loans.name: Kiprono

texts.en:
Kiprono is a dairy farmer in the town of Litein in Kenya's Rift Valley. He has been practicing mixed farming for three years and sells his milk through Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He also earns income from small-scale farming of tea, which he sells locally.

He has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to upgrade his dairy farming by constructing a zero-grazing unit, or animal pen,and buying a chaff cutter that will allow him to cut up animal feed. He hopes that his dairy farming will improve in future. His biggest challenge is lack of capital for expansion.

Kiprono is 25 years old and single.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter and construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 57-year-old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  poultry and dry goods (fashion earrings). 

She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her poultry and dry goods (fashion earrings) businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000.

Aida is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Aida aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Benkan (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Benkan est un regroupement de femmes  du quartier N’Tonasso de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes : oignons, tomate, épices, des choux,  poivron, carottes, haricot vert, radis etc, à l’image de Kadiatou Sangaré. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et  le prêt précédent  a été bien remboursé. .  
Kadiatou compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs d’oignon, de choux des paniers de tomate et beaucoup d’épices. Elle se procure  de ces condiments dans les différents villages auprès des jardiniers. Elle  les revend  en détail et au comptant au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Benkan comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Kadiatou Sangaré compte réaliser 120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkan is a group of women from the N’Tonasso district of Koutiala City. They know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and parents. The women of the group average 40 years of age and are married mothers of at least five children. This group of women essentially does commerce in all sorts of condiments: onions, tomatoes, spices, cabbage, peppers, carrots, green beans, radishes, etc., as does Ms. Kadiatou Sangaré. 

To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. They are now on their second group loan. The preceding one has been repaid. 

Kadiatou intends to use her loan to buy sacks of onions and cabbages, baskets of tomatoes, and many spices. She acquires these condiments in the various villages from gardeners. Accepting cash, she sells them retail to a diverse and varied customer base at the main market of Koutiala. 

While the other group members plan on making an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA in the course of the loan cycle, Kadiatou plans on making 120,000 francs. In addition to repaying the loan, the group members will use a portion of the revenues for coping with typical family expenses.

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es:
El Señor Abrahan O. R., es una persona de 20 años de edad de estado civil soltero, pero vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en casa de sus padres y tiene un pequeño hijo. La actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, produce anualmente papa, oca y haba el cual los comercializa en la feria semanal de la población de Tíraque que esta distante aproximadamente a unos 67 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

En la actividad agrícola trabaja junto a su esposa, la siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en parcelas heredadas de sus padres, pero en la actualidad producto de sus ganancias pudieron adquirir 2 parcelas cultivables y para tal efecto necesitan capital de inversión para comprar mayor cantidad de semilla de papa y de tal forma poder incrementar su producción de este producto y obtener mayores ingresos económicos mejorando de esta manera sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Abrahan O. R. is a 20-year old man who is not married but he lives with someone. He finished primary school and he lives with his parents. He has a young son. His principal activity is agriculture, producing potato, okra, and fava beans every year. He sells his products at the weekly fair in the community of Tiraque, which is approximately 67 km from the city of Cochabamba.

His wife helps him with his agriculture business. He cultivates his plantations on parcels of land inherited to him by his parents but as a product of their earnings they have managed to acquire 2 more lots. For this reason they need to invest capital funds in order to increase production of their products and to obtain a greater income and so to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds to plant

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra B. es una mujer D. 30 años, que vive en el barrio Santo Domingo con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades D. 10 y 4 años ; elL. por iniciativa propia decidió aumentar sus ingresos familiares, comprando mercancía  como ropa femenina y vendiendo a unos cuantos clientes, su sueño por fortalecer su negocio L. llevó a persistir constantemente y a trabajar para ampliarlo, así fue como empezó a conseguir nuevos clientes y ahora no solo venD. ropa sino también calzado en mayor cantidad y toda mercancía que solicitan sus buenos y rentables clientes.  Su meta y gran desafío es tener un punto D. ventas muy concurrido con gran variedad D. productos para ofrecer, para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con su respuesta oportuna. Su gran desafío es tener una casa propia a L. que pueda adicionar un local donD. adecuar su negocio. Así mientras desarrolL. su sueño,  maneja unas cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 15 días, un margen D.  utilidad no menor D. 40% y  continúa ordenando su desempeño, para cumplir mas adelante sus propósitos. En L. actualidad acuD. a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para acceder a un credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, cosméticos sobre pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, lo cual garantiza que su inversión sea exitosa.
texts.en: Sandra B. is a 30 year-old woman who lives in the Santo Domingo neighborhood with her husband and their 2 children, aged 10 and 4.  She decided on her own initiative to start a business so she could increase the household income, buying merchandise such as women's clothing, and selling it to a small number of customers.  Her dream to strengthen her business led her to persist and work constantly to expand it.  In this way she started to attract new customers and now, not only does she sell clothing, but she also sell shoes, and she sells in large quantities, satisfying the demand of all of her good and profitable customers.  Her goal and great challenge is to have a busy point of sales where she could offer a large variety of products, so that she could respond to the needs of her customers in a timely manner.  Her greatest goal is to have her own home where she could also have space for her business.  While she works toward that dream, she manages accounts receivable that rotate every 15 days, and a profit margin no less than 40 percent.  She will continue to drive the performance of her business so that in the future she can accomplish her goals.  Now she has come to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva loan that she will use to purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. With these products she can fill outstanding orders from her customers, which will ensure that her investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics to fill her customer's orders

loans.name: San Benito Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Benito esta en el sexto ciclo en FINCA Perú. Los miembros se dedican a vender aguas gaseosas, abarrotes, tienen recreos, y venD. comidas preparadas. 
Silvia, es L. presidenta del Banco. ElL. tiene 43 años y es casada con 4 hijos D. (27,23,21,11 D. edad).
Tiene un restaurante.
Solicita un crédito D. S/. 2500.00 Nuevos Soles.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra D. abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, verduras, carnes, entre otros para L. preparación D. alimentos.
Silvia tiene un restaurante en L. Av. Del Ejercito. AtienD. todos los días desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Tambien da pensión, extras y compromisos.
Está en FINCA Perú hace 6 ciclos, le gusta por L. facilidad en los créditos y pueD. ahorrar. Con sus ahorros compró puertas y ventanas para su casa e implementó su negocio.         
Está ahorrando para poder comprarse un exhibidor para mostrar sus tortas, gelatinas y helados. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que siga prosperando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "San Benito" communal bank is in its sixth term with FINCA Perú.  The members sell sodas, groceries, prepared meals and recreation services.

Silvia is the president of the bank.  She is 43 years old and has 4 children (ages 27, 23, 21 and 11).  She runs a restaurant and is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN which she plans to use to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, vegetables, meat and other food items to prepare meals.

Her restaurant is located in "Ejército" Avenue where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She also has a catering service.  This is her sixth loan through FINCA Perú and she likes it because of the good credit terms and the fact that she can save money.  With her savings she was able to buy doors and windows for her house and start her business.  She is saving to buy a display case to exhibit her cakes, gelatins and ice creams.  Her dreams is that her children become professionals and that her business be more and more successful.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, vegetables, meat and other food items

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Betty has furniture business that makes beds, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more timber for making beds for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Betty hopes to expand her business.    

Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for making beds for resale.

loans.name: Renato

texts.es: Renato, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, tiene 41 años, convive con María de 37 años de edad y fruto de esa relación concibieron 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarle un mejor porvenir. Renato es albañil, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño, con el transcurso del tiempo se hizo maestro de obras hoy construye grandes obras como: viviendas, puentes, escuelas y alcantarillas, es conocedor de la construcción y edificación, agarra obras en contratas,  donde realiza obras por periodos largos; en su labor cuenta con el apoyo de operarios, oficiales y peones cada quien divididos en sus propios rangos. Se siente muy a gusto con su labor porque cada vez va adquiriendo experiencias nuevas por estar en contacto con los ingenieros civiles. Su mayor incomodidad es la variación de los planos ya que los profesionales lo reforman casi constantemente así incomodándole con el avance de la ejecución de la obra. Cuenta que su trabajo le es muy rentable. Acude a MFP para facilitarle el préstamo y llevar a cabo su propósito de refaccionar la fachada de su vivienda. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo y obteniendo buenos ingresos y así adquirir muchos bienes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho con el propósito de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución por facilitarle el préstamo. Los 1,500 nuevos soles, le servirá  como implemento de compra para la adquisición de materiales de construcción y así refaccionar la fachada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Renato is from the city of Quimbiri.  He’s 41 years old and lives with María, 37.  They have three children for whom he wants to provide a better future.  Renato is a bricklayer.  His parents taught him this occupation when he was still a little boy.  In time, he became a master builder and today builds large projects like: homes, bridges, schools and drainage systems.  He is knowledgeable in construction and building.  He takes on construction contracts for long-term projects.  His work is supported by operators, officials and laborers, each divided into proper ranks.  He feels very happy with his work because he gains new experiences each time being in contact with the civil engineers.  His greatest discomfort is the variation in plans because the professionals change them almost constantly thus delaying his project’s advance.  He says that his work is quite profitable.

He calls on MFP to request a loan to complete his house’s façade.  The plan he has in mind is to continue growing and obtaining good income in order to acquire many assets.

This is his first loan with MFP and he knows that the money from the loan will help him a lot with his work purpose.  He is grateful to the institution for facilitating the loan.  He will use the 1500 new soles to buy building materials and supplies to refurbish the façade of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to finish his house's façade.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Nuon, who has been working in this sector since 2000. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they generate an income of around US $3 per day. This humble couple have four children, one of whom is working in manufacturing as a sewing worker and earns a fixed salary every month. 

Mrs. Nuon would like to apply for a loan to buy two cows to support her in the field.

loans.use: to buy two cows to support her in the field.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fishmonger at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is divorced and has two children. Her income is used to see to the up-keep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to plough back into her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a goat-meat selling business, selling wholesale to butcher-shop operators. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase goat meat for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goat meat for sale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Married to a weaver, Sok, a farmer and a fisherman, lives with his wife in a village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Because Sok also knows how to weave, he helps his wife in her business when he is free (as shown in the photo). He is now requesting a loan of $250 to continue his farming business by paying for plowing fees and fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and fertilizer.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells kenkey at Abura. She is in this picture showing the maize she uses for the kenkey. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a teacher. Araba has been selling kenkey for three years. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her capital to buy more bags of corn to make the kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: Her loan will be added to her capital to buy more bags of corn to make the kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elizabeth, vive con su esposo, se dedica a la venta de ropa y atiende al mismo tiempo una sala de belleza, estos negocios los tiene instalados  frente al mercado municipal, tiene un horario de 8:00am a 4:30 pm. 
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el inventario de mercadería, ya que con variedad en las prendas de vestir va a generar más ventas.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, tener a disposición de los clientes toda la mercadería posible, para mantener la clientela y su preferencia, así también en su vida familiar quiere ser madre en el corto plazo y finalizar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her husband. She sells clothing and manages a beauty salon at the same time. These businesses are located at the front of the municipal market. Her work schedule is from 8am to 4:30pm.

At the moment, Elizabeth needs a loan to buy new clothing. This investment will help improve her inventory of merchandise. By having a variety of clothes to offer, she will be able to generate more sales.

Her goals are to improve her business and to make all types of merchandise available to her customers so that she can maintain their loyalty and satisfy their preferences. In her family life, Elizabeth wants to focus on being a mother and in the short term finish her professional degree.

loans.use: to buy new blouses, skirts, shorts, and trousers to sell in her business.

loans.name: Enhbaayar

texts.en:
Enhbaayar is 27 years old and lives with his wife and a son in a ger, a Mongolian felt tent, in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His son will attend kindergarten this fall and his wife is an accountant at Baylag Hurah LLC. Enhbaayar started a transportation service in 2005. After saving his profits, he purchased a car in 2010 and became a taxi driver. Now, he runs a public transportation service in his local town. Enhbaayar is well-balanced in terms of providing income to his family and supporting his business. He is a hardworking, diligent, and honest man who says, "After I received my driver's license, I was in the public transportation business. Now my wife is pregnant and I cannot go far away from home for longer time. That is why I bought this small car. I fix this car by myself.”

Enhbaayar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car engine and other spare parts to maintain and repair his car.

loans.use: to purchase a car engine and spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow gladiola flowers and corn.

loans.name: Badam

texts.en: Badam is 60 years old and lives alone in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Hovd province.  Although she is over 60, her health is in good condition. She used to live with her disabled son who is now living with his brothers in Ulaanbaatar City.  She started her business in 2006 by selling flour and dried yogurt in Han-ord local market.  She was selling them from a mobile cart.  Now she rents a commercial space at the Ih Buyan market.  Her business income is enough to cover all costs.  She plans to keep running this business.  She is a hard working woman who says, "The increasing price of gasoline is bringing up the prices of other goods.  But, I will continue to do my business."  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more flour and other product for her business.

loans.use: to buy more flour and other products for her business.

loans.name: Rona Lorraine

texts.en:
Rona Lorraine is 30 years old, a resident of San Fabian Echague. She is single and a business-minded person. She sells rice and groceries such as coffee, shampoo, detergent soap, junk food, hand and body lotion, perfumes and oil. Her business is located at a public market in Echague. She has had this kind of business for eight years and with this business alone she is able to earn about P20,000 a month. 

Rona Lorraine would like to become a successful entrepreneur someday. For this reason, she would like to buy stock of rice for her stall but her funds are not enough. So, she is requesting a loan amounting to P50,000. She truly believes that she will be able to increase her sales and income in this manner. In this regard, she could improve her quality of life and her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for her stall at the market.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Miguel Angel; el tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de zapatos, el socio vende zapatos para mujeres, varones y niños, el socio trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de zapatos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "BANCO DEL DESARROLLO" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Miguel Angel is 33 and single.  Her alternates his daily activities with his business selling shoes.  He sells women's, men's and children's shoes and works from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  Through his business he has been able to support his children, and wants to expand and improve the activity.  He is requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Por El Progreso 3 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Manuel es uno de los miembros del Grupo Mujeres luchando por el progreso 3 & 4, localizado en la ciudad de Santiago, la segunda más grande del país en población y actividades económicas, gracias a esto sus habitantes tienen muchos acceso al mercado al por mayor, también por la cercanía al mercado fronterizo con Haití, donde muchos de nuestros clientes y miembros de este grupo compran sus productos.

Manuel ofrece ventas miscelaneas de diferentes productos, como papeles de baños, zapatos y zapatillas, etc. Es padre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos viven con El y su esposa. Manuel nos dijo que uno de sus retos mas difíciles es poder tener un negocio exitoso, para así de esa manera poder proveer y suplir las necesidades que enfrentan.  En sus tiempo libre le encanta leer la Biblia.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Manuel, el cual invertirá para ampliar su inventario, El compra los papeles de baño al por mayor y los vende al detalle, también compra sus calzados en la frontera con Haití, a muy buen precio y de buena calidad. 

Unos de sus sueños es poder construir otra vivienda y poder alquilarla, así puede generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel is one of the members of the women's group Fighting for Progress 3 &4, located in the city of Santiago. It is the second largest in the country in population and economic activity. Thanks to this, its residents have a lot of access to wholesale markets. This is also due to its proximity to the border markets with Haiti, where a lot of our clients and members of the group buy their products. 

Manuel sells different products such as toilet paper, shoes and slippers, etc. He is a father of 3 children, 2 of whom live with him and his wife. Manuel told us that one of his biggest challenges is being able to have a successful business and in this way provide and meet the needs he faces. In his free time, he likes to read the bible. 

This is Manuel's second loan. He will invest it in increasing his inventory. He buys the bathroom products wholesale and sells them retail. He also buys his shoes at the Haitian border at a good price and quality. 

One of his dreams is to be able to build another house and rent it out, in order to make more income.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, and shoes, among other products.

loans.name: Olin

texts.es: Olin de 22 años de edad, es un joven padre que convive con Yeny de 19 años. Ambos tienen un hijo de 1 año. Olin aún vive solo en Pumpuriani, en una casa propia. Olin, sonriente y alegre cuenta que desde muy niño se inició en la agricultura con la siembra de maíz, plátanos, yuca y café, siendo éste último el que sustenta a la familia y le brinda algunos y escasos gustos.  Así también, Olin trabaja como obrero en obras como construcción y reparación de carreteras, cuyos contratos son por 3 meses, del mismo modo se desenvuelve como operario en parcelas ajenas. “Al inicio desconocía sobre la alza y baja del precio del café, por ejemplo en octubre siempre baja, a 5 y a 6 soles el kilo, en cambio en abril sube a 10, 11 y 12 soles”, describe como uno de los principales inconvenientes que tuvo que superar con el tiempo. Más adelante a él le gustaría casarse con Yeny y tomar las riendas de su familia, para ello debe establecer e implementar su hogar para recibirlos. De esa manera las familias de ambos se sentirán a gusto con la unión. Gracias a su ayuda, Olin podrá obtener su préstamo número 6 de MFP, con ello él podrá empezar a concretizar sus proyectos.  Olin está satisfecho con su banco comunal, siente que en grupo se puede llegar más rápido a las metas. Con el dinero, Olin podrá colocar café entre las plantaciones de plátanos. Así comprará las plantas y los 10 sacos de abono necesario, y si sobra pagará a los peones que apoyarán en el proyecto.
texts.en:
Olin is 22 and a young father. His girlfriend is Yeny, who is 19.  Together, they have a one-year-old son.  Olin still lives alone in Pumpuriani, in his own home.  Olin was smiling and happy when he told us that he started working in agriculture when he was very young by growing corn, plantains, yucca, and coffee.  Coffee was what supported his family and offered them limited luxuries.  Olin also works some in construction and repairing highways.  His contracts for this work are for 3 months at a time.  He works operating equipment on other pieces of land.  "At first, I was unfamiliar with the rise and fall of coffee prices, for example, in October, it always lowers, to between 5 and 6 soles per kilo.  But in April in climbs to 10, 11, or 12 soles."  He describes one of the biggest inconveniences of this work as having to face the weather conditions.

In the future, he would like to marry Yeny and take the reins of his family.  To do that, he should establish and fix up his home to receive them.  In this way, both of their families will feel comfortable with their marriage.  Thanks to your help, Olin will be able to obtain his sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  With it, he will start to fulfill his projects.  Olin is satisfied with his communal bank.  He feels that he can reach his goals more quickly as part of a group.  With this money, Olin will be able to plan coffee between his plots of plantains.  He will buy coffee plants and 10 sacks of the necessary fertilizer.  If he has enough left, he will pay workers to help him with this project.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and 10 sacks of fertilizer, and to hire temporary workers.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen is 69 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh. She has four children. They are all married. Mrs Sen has a general store. She sells groceries. She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 5.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid the loan punctually. This is the 5th time she is borrowing money from SEDA. This time, she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to expand her store (buy more groceries like candy, cakes, sugar, beer)

loans.use: to expand her store (buy more groceries like candy, cakes, sugar, beer)

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria, age 56, lives in the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela with her husband and five children. Some of her children already have their own families.

To make a living, Gregoria owns and operates a farming business. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP every crop season. She also sells vegetables in the local community for additional income. She needs both sources of income in order to sustain her family's daily needs.

Right now she would like to request a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP in order to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizer for her farm production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizer for her farm production

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 26 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, drinks, snack foods, etc. 

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like  shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 8 children, but only 3 children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Ruth sells charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for 4 years. She works 6 days a week. She has requested for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her charcoal business into wholesale. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Zarina Begum's Group

texts.en:
A 57-year-old lady, Zarina begum lives with her family: a husband and four children (two sons and two daughters). Her eldest daughter is 35 years-old and the youngest is 25 years-old.  Her eldest son is 27 years-old and her youngest son is 24 years-old. 

Her husband has a stable job. 

Zarina is a caring lady. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities.   

All of her children are involved in different work and work to financially contribute to the family. Her elder daughter does sewing. Her work is home based. Her younger daughter works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her eldest son runs a grocery store in the community market while his younger brother works in a factory for a monthly wage. 

With this loan, her son will purchase groceries in bulk to be able to stock his store.  He has been operating his business for past many years. His experience and good dealing will help him increase his sales and profits. 

Zarina is very confident about the future expansion of her sons’ business after the loan investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zarina begum”.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Monsieur Bassirou habite au Sénégal  et est âgé de 35 ans. C’est un père de famille qui a  2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 7 ans. Il évolue  dans le secteur de la pêche  depuis plus de 15 ans. Il a choisi cette activité par amour. Etant issu d’une famille de pêcheur  il pratique cette activité depuis le bas âge. Ce qui l’y intéresse  c’est la capture de poissons et les revenus qui lui sont procurés. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2006. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de sa pirogue en cette période de repos des pêcheurs  a cause de la marée haute. Son souhait est d’améliorer ses revenus  et le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Bassirou lives in Senegal and is 35 years old.  He is a family man, with two children, 5 and 7 years old.  He has been working in the fishing industry for more than 15 years.  He has chosen this activity because he loves it.  Being from a family of fishermen, Bassirou has been fishing from a very early age.  He particularly likes catching fish and generating revenues from this activity.  He has been a member of the local UIMCEC branch since February 2006.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 CFA francs to repair his boat during this period of high tide which is a rest period for fishermen.  Bassirou wishes to increase his income and to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To repair his fishing boat.

loans.name: Atambula Empola Zakaliya Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Moses has been a retail trader for the last five years. The father of five plies his trade in Kayunga. He deals principally in general merchandise retail commodities such as sugar, salt, plastics, rice, beans, etc. On the side, too, he practices farming. Week In, week out, he says his sales revenue equals to UGX 150,000.

Moses says he intends to use his loan money to purchase more goods: sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, and maize flour to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more goods: sugar, cooking oil, rice, beans, and maize flour to resell.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LA GLOIRE DE DIEU  est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont dans un même secteur d’activité et qui se connaissent dans de petites associations. Émilienne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans est mariée à un certain Maurice. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Émilienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Émilienne et son mari. Émilienne a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Émilienne collette des bouteilles vides qu’elle revend depuis une douzaine d’année.  Émilienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Émilienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA GLOIRE DE DIEU un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des bouteilles vides.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old and supports a family of three members. She has been a small-scale farmer for the last five years, earning an income of KES 8,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve her farming activity by adopting modern farming technology and to raise more income to improve family living standards. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her farming activity. Her future hope is to lead a better life.

loans.use: to improve her farming activity by adopting modern farming technology and to raise more income to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Assana

texts.en:
Young and dynamic, Miss Assana F. is quite a good cook, practically a chef! She learned from her mother, who was a catering professional. She is single and has no children but is also the guardian of her two young brothers, who are in school. She has an eatery open during lunch where she sells pasta, rice with various sauces, salad, and other dishes. With the encouragement of her customers, Miss F. wants to expand her business into the evening thus transforming her little eatery into a pub. People could go there to eat even late at night. She has saved a little, but it is not enough to make the changes needed. So she is asking for a loan of $850 to buy kitchen utensils, foodstuffs, and other necessities in order to grow her business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Jeune et dynamique, Mademoiselle F. Assana est un véritable cordon bleu. Elle tient ce don de sa mère qui elle-même est revendeuse de nourritures. Elle est célibataire sans enfant, mais elle a à sa charge ses deux (02) jeunes frères élèves. Elle tient un petit restaurant du jour où elle vend de la pâte, du riz accompagnés de sauces, de la salade et d’autres mets. Avec les encouragements de ses clients, Mlle F. Assana, cherche aujourd’hui à étendre son commerce jusqu’au soir de façon à transformer son Mini Restaurant en cantine où même tard dans la nuit, l’on puisse aller manger. Elle dispose d’un peu d’économie mais cela ne suffirait par pour cette transformation. Elle sollicite alors, un crédit de $850 pour acheter les ustensiles de cuisine et les vivres en vue d’accroître ses activités.

loans.use: to buy utensils and foodstuff

loans.name: Margeret

texts.en: Sister Maggie (as she is popularly called) deals in plastic household items. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and requires a loan of $675 to expand her business. She knows about the TEACH Lending program and has practical experience in record-keeping.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.en:
I have run a small food stand for four years. It helps feed my children and allow them to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Yo tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de comida, este negocio lo tengo hace 4 años con el cual ayudo a mis hijos para que terminen sus estudios y su alimentacion diaria.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, rice, beans and drinks

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristine C. is 35 years old and is married to Roberto Bordon, 52. They live in their own home. Cristina is an enterprising woman. With some savings she was able to open a business in her house. She sells aromatic candles, incense, natural remedies and various other articles. Thanks to the excellent location of her home, she has made good progress in her business and her earnings. She is able to help her husband with the household expenses and the costs of her son's university studies; he is studying at a private university in the capital at considerable expense to the family.

To continue her good progress, Cristina would like to buy a wider variety of merchandise. She would like to receive a loan of $500 which she will invest in the purchase of the additional items at wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Cristina C. tiene 35 años de edad está casada con. Roberto Bordón de 52 años, y viven en una casa propia. Cristina es una mujer emprendedora, con unos ahorros pudo abrir un negocio en su casa donde se dedica a la venta de velas aromáticas, inciensos, remedios naturales y artículos varios; gracias a la buena ubicación de su local, ella ha podido ir progresando y con sus ganancias puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de su hijo que vive en la capital pues está estudiando en una Universidad privada que le demanda muchos gastos.

Para seguir progresando ella desea adquirir mayor variedad de mercaderías, por lo que desea adquirir un préstamo de $ 500 que los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor.

loans.use: Buy aromatic candles, handcrafted items, incense, candle holders and aromatic oils

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
Sra. Silvina, 51, is a single mother with 1 son. She owns a home-based business making headwear; she also displays and sells the products that she makes in her house. Her main customers are tourists, the faithful who flock to the Virgen de Caacupe--the image of the Virgin at the Basilica de Caacupe that is one of the main attractions of that city--every year, along with passing motorists. Silvina works with her mother and son and the three of them pull together to meet their monthly sales goals. Silvina's mother is in charge of making the headwear; her son sells their products at local festivals in Cordillera--the department in south-central Paraguay where Caacupe is located; and Silvina sells from the shop in her house.

Her main achievement--that is, to say, what has allowed her to buy her own home--has been to broaden the range of merchandise she sells which, in turn, has allowed her to increase sales. She said that starting the business was very difficult because she had to meet government regulations for starting a business at the same time that she was being mother and father to her son. Nevertheless, she has managed through perseverance to get ahead and now she's even planning to expand her business, renovating a small shop near the Basilica de Caacupe, for which she's looking to the Fundacion Paraguay to help her raise enough money to finish.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Silvina 51 años, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, su taller de confección está ubicado en su mismo domicilio dónde también tiene su salón de exposición y venta de sus artículos, sus principales clientes son los turistas, los fieles que visitan a la Virgen de Caacupé cada año (la imagen de la virgen se encuentra en la Basílica de Caacupé y es una de las principales atracciones de la ciudad) y los automovilistas que pasan frente a su negocio. Actualmente Silvina, trabaja con su mamá y su hijo, los tres se ayudan mutuamente para lograr sus objetivos de ventas mensuales, la encargada de confeccionar los kepis y sombreros es la madre de Silvina, su hijo sale a vender sus productos en las fiestas patronales de las principales ciudades del departamento de la Cordillera, mientras que Silvina los vende en su local.

Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haberse comprado una casa propia, y aumentado el volumen de sus mercaderías en el negocio, lo cual le permitió aumentar sus ventas. Comenta que en sus inicios fue muy difícil ya que ella tenía que cumplir el papel de comerciante, de madre y padre para su hijo, no obstante con perseverancia logró salir adelante y hoy día está pensando inclusive ampliar su negocio habilitando una pequeña sucursal cerca de la Basílica de Caacupé, por lo cual está pensando en la nuevamente en la Fundación Paraguaya para poder tener el capital que le permita cumplir con su proyecto.

loans.use: Buy materials, threads, etc. for a headwear business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a wider assortment of phone accessories.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: I am Shahnaz B. from the small town of Raiwind, Pakistan. I sew clothes for my neighborhood clients, and my husband works at a government institution for small pay, which is insufficient for our family. Therefore, my husband sells milk to increase his income. I am a mother of eight: four girls and four boys.  All of my children attend school except the youngest three who are not school age yet. My husband feels that we should raise our living standard, and hence expand our milk business. Please lend us $175 to buy an additional cow for the business.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Sitsofe

texts.fr:
Ms. Sitsofe D. is single and has two children, one in high school and one in middle school. She is 35 and has been selling fruits and vegetables for over five years. Ms. D. is able to pay her children's school fees and the family's other expenses with the profit she earns from her business. Thanks to her good management skills, she was recently able to open a sales stand for her younger sister. With this loan, she would like to expand her business and increase her sales.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Sitsofe D. est célibataire avec 02 enfants dont le prmier est en classe de troisième et le second en classe de sixième. Elle est âgée de 35 ans et exerce ce metier depuis plus de 5 ans. Madame Sitsofe subvient aux charges scolaires de ses enfants et aux autres charges de la famille avec les profits qu'elle tire de son activité. Grâce à sa bonne gestion, elle vient tout récemment d'ouvrir un point de vente pour sa petite soeur. Elle souhaite par ce crédit améliorer la capacité de son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 trays of eggs, 5 boxes of potatoes, 3 baskets of cabbage and 2 baskets of lettuce

loans.name: Houl

texts.en:
Mrs. Houl K., 44, is a duck seller in the Cher Chroy part of Kompong Cham province in Cambodia. Each day she earns approximately six dollars in profit. Her husband, Mr. Choun Lay, 47, sells deep fried ducks in the market earning five dollars a day. They have two children. Their daughter sells ducks in the market with Mrs. K. and their son is a student.

The couple hopes to use part of this loan to expand their current business by purchasing ducks in larger quantity to resell at the market. The balance of the money will be used to buy pigs to breed and sell when they are grown.

loans.use: To purchase ducks for resale at local markets.

loans.name: Fatuma's Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 39 years old and is married woman with 6 children, ages 24,22,18,15,8 and 6 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 23,22 and 19 years old. Fatuma sales bites and water from well, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 8.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Fatuma has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy other tapes for a well.. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Zainabu and Zuhura.

loans.use: To buy new tape for her well.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet I. sells drinks, foodstuffs and provisions. She lives in Okoko Lagos State Nigeria. She is 30 years of age with 4 children and has been a member of LAPO for three years. Juliet has been in her business since 2002 and  is soliciting a loan of  $1200 to enable her buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.name: Haydee's Group

texts.es:
Angélica and Hayde belong to the Bonanza Communal Bank.

Angélica, 51 years old, is a single mother with one child. She sells cereals at the “12 de Abril” market. During the holiday season, she also bakes breads and makes typical jams.

Hayde is a 59 years old widower with two children. She sells second hand clothes at the different regional fairs.

Angélica and Hayde need loans for 800 and 200 soles, respectively, which they will invest in the purchase of barley, wheat, garbanzo beans, lentils, and second hand clothes.

The dreams of Angélica and Hayde are to see their children become professionals, to own a house in the city’s downtown and to have their own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica y Hayde pertenecen al Banco Comunal Bonanza.

Angélica es madre soltera, tiene 51 años y un hijo. Angélica vende cereales en el mercado 12 de abril, y además elabora panes y dulces típicos de la zona, actividad que realiza solo en época de fiestas.

Mientras que Haydee es viuda, tiene 59 años y dos hijos. Haydee vende ropa usada en las diferentes ferias de la región.

Angélica y Hayde necesitan préstamos de 800 y 200 soles, respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, trigo, garbanzo y lenteja, y ropa usada.

Los sueños de Angélica y Haydee son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una casa en el centro de la ciudad y capital propio.

loans.use: Purchase of barley, wheat, garbanzo beans, lentils, and second hand clothes.

loans.name: Freddy Salvador

texts.es:
Fredy O. is a gentleman from the municipality of San Rafael del Sur and owns a carpentry business, which he runs from his home where his clients visit him. He specializes in woodwork, and has created a name for himself by making different kinds of fine furniture as well as any other type of wooden items requested by his clients.

He has been carrying out this activity with the sole purpose of subsisting and maintaining his family which consists of his wife and two children, whom he must support. Currently, he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase lumber as the prime material for his business. It is necessary to point out that to date, he has received a total of four loans, all of which have been repaid in timely fashion and in the manner established by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Fredy O. es un caballero del municipio de San Rafael del Sur el cual se dedica al negocio de la carpintería el cual atiende en su propia casa de habitación a sus clientes que le visitan. Él es especialista en el trabajo con la madera y se ha destacado por hacer diferentes tipos de muebles finos y además cualquier otro tipo de artículo de madera solicitado por el cliente.

Se ha desempeñado a esta labor con el único fin de subsistir y además de mantener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos a los que tiene el deber de mantener. Actualmente solicita crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de la madera como materia prima para el negocio. Es necesario destacar que hasta hoy posee un total de cuatro créditos todos pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido con la institución.

loans.use: Purchase lumber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia is 37 years old, and couldn’t finish high school, she speaks Aymara and Spanish, is married and has 5 children, 3 of them are in high school, one is on elementary school and the youngest is still a baby. She lives on the neighborhood of Progreso Jr. Manco Capac s/n, in the village of Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao.

She works preparing and selling bread, and takes her products every day to the market, and works on this activity for the last 17 years.

She belongs to the community bank “Lago Azul” where she started with a loan of S/. 300.00 new soles that she invested on buying a sack of flour and a ball of yeast.

With the loan of S/. 1,700.00 new soles, that will be paid in 3 months, she will buy 3 sacks of flour, a ball of yeast, a sack of sugar and ten bags of salt and firewood.

She is very thankful with the loan she received because it increased her income and learned to be responsible and punctual with her payments.

Her greatest wish is that her kids one day could be professionals and work. She would like to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el cuarto de secundaria, habla el aymará y castellano, es casada tiene cinco hijos, tres estudian en el Colegio, uno en la escuela y un bebe, ella vive en el Barrio progreso Jr. Manco Cápac s/n, en Villa Chipana Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, llevando sus productos todos los días a Ilave se dedica a esta actividad hace 17 años. Pertenece al banco Comunal “Lago Azul” donde inició con un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de un saco de harina y una bola de levadura. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 3 meses, compró tres sacos de harina, una bolsa de levadura, un saco de azúcar, diez bolsitas de sal y leña. Esta muy agradecida con el crédito recibido porque mejoró sus ingresos económicos y aprendió a ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. El gran anhelo que tiene, es que sus hijos sean profesionales y trabajen. A ella le gustaría continuar con el negocio.

loans.use: To buy at wholesale prices flour, yeast and other products. / Compra al por mayor de harina, levadura y otros insumos.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay L., 56, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has had a business selling rice and noodles in the village since 2005, earning around US$ 12 each day. Her husband, Nuon Srouy, 61, is a motor-taxi driver, making around US$ 4 in profit each day. Four of their children are married and no longer live at home and the last child is a student.

Lay L. would like to borrow from Kiva to invest in her business; any remainder of her loan will be used to purchase wood to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs so as to increase rice and noodles customers and repair their house.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 25 years old and married with two children, aged seven and five years old. Since 2005, Rukia has been selling shoes and khanga (traditional East African cloth worn by women). She works daily from 5am to 4pm and earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rukia is requesting a loan to buy more shoes and khanga cloth to sell and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and khanga for her business.

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Mrs. Va S. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small plot of land where she can cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Yron Yeth, is a teacher and cow breeder. Because the second business is going well, he wants to expand it; so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy two more cows. Mrs. Va S. is 34 years old and the mother of three children. Two of the children are attending the local school, while the youngest one is two years old, too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for breeding

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 58 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Riguero, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 21 y 25 años de edad,  que trabajan, don Carlos vende ropa y productos de plásticos, desde haces cinco años, el inicio con la liquidación de un trabajo que tenia anterior, con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en ropa de damas y caballero ya que los pedidos son mucho y desea aprovechar a sus clientes como la temporada. A futuro es poner un taller de costura y incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old and he lives in a neighbourhood within the capital city of Managua called Riguero. His wife has given him two children, aged 21 and 25 years of age, and they are both working. Carlos sells clothing and plastic products and he has been doing so for the past 5 years. He started out when he was layed off from the work he had before. With the loan he is requesting he will invest in the purchase of clothing for ladies and gentlemen, especially because he has many orders already placed. He wants to take advantage of the clientele that comes with the season. In the future he hopes to set up a tailoring shop and increase his sales.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ladies' and gentlemens' clothing.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan was born in 1980. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Dilagarda village. He is married with 2 children. This man has been in the taxi business for 5 years. Now, he needs a loan to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received no formal education. Mary sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, Milo, milk and others at Elmina, which she has done since early this year. Her husband is a pensioner. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Mary will use the loan as  additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save toward extending the house to meet the needs of a large family.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim U., 53, lives in Siem Reap Province where he has owned a plot of land since 1979. He grows rice and has two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons.  He is married and has three children.  One child is single and two are married.  One of his children is working in Thailand as a construction worker.

His wife, Nhem Sar, 54, works with him in the farming business and this is their main source of income.  Because the dry season is coming, Sim U. needs a loan of US$500 to pay to have his farmland plowed.  The loan will help to increase the farm's income and sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay to have his farmland plowed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca F. D. M. se dedica a la venta D. chompas en un pequeño puesto que tiene en el centro D. la ciudad, está casada con el señor Miltón M. que es garzón, tienen tres hijos D. los cuales uno sigue a su cargo. El resto son mayores e independientes.
La señora M. comenzó con un pequeño capital y ahora tiene un puesto fijo, con mucho sacrificio pagó los estudios D. sus hijos los cuales ahora son profesionales y ayudan con los gastos familiares. Ella espera que con el tiempo y con su trabajo mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, por ahora viven humildemente en un hogar feliz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca F. D. M. earns her living selling sweaters in a small stall in the center of the city. She's married to Mr. Miltón M., who is a waiter. They have three children, one of whom is still dependent. The others are older and independent. Mrs. M. started out with a small amount of capital and now has a permanent stall. Through great sacrifice she paid for her children's schooling, and now they're professionals and help out with the household expenses. She hopes that over time she can work to raise her family's standard of living; for the time being they live modestly in a happy home.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es: Doña Ligia tiene la edad de 40 años, reside en laureles sur, tiene dos hijos que estudian la primaria, su esposo trabaja junto con ella enana pulpería que tiene desde hace seis años que inicio con una liquidación de la empresa donde laboraba en la zona franca anteriormente. Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para que sea rentable y poder organizarse con su familia ya que su objetivo es poder terminar de construir su casa, a que a sus hijos reciban una buena educación. Afodenic le ha brindado la oportunidad para aumentar el inventario es por eso que da las gracias por las mejoras que ha hecho en su vida personal como en la inversión de su negocio esta es la sexta solicitud que va invertir en comprar productos variados como: productos enlatados, carnes, golosinas entre otros que cubra la necesidad y alimentación de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Ligia is 40 years old and resides in Laureles Sur. She has two children who are in elementary school. Her husband works with her in a small local store which they have had for six years, since it began with a liquidation of the business in the duty-free zone where she worked previously. Their plans are to continue investing in their business so that it will be profitable and they will be able to organize their family. Their objective is to be able to finish the construction of their house and for their children to receive a good education. Afodenic, an affiliate of Kiva, has offered them the opportunity to enlarge their business inventory. This is their sixth request, and will be invested in buying various products like canned products, meats, and delicacies, among other things, that will cover the needs and diet of their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned products, delicacies, and beef.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband Ruben is a jeepney driver (a jeepney is a four-wheel type of jeep). Their children are Joan, who is 17 years old and a second-year college student; Lea, who is 14 years old and a third-year high school; and Angelica, who is 6 years old and in grade one. They are currently living in a harmonious relationship in baranggay San Juan, in Alicia, Isabela.

Marissa's husband operates their jeepney from their village to the town proper. Sometimes their jeepney is used as a service, especially during harvest season--it brings their harvest from their farm to their house. Some farmers also rent their jeep during harvest season.

In addition to operating their jeepney, Marissa wants to start a small village store for additional income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to pursue her plan. This is also her way of assisting her husband to meet the growing needs of their family. She is glad that they also have their farm as a source of income twice a year.

loans.use: To open a village store

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Madame L. Kossiwa  habite le quartier d’ablogamé, elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle vend ses pagnes au rond point du port autonome de Lomé non loin du poste de douane où passe un nombre important de personnes. Pour bien couvrir la demande actuelle de sa clientèle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes de qualités supérieures. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est  magasinier avec qui elle a eu 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Kossiwa lives in the Ablogamé district. Her business is selling "pagnes" (brightly colored lengths of African print cloth). She sells her "pagnes" at the roundabout of the autonomous port of Lomé, not far from the customs office where a great number of people pass by.

In order to respond appropriately to the demand of her present customers, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES which will allow her to buy 15 lengths of high quality "pagne". She is married to a gentleman who is a stock clerk and with whom she has 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 'pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Lusajo

texts.en:
Lusajo runs a tailoring business and is also a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She makes different types of dresses and sells them. She belongs to the Maendeleo A2 group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items and clothes. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Lusajo is 27 years old, married, and has two children: ages 9 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items and clothes.

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Zafar Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Kosar parveen baji has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Multan city is famous for its handmade items and for its shrines. Kosar baji is an uneducated lady who couldn’t get an education because her parents couldn’t afford the education expenses due to little financial resource. She married a man whose name is Z. I. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. Kosar baji is a very hardworking lady. She helps her husband by selling thread. She buys old warm clothes and pulls the thread out from them. Then she washes them and makes a roll. This process takes her a whole day. She sells the thread rolls to the thread sellers and earns an income. Her husband feels proud of her. She is applying for a loan to buy more old warm clothes to increase the profit of her business. 

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Nazir begum baji and Samina begum baji each want a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) for their decorative embroidery business. Haseena baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Sardaran mai baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy old warm clothes for thread selling business

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadores Sin Limites Group

texts.en:
Angela E. is the group leader of the Mujeres Luchadores sin Limites group. Business runs in Angela’s blood. Both of her parents had small business and taught her business skills since she was a girl.

Angela now has three businesses of her own. Her main business is a clothing business, where she takes orders for clothing in the community and buys her inventory on a per-order basis. In addition, she also runs a small store out of her house that sells candy, snacks and other staple food items. Her businesses have suffered from the current recession, as she notes: “There is less money on the street these days.” Angela will use the loan to restock her inventory.

Angela is the single mother of three boys, ages 18, 13 and 10. Since her husband left her, she has become the breadwinner of the home, and has had to support her sons with the income from her businesses. Angela has big dreams for her businesses. She hopes to be very successful, to expand her businesses and to be able continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena B. is from the city of Brgy. 25, Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Magdalena owns and operates a specialized business. She is into homemade food products like peanut butter and she's also into RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) sales. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Magdalena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more RTW clothes and ingredients for her peanut butter business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more RTW clothes and ingredients for her peanut butter business

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.es:
Elvin M. M. es un señor de 64 años de edad que vive con su madre su esposa y su hijo.
La comunidad en la cual vive don Elvin se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Don Elvin  se dedica desde hace 3 años a la producción de leche y queso como una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante. Comenta que la producción de leche la vende a la planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce.

El queso de la región donde vive don Elvin es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

Don Elvin desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y  sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Don Elvin es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la micro financiera EDESA. Este será su décimo segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico
texts.en:
Elvin M. M., 64, lives with his mother, wife, and son. Elvin lives in the El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba community in the Cargao province. It is a small rural community with approximately two thousand inhabitants. The community members work at milk production and planting coffee. The landscape is irregular, and much of the land is humid tropical rain forest. The community has very colorful scenery that combines the tropical rainforest with two pretty lakes, coffee plantations, and dairies. El Sauce is located approximately an hour and a half by bus from Turrialba, which is the closest commercial center. Nevertheless, several times a year the road becomes impossible to use because of the rains that batter the area. This is, without doubt, one of the biggest challenges for the area. When there was no work, many people chose to leave to look for work in Turrialba or in banana farms located in the Atlantic zone of Costa Rica. Currently, coffee and milk prices have improved. Therefore, the members of the neighborhood are looking for ways to invest in projects in their own zone in order to avoid emigrating. For three years Elvin has worked at milk and cheese production as a way to generate income for his family. He is very happy; thanks to this work, he has been able to get ahead. He sells his milk to the plant that makes cheese, which is the property of the Association of Milk Producers of El Sauce. The cheese from the region where Elvin lives is famous throughout Costa Rica. It is a fresh cheese that is traditionally known as “queso tipo Turrialba” (Turrialba type of cheese). The “ticos” (inhabitants of Costa Rica) really like to eat this product, which can be found on their tables as an accompaniment to all types of food. For that reason, the market for the product is really good. Elvin wants a loan for $500 to buy another milking cow in order to increase his milk production. He knows that having another cow is a big sacrifice, and that it will demand more work. Nevertheless, the desire to be a successful entrepreneur, to help his family’s future, and to improve their living conditions, motivates him to work with great dedication. Elvin is a member of the Association of Producers of El Sauce, a local organization belonging to the micro finance association Edesa. This will be his 12th loan, and he hopes to continue growing personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milking cow

loans.name: Joyitas De Villa Adela Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de el Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Villa Adela, a este pertenece la asociación “Joyitas De Villa Adela”, formada por catorce miembros que trabajan con mucho entusiasmo por mejorar en sus pequeños negocios.
Diversas son las actividades que tienen dentro el grupo, por ejemplo: Venta de queso, elaboración de comida, venta de frutas, dulces confitados, artefactos eléctricos. La asociación Joyitas De Villa Adela afirma que desean ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan reforzar su capital comprando mayor mercadería, tienen la seguridad que podrán generar mayores ganancias para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
In the city of El Alto, you can find the center Villa Adela. This is where the association "Joyitas (little gems) de Villa Adela" can be found, formed by fourteen members who work with a lot of enthusiasm to improve their small businesses.

The members of this group are involved in diverse activities, including: selling cheese, making food, selling fruit, sweet preserves, and electric goods. The Joyitas de Villa Adela association says that they wish to expand their businesses, which is why they need to increase their capital to buy more merchandise. They are sure that they will be able to earn more income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: George Kimani

texts.en:
George is 35-years-old, married and with two children. His wife Lucy assists him in the baking business. He lives in Uthiru where he supplies the cakes to the small traders in shops.

He was introduced to KADET by a neighbor who is a client. George has never borrowed from other sources, this will be his second loan with KADET. He paid off his first loan well without any difficulty. He wants to use the finance from this loan to buy a water tank to stock water for his family and also for use in his business.

George hopes and plans to establish his bakery business by adding more equipment to bake and pack his products. He desires to diversify in to baking bread in addition to the cakes.
He also desires to start a clothing business.

loans.use: George plans to buy a water tank because there is water shortage at his home area.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosita es una mujer entusiasta , dinámica y colaboradora, tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos . Ella se dedica a la costura, le gusta mucho confeccionar prendas de vestir y también hace lenceria, ya que cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura y tiene cuatro máquinas para realizar este trabajo. Rosita tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en una tienda de repuestos y lubricantes de motos y motocarro. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de Luren” desde hace  tres años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles.
Ella requiere otro préstamo de 1,500, el cual invertirá una parte en comprar telas y otra parte comprará polos y blusas hechas para vender.

La meta de Rosita es tener un taller de costura bien implementado y contratar personal para poder trabajar mejor y cumplir con el pedido que le solicitan y también de esta manera dar una oportunidad de trabajo  a otras personas.
texts.en:
Rosita is a very enthusiastic, dynamic, and collaborative 29 year old woman, mother of two children. She is a seamstress, and she enjoys making clothing items and also lingerie, as she has a small seamstress shop with 4 machines to do this work. Rosita has the support of her husband who works in a car and motorcar parts and oil store. She has been a member of the “Señor de Luren” Communal Bank for 3 years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles. She needs another loan for 1,500 soles to invest in buying fabric and polo shirts and blouses already made to sell. Rosita’s goal is to have a well implemented seamstress shop and hire people in order to be able to work better and meet the orders she has, and in this way provide an opportunity to work to other people.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and premade polo shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Mayra Elena

texts.es: La señora Mayra Elena R. M. tiene 42 años de edad madre de familia tiene dos hijos que van al colegio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que ella es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar por lo que en la actualidad sigue con el mismo negocio ya que tiene que proporcionar el alimento diario de su familia. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosméticos, calzado y bolsos.  En su deseo esta el salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra Elena is 42 years old and a mother of two children who attend school. She sells general merchandise. For over 7 years she has dedicated herself to this business. Mayra is a woman who has always liked to work and she continues by means of this business to feed her family.

Mayra is soliciting financing to invest in her business, for buying clothes, cosmetics, shoes and purses. Among her desires is getting ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Sergio Jacinto

texts.es: El señor Sergio Jacinto tiene su Kiosco el cual ya lleva mas de 8 años en ese puesto, con dulces , caramelos, galletas y refrescos los cuales vende a los que pasan por el lugar que es bastante concurrido.Tambien el señor es portero por las noches del Edificio "Asbun", que vive en las mismas instalaciones junto a su esposa y su hijo, trabaja como portero ya hace 6 años. El destino del credito es para comprar mas golosinas y mas refrescos por que es un lugar bastante transitado.

loans.use: Capital trabajo

loans.name: Anna
