texts.en: Anna sells frozen food items, such as turkey, chicken, and fish, to make a living. She is a widow with seven children and she is 54 years old. She takes care of her children alone and she hopes to give them a quality education. Anna lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more frozen food to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders .

loans.use: To purchase frozen food to sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji C. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase other goods like sodas, water, juice, etc to sell.  Keji is 36 years old and is married to a soldier. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like sodas, water, juice etc to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria U. is 54 years old. She is married and has seven children.

Maria owns a poultry farm and a shop where she sells food stuffs. Maria has been in these businesses for some years. She manages these businesses to support her husband, who is a retired army officer. Maria is a LAPO client; she has been in LAPO for six years.

Maria is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira (NGN) in order to purchase more food stuffs and feed in bulk, as this attracts customers and increases her profit. With this, she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs and chicken feed.

loans.name: Luis Larin

texts.es: Luis Larin S. de 55 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La libertad, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante y su hija de 13 años de edad. El posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, debido a que su tienda en la actualidad cuenta con muy pocos productos, las ganancias no son muy buenas. Es por esta razón que Luis solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos como cereales, detergentes, entre otros más y de esta manera surtir la tienda y poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Luis Larin S. is 55 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with his wife, who works as a shopkeeper, and his 13 year old daughter. He owns a shop where he markets basic necessities. Because his store currently has very few products, the profits are not very good. It is for this reason that Luis is requesting a loan, through which he will be able to buy more products, such as cereals, detergents, and other products to supply the store and to be able to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessity products

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia C. is a 37-year old married woman who lives in  Brgy Cabacungan, La Castillana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling used clothes, running a general store, and networking products of Avon.

Nelia’s husband helps her with the business. They have two children who are between 8 and 12 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Nelia joined NWTF-Project  Dungganon in 2001 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase her family's income. Now, she earns an average monthly income of  Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Nelia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 25,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and direct-selling of Avon beauty products, which had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 16th loan, in the amount of Php 29,500, which she intends to invest in her general store, clothes-selling, and networking businesses. Nelia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the village of Mararigue. She is 52 years old. Erlinda is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Erlinda's Group.

Erlinda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Nyongle

texts.en:
Nyongle V. is currently in the business of selling fresh cabbages and Irish potatoes in the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Nyongle is 29 years old and married to a builder. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

 In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola, vive en  la zona Estrellas de Belén, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de un año.
 
Trabaja como ayudante juntamente con Enrique su esposo como obreros en una fábrica elaboradora de muebles de exportación.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de materiales de construcción, ya que su señor padre les proporcionó un espacio en su vivienda en la cual podrán realizar las reparaciones y construcción de una habitación donde podrán vivir con un poco mas de comodidad junto a su pequeña familia.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Paolo lives in the Estrellas de Belén section of the city of El Alto. She lives in her parents' house with her husband and one-year-old son. She and her husband work as laborers in a factory that makes furniture for export. The funds will be used to buy building materials and supplies because her father provided a space in his house where they can build a room for themselves so that her small family can live a bit more comfortably This is her first loan with Impro; the socio-economic evaluation conducted qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maxima Maria

texts.es: Doña Maxima María Ordoñez Lacán cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Fajas Típicas” cuenta con un taller, habita junto a sus 5 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 4 años de laborar Fajas Típicas  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam, Cantón Nimapá, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maxima María Ordoñez Lacán, 43, is a married craftsperson, who lives with her husband and 5 children. She has a workshop where she makes typical sashes. She and her husband are in the same line of work and they employ two workers. She has made typical sashes for 4 years in her home, which is located in Paraje Xeatzam, Cantón Nimapá, Totonicapán, Guatemala. Demand has risen lately but her economic situation does not permit her to increase her production. For this reason, she called upon Asociación ASDIR to request funds to buy raw materials so that she can increase sales thereby hoping to move her children ahead in life and that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crafts supplies.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca F. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy. She is 60 years old. Rebecca is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Rebecca operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Rebecca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Cornelia is the coordinator of her group Jesus es Prosperidad (Jesus is Prosperity), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an urban area known for tobacco and beef production,  where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Cornelia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling polo shirts, accessories and skirts by purchasing her merchandise in the main markets and then selling it in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to purchase the daily needs of food and clothing for her children, as well as saving towards building a successful business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Shirts, skirts, accesories

loans.name: Mi Amigo Jesus Group

texts.es:
Un grupo muy unido que  se emprenden en aéreas similares  de trabajo.
Simeón de 42 años de edad cuenta con un pequeño negocio que le permite contar con  ingresos  para su familia
Actualmente convive con la madre de sus 4 hijos de la cual el último hijo de 9 años aun depende de ellos.
Simeon comenzó a trabajar desde los 23 años  debido a la responsabilidad  de cuidar de su familia, como cobrador de micro en la ruta (Lima - Chosica) hasta los 32 años.
Con el cual le permitió acumular capital para la apertura de un pequeño Negocio de  venta de Caldo de Gallina, labor a la que se dedica desde hace 10 años junto a su esposa, empezó con 1 mesa y 2 sillas, y posteriormente fue mejorando en la implementación de su negocio el cual lo realiza de forma ambulatoria. 
Por intermedio de su cuñado se entero de los Beneficios que le brindaba EDAPROSPO, por lo cual decide  participar en este crédito grupal, Este primer prestamo le permitió adquirir   1 carpa, mesas y sillas.
El anhelo de Simeón es apoyar y mejorar la educación de su ultimo hijo de 9 años ya que sus otros tres hijos son mayors de edad y son independientes y  claro esta en brindar una adecuada atención a sus clientes
texts.en:
This is a very united group that engages in similar areas of work. Simeón is 42 years old. He has a small business that provides him with enough income to support his family. He currently lives with the mother of his four children. Their youngest child is 9 years old and still depends on them. Because of his responsibility to take care of his family, at age 23, Simeón began working as a bus conductor on the route from Lima - Chosica. He worked there until he was 32. His work as a bus drive helped him accumulate enough capital to open a small business selling chicken soup. He has done this for this the past ten years alongside his wife. He began with one table and two chairs. Later he began improving his business, which he does as a street vendor. Simeón found out about the benefits provided by EDAPROSPO through his brother-in-law, which is why Simeón decided to participate in his first group loan. This first loan allowed Simeón to purchase a tent, tables, and chairs. Simeón's greatest wish is to support and improve the education of his youngest 9 year-old son, now that his other three children are grown and independent. He can achieve this by giving appropriate attention to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in one tent, large benches, and large table

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsa Jimenez tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada con el  Señor Antonio Benitez hace ya 32 años, tienen cuatro hijas juntos, todas mayores y profesionales a quienes criaron con mucho sacrificio ya que son personas muy humildes y trabajan de forma independiente.
La Sra. Elsa se dedica a la venta comidas típicas del Paraguay como Pastel Mandi'o (Empanada de Mandioca) hace 25 años en el Mercado Municipal Nº 2 de Coronel Oviedo, comenta que aprendió a realizar el producto con mucha delicadeza de su madre. Ella ayuda y apoya económicamente a su marido para la manutención de la casa y la educación de sus hijos.
Vende mas de 300 empanadas por la mañana porque tiene su clientela formada y la popularidad de buena calidad de su producto. 
Ella manifiesta su conformidad con la Fundación Paraguaya porque es la primera institución quien le otorgo un préstamo por el tipo de actividad que realiza, la cual valora y agradece.
Solicita el prétamo para la compra de ingredientes como; harina, huevos, aceites, carnicos y verduras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa Jimenez is 50 years old and has been married to Antonio Benitez for 32 years. They have four daughters, all of whom are adults and working professionals, and they raised them with a lot of sacrifices, since they are very humble people and work independently. Elsa makes a living selling typical Paraguayan foods, such as Pastel Mandi'o, which she has done for the last 25 years in the town market of Coronel Oviedo. She learned how to make the product with a lot of gentleness from her mother. With her earnings, she helps and supports her husband economically for the maintenance of their house and the education of their children. She sells more than 300 empanadas each morning, because she has an established clientele and is popular due to the good quality of her product. Fundacion Paraguaya is the first institution to grant her a loan for the type of activity that she performs, for which she is very grateful. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of ingredients such as: flour, eggs, oil, meat, and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, eggs, oil, dairy products, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sok Chea's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people who live in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. They will use tH. loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in tH. future. Mrs. Sok Chea R. is tH. group leader, selected by all tH. members who will use tH. loan for different purposes. SH. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Sok Chea R. is asking a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Voras Saren, is a construction worker. They did have a child but now they live in a two-member household.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: In Spean Daek village in Kandal province, there are four people who make up a group loan. Mrs. Vanny H. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who rents a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support her family.  She is a widow with six children. One of the children is a motorbike repairer, one is grocery seller in the local village, and the others are studying in the local public school. Since her child’s business is going, well she wants to expand it. So to improve this business, Mrs. Vanny H. is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es: Norma Luz S. D. G. D. 41 años D. edad, es una madre soltera, la cual es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a sus dos hijas, una niña D. 7 y otra D. 15 años D. edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Norma vive junto a sus hijas, en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas, en la cual se encarga D. elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche las tortillas. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación lugar en el cual sus hijas le ayudan a repartir las tortillas, sobretodo en los fines D. semana. Norma desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, varios cilindros D. gas propano y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad D. tortillas, sobretodo los fines D. semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas, lo cual Norma desea aprovechar al máximo ya que D. esta forma ella podrá obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad.
texts.en:
Forty-one year old Norma Luz S. D. G. is a single mother who is very responsible and whose priority is to raise her children. One is a seven year old girl and another is fifteen years old, they are both students. Norma lives with her daughters in the Ilopango municipality in the San Salvador department. She has a tortilla selling business, for which she is in charge of making tortillas every afternoon and night. Her business is located in her home where her daughters help her distribute the tortillas, especially on the weekends. Norma really wants to improve her business because it brings stable earnings that allow her to sustain her family. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan to at least be able to buy maíz in bulk, various canisters of propane gas and lime. This is so that she can make more tortillas, especially on the weekends when demand increases because a lot of other tortilla vendors are closed. Norma wants to take as much advantage of this as possible since this allows her to get higher earnings that will allow her to improve her stability.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maíz in bulk and canisters of propane gas for her tortilla business

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Talapsu” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Waterloo small town in western Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva of SLL 2,800,000 for the entire group in order to improve their businesses.
 
The leader of this group is Maseray K.. She was born in Waterloo small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. She is age twenty-seven, is married to a motor mechanic, and they have two children.

Maseray makes a living through selling clothes. With twenty years of experience in business, she wants this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire a business premise and to buy sweets for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 5  est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées  ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 40ans, 5  enfants et  vivant dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et tous les trois prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz par DIALIA B..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et payer de la  main d’oeuvre pour entretenir : 1hectare . 
La production est vendue au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 55.000 FCFA  en fin de campagne, qui  lui permettra de payer son prêt et de contribuer pour certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
Benkadi 5 is a group of ten married women who average 40 years of age and have an average of five children each; they live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth loan from the institution and the three previous loans were all repaid correctly. The crop cultivated by Dialia B. is rice. With her loan, she is planning to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment, as well as recruiting workers to maintain her hectare of land. The harvested crop is sold at the market in Loulouni to a customer base made up of consumers and retailers. She is planning to make an average profit of 55,000 FCFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to make a contribution to certain daily expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to cultivate a larger area of land and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of labor, grains, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing and small farming materials

loans.name: Suiumkan

texts.en: Suiumkan A. is a resident of Tup, a nice town in Isykul region with a population of 15,000. She is a 54-year-old widow who has raised three daughters and a son: her son is married and lives separately with his family; two older daughters study at university; and the youngest daughter is at school. In 1995, because of the high unemployment rate, Suiumkan decided to start her own business and began to sell foodstuffs in the market. Then she saved some money and opened a butchery. With money received from this loan, Suiumkan wants to purchase eight sheep in order to sell the meat in her butcher shop. In the future she wants to expand her business, give her daughter a good education and have enough money to support her children in the future. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase eight sheep for her butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon E. is from the village of Larion Bajo, Tuguegarao City. He is 44 years old. Ramon is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ramon owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling knives and iron products to local businesses and community members. Ramon has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ramon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Ramon is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ramon from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Jaser

texts.en:
Jaser is a Palestinian National Authority employee, and he also has a small family business of raising sheep. Jaser has started building his own house, now that the house is almost ready Jaser needed a $3000 loan that he took from FATEN which will help him finish constructing his house.

Jaser is working on having the house finished soon as he will get married soon. Jaser works with his father in his sheep's farm which he used its returns to build the house.

Jaser appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: Pay for construction expenses

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Bismark Antonio F. H.  él es Trabajador activo del colegio “Monte limar” desempeñándose como Maestro de Educación Primaria tiene  Veinte años de trabajar como docente es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando  para ampliarle a su casa con un cuarto mas, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Bismark Antonio F. H. is an active worker in the Monte Limar school. He is a first  grade teacher. He has been a teacher for the past 20 years, he is married and he has 2  school-aged children. He has had seven past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each  has been invested in the purchase of building material to build a better house for his family.  He requests this loan to add a new room to their home. The loans from Ceprodel have been a great  help and they have enabled a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry farming

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La  señora Eva C., es de la Ciudad de  Capi´ivary barrio centro, es soltera tiene casa propia es propietaria de comercio roperia y zapateria anexo peluqueria con local propio. 
Según ella empezo a vender mercerias por la zona de Capi´ivary en una moto acompañado por un señor a quien ella le pagaba mensualmente, ella siempre soñaba de salir adelante  y de tener su propio local comercial, ahora ya cuenta con dos salones bien terminado, cuenta  con clientela bien formado.
La señora acude a la entidad en busca de un apoyo economico como manifesta si uno trabaja siempre necesita de una ayuda para poder comprar mercaderias y tambien mantener la buena imagen de su negocio. 
 Posee buenas referencias personales y no tiene deuda financieras ni comerciales en otras entidades, solicita el prestamo para compra de mercaderias.  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de calzados y ropas.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva C. lives in a central neighborhood of the city of Capi´ivary. She is single and has her own home. Eva is the owner of a clothing and shoe store that is located next to a beauty parlor.

She says she began selling sewing supplies throughout Capi´ivary by traveling on motorcycle with a man who she paid each month. Eva always dreamed of getting ahead and having her own retail store. Now she has two boutiques that are finished and an established customer base.

Sra. Eva comes to Fundación Paraguaya in search of financial assistance since she always needs some help in her business with acquiring merchandise and maintaining a good image. She has good personal references and no other financial or business obligations with any other entity.

Eva is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as shoes and clothing.

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband whose business is selling construction supplies. He offers his services to his customers through his shop which is located in the market. From his shop, he sells different construction supplies such as sand, bricks and cement in bulk quantity to different construction companies and earns income for the family. With the loan, he will buy more construction supplies for his shop and improve his sales.  

Safia is very confident that her husband will utilize the loan in a proper way and further improves his business. Safia is a very supportive lady. In order to financially support her family she sells clothes to her local area clients and generates income for the family. She buys clothes from a wholesale market named “Shahalmi” at cheap rates and resells them for a good profit.  

She is the mother of 4 sons and 3 daughters. Her elder son works with his father in his business while others are studying by attending a local school. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a construction supply selling business

loans.name: Alivera

texts.en:
Alivera is 44 years old and married with five children between the ages of four and 16. Her husband is a nurse. Alivera runs a general store that sells a large variety of food and other items. She has fifteen years of business experience and is able to employ two people.  
 
Alivera has requested a loan to expand her business. She will use her loan to purchase additional products to sell such as water, baby food, juice, and coffee. Alivera hopes to be able to build her own house with the profit from her loan.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia L. is from the town of Banga. She is 41 years old, married and has five children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 10. All of her children go to school. To make a living, Cresencia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. Cresencia also plants and harvests corn crops. She sells her harvest to the market.
Cresencia joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy feed and farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Yolanda Zulema

texts.es:
Yolanda Zulema Z. M. tiene 41 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposo,  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. DIVINO NIÑO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Yolanda Zulema se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Agro Servicios San Jacinto y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener su propio negocio de venta de comida 

Le gusta escuchar música
texts.en:
Yolanda Zulema Z. M. is 41 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage with her partner in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos Province. She has 3 children. 

The V.R.C. Divino Niño (Divine Child Communal Bank) is located in the Estero Lindo precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; it is composed of 12 members who engage in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Yolanda Zulema engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys her products in the Agro Servicios San Jacinto and sells them in the same place.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize and rice by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of running her own grocery store.

She likes listening to music.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old married woman living with her husband and three young children. She is from Lebanon. She sells bread from her house to customers from her community. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her husband who works in the construction field. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new oven and some other needed products so that she can produce more, augment her sales and get higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven and some other needed products

loans.name: Yakobus

texts.en:
Yakobus is a 26-year-old fishmonger. He lives in Labat, a village which is situated about 3 km from the city of Kupang. Yakobus lives with his wife, Maria, and with his two sons, Feri, 5 years old, and Oktovianus, 2 1/2 years old. His house is very simply constructed with a zinc roof, cement floor and palm-branched walls. Yakobus has been running his business for almost 5 years. He works from 6 a.m. until the fish are all sold, about 3 p.m. Yakobus can generate a daily profit of IDR 30,000 - IDR 50,000, which he uses to provide rice, vegetables and side dishes for his family. His income obviously depends on the amount of fish sold. Yakobus realizes that the profit is still not comparable with his family's everyday needs.

Yakobus experienced difficulty when his second child was sick and he did not have money to pay the doctor and medicines, so he had to borrow from his neighbors. Because of this situation, Yakobus wants to improve his business, but needs additional capital. Yakobus heard about TLM from the field officer who came to the market. He then became interested in joining the individual lending program. Yakobus is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000. He plans to buy large quantities of fish, such as belang kuning (yellow mottled), to sell in order to generate more profit. He assures that he will be able to save some of his profit for his children’s schooling and health care. Yakobus really hopes that TLM will provide him with the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es: Jackeline es una mujer emprendedora de  36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace varios años vende granos como maíz, cebada, arveja, habas y quinua, productos que siembra, y algunos son comprados de sus vecinos. Asimismo posee vacas, en donde vende la leche que extrae, así se genera un poco más de ganancia. Desde entonces viene realizando este trabajo desde hace más de 3 años, siendo los miércoles y fines de semana lo días de mayor venta. Procura siempre estar al pendiente de los precios que ofrece la competencia, para asegurar las ventas. Para ella este trabajo es imprescindible para poder sostener a su familia, por ello espera producir en mayor escala y convertirse en una comerciante mayorista. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar sacos de abono para esta temporada de siembra que en la actualidad esta desarrollando.
texts.en: Jackeline is an enterprising woman of 36 years of age. She lives with her husband and 2 children in their own house. For the past several years she has been selling grains, such as corn, barley, peas, beans, quinoa, and harvest products, sometimes purchased by the neighbors. She also owns dairy cows that produce milk to generate an extra income. She has had this business for three years. The days when she sees the highest sales are on Wednesdays and on the weekends.  She tries to always know the prices by the competition to secure her sales. This work is essential to support her family and that’s why she hopes to produce at a greater rate and to become a wholesaler. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has this source of financial support. She has always demonstrated to be responsible with her payments and she also enjoys partaking in her communal bank because all of the other members are responsible and very caring people. She is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. It will be very useful for the progress of her business. With the help of the loan she requests she will be able to purchase sacks of fertilizers for the sowing season that is currently taking place.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
la sra. Martha Lidia C. tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Martha vive en la aldea el polvo, tiene mas de 30 años de vivir en su casa propia, le a tocado dificil mantener y educar a sus  hijos sola, mas sin embargo a luchado para sacar adelante su hogar.
Martha se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mejores ganancias.
  
su sueño es que su negocio crezca y se convierta en un mercadito bien acondicionado para una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Lidia C. is 62 years old and she is a single mother of 3 children. Martha lives in the community of El Polvo. She has lived in her own home for more than 30 years. She has had difficulty raising her children and sending them to school on her own. But in spite of it she has fought hard to support her home. Martha sells every day products. She has a grocery store in her house where she lives. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to supply her business in order to have improved earnings.

Her dream is to expand her business and to convert it into a well-conditioned food market to provide her clients with a better level of service.

loans.use: to purchase basic needs merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: Astrid B. vive en el barrio Los Almendros del municipio de Galapa, población donde tradicionalmente las artes, la música y el folclor forman parte de su tradición cultural; allí se dedica a la confección en un taller ubicado en su propia casa, negocio  heredado de su madre quien le enseñó el oficio de la modistería y con el cual se ha sostenido desde hace 30 años, construyendo toda su experiencia emprendedora. Astrid considera que su m microempresa ha sido muy importante en su autonomía e independencia, pero sobre todo porque con el ha logrado salir adelante en la educación y el sostenimiento de  con su único hijo, que hoy se encuentra en la edad de 23 años. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a la linea de Kiva, con él cual comprará telas e insumos de confección, inversión que garantiza sea exitosa porque está sobre pedidos y especialmente por la calidad de las prendas de vestir que Astrid produce y comercializa.  Su sueño es organizar mejor su taller para garantizar mejores tempos productivos y dar una respuesta bien oportuna a su clientela, mientras en la actualidad  maneja una rentabilidad no menor del 40% que desea ampliar iniciando por este su primer financiamiento con esta organización a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Astrid B. lives in the “Los Almendros” neighborhood in the municipality of Galapa, a location where art, music and folklore are traditionally part of their culture; she has a dressmaker's shop in her house, business inherited from her mother, who taught her dressmaking and with which she has supported herself for 30 years, having a full entrepreneurial experience.  Astrid considers that her micro-enterprise has been very important in her autonomy and independence, but for above all because she has been able to get her only son ahead, through education and financial support , he is now 23 years old.  This is her first loan with “Mario Santo Domingo” foundation through Kiva, with which she will buy fabric and tailoring supplies, an investment that guarantees success because she has many orders due to the quality of the clothing pieces Astrid produces and sells.  Her dream is to organize a better shop to be more productive and provide timing services to her clients, currently she has profitability of not less than 40% that she hopes to increase thanks to the loan with this organization through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 54, runs a rice retailing business. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale. She has been in this business for 15 years. She and her husband have five children, three of whom are still in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money so that she can expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 41 years old and married with three children between the ages of one and 15 years old. Justine and her husband sell sweet bananas wholesale. This business has enabled her to feed her family and meet her family’s needs. 

Justine is requesting a loan to purchase more bananas and increase her profits. In the future, she would like to save enough to open up her own shop.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Narcisa Del Socorro

texts.es: Narcisa se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo. Tiene más de 19 años en su negocio, anteriormente  su familia era quien se hacía cargo del negocio, pues con el paso del tiempo decidieron que Narcisa se encargara del negocio. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos, leña y pago del transporte.  Ella desea incrementar sus ganancias cada día más pues tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo.
texts.en:
Narcisa sells and butchers beef. She has been doing this for more than 19 years. Before that her family was in charge of the business, but eventually they decided that Narcisa should take over. She is a hardworking woman and a go-getter. 

She asks for a loan to buy pigs, firewood and to pay for transport. She wants to increase her earnings every day since she has a young son in her care.

loans.use: to buy pigs, firewood and pay for transport.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is from the village of Binuangan, Sindangan. She is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene buys fish from the fishermen of their barangay and nearby barangays. She lets the fish dry, using the fish nets, under the heat of the sun. 

Arlene has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, with which she will purchase more fish. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Arlene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative: 
(PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
   
Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to produce dried fish.

loans.name: Nana Ama

texts.en: Nana is a fish monger in Elmina, a fishing community on Cape Coast. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She helps to pay the utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to buy more fresh fish to sell. In the photo, she is standing by the traditionally-built oven she uses to smoke the fish.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is twenty-six years old, divorced, and has two children aged eight and two years old. Her business is located at Khayega, a busy local market in Kakamega. She sells vegetables, onions and tomatoes to the local people. She has engaged in this kind of business for the last five years despite the fact that competition is high because there are many people in the area engaged in the same kind of business as hers.

She is using her loan of 80,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She dreams of buying her own land and building her own shop. She also sees herself being the biggest greengrocer in Khayega. She is a very hardworking and determined lady.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: She  has a small business of keeping animal and selling it to customers . Now she wants more income to able her purchase more stock. She is 32 years old and married with a husband who is a  businessman. She has four children and two of whom are in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and make a wonderful house.

loans.use: Small Stock Business

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria works as a mechanic and has her own auto repair business. She is 43 years old and lives with her partner. She has four children, all of whom have moved out of the house. Hilaria is asking for a loan in order to purchase car parts, specifically metal plates and mirrors, in order to repair vehicles that are brought to her repair shop. She is very motivated to improve her business and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy car parts for her auto repair business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 37 años, vive con sus hijos y su esposa. En la búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades para su familia vio que la mejor salida es a través del comercio de productos de acuerdo a la temporada del año y desde entonces se dedica a este negocio de manera ambulante, permitiéndole tener ganancias semanales. Con la ayuda de su esposa desarrolla estas actividades, y se vale de un  medio de transporte que es un triciclo, para poder trasladar sus productos a diversas calles de su ciudad. Después de un día de trabajo, por lo general terminan muy cansados pero con todos los deseos de seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su familia y concretar lo que se han propuesto, el de incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, le recomendaron unos familiares para que pueda mejorar su capital de trabajo. El dinero que solicita, será para comprar más productos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 37 years old living with his wife and children.  Seeking new opportunities for his family he found a better way out through commerce of seasonal merchandise and since then has been a street vendor of such items producing weekly profits for him.  His wife helps him carry out these activities and he uses a means of transportation, a three-wheeled cart, to move his products from street to street in his city.  After a day of work they finish tired but with a strong desire to continue working for the benefit of their family and reach the goals they’ve set for themselves: to increase working capital.

This is his time he’s asked for an MFP loan.  He was recommended by some relatives so that he can improve his working capital.  The money he’s requesting will be to buy more merchandise to stock his business.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en:
Elgie works hard to support her family. Elgie is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

Elgie requested a 14,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving. She has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income fR. charcoal sales. 

Elgie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena D. 24 años D. edad vive en el municipio D. Soledad con su esposo y su hijo D. 2 años D. edad. Allí se dedica a L. producción D. comidas rápidas, negocio que inició como una alternativa D. generar ingresos para apoyar L. gestión D. su hogar. DesD. hace 17 años tiene esta experiencia D. negocios, pues este fue iniciado por sus padres  y hace 2 años, elL. se encargó D. él. En su negocio Lorena venD. perros calientes, hamburguesas, sanduches, picadas y pizzas. Su negocio se caracteriza por su buena atención, una clienteL. acreditada, y un importante volumen D. ventas, pues atienD. a sus clientes “uno a uno”.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas e insumos para elaborar sus productos como carnes frías, salsas, quesos etc. Su meta más adelante es acondicionar un segundo piso, para separar su espacio familiar del productivo. Mientras esto ocurre Lorena se esmera por mantener su negocio con una rentabilidad no menor del 21% L. cual le permita cumplir el pago D. sus obligaciones L. rotación D. sus inventarios es diaria, indicadores financieros desD. los que proyecta su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Lorena is 24 years old and lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and two-year-old son. There she produces fast food, a business that she started as a way of generating income to support her household. She first gained experience when she was 17 years old and her parents started this business. Two years later, they allowed her to take charge of it. In her business, Lorena sells hot dogs, hamburgers, sandwiches, snacks, and pizzas. Her business is known for its good service, an established customer base, and a large volume of sales, all because she gives her customers “one-on-one” attention.

This Kiva loan is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Lorena will use the funds to buy basic materials and supplies for making her products such as cold cuts, sauces, cheeses, and other items. Her goal for the future is to remodel the second floor of her family home so that she will have a separate space for being productive. In the meantime, Lorena strives to maintain a profitability rate of no less than 21% in her business, which will allow her to pay her obligations. Her inventory turnover occurs on a daily basis, which is a good financial indicator that predicts the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies such as cold cuts, sauces, and cheeses.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 52 years old and married to a tricycle driver. Together they raise two children. She has managed her sari-sari store (variety) for almost 30 years. With the minimal profits she earned from the business, she was able to support the daily allowances of her children. As of now, her two children have their own employment and somehow help her in times of need. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy instant noodles, canned goods, eggs and breads to sell in her store. She wants to increase her earnings to achieve financial stability and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy instant noodles, canned goods, eggs and breads to sell in her store.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is 69 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Adelaida has a food shop, or carenderia, that makes and sells viands like adobo and afritada. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making viands. Adelaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eva; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende cervezas y gaseosas desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 12:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de bar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO” communal bank. It is located in the Cuzco district, in the province and department of Cuzco.

Her name is Eva. She is 40 years old, married and has 2 children. The alternates between her daily activities and her bar business. She sells beer and soft drinks from 5:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m. With this business she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve the business and is asking for the loan to buy soft drinks and beer wholesale.

Eva is happy with the loan and committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beer wholesale.

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Carlos, es un pequeño agricultor de a zona de Ticuantepe, habita junto a su esposa e hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Carlos desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para poderle dar una mejor mantención al cultivo ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para una mejor producción. Agradece la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que los interés son bajos y  sobre todo que sin ellos no fuese posible trabajar su cultivo .
texts.en:
Carlos is a small farmer in the Ticuantepe zone.  He lives with his wife and children.  His plan for the future is to improve living conditions. 

Carlos has been a pineapple farmer for several years.  The greatest problem he faces is not having enough economic resources to provide better care for his crops because he lacks fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies for a better production.  

He is grateful for the trust and support given by Afodenic through the Kiva funds because interest rates are low and, above all, because if it weren’t for them it would be impossible to farm his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is currently taking care of 3 children. Veronica sells cooked rice at Takoradi, which she has done for 3 years. She serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni and others. Her husband is a driver. Veronica uses her income to see to the well-being of her home. Veronica will use the loan to purchase bags of rice and other food items to cook and sell.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and other food items to cook and sell.

loans.name: Janylkan

texts.en:
Janylkan is the resident of Tup, a small village in Isykul region. She is 53 and unfortunately she is a widow. This brave woman has raised six sons and a daughter.  Three older sons are married; they live and work in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). The other three sons help Janylkan with housework and her daughter, studies at school.  In order to earn a livelihood, Janylkan sells clothes at the market. She started this business seventeen years ago with an initial investment of 3000 soms.  Currently, her business runs well and she earns about 8000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she will purchase winter clothes in order to improve and increase the variety of goods that she sells.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with six children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Grace has operated a vegetable stall for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

Grace plans to use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it helps low income earners by giving them funds to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 38 years old and married. With 2 children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell. Mary Ann has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Mahoko Group

texts.en:
Gotham is a 40 year old married man with no children. He has been growing coffee, maize and beans for over six years. He faces a number of agricultural problems, such as a lack of fertilizers. He is struggling to find funds to finance his agricultural activities, especially buying fertilizers.

Gotham is a hard worker who hopes to expand his scale of production from 5 to 15 acres within five years. He also wishes to improve his house and own his own transportation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a 37-year-old married father of three children between the ages of nine and four, is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya producing milk, maize, tea and beans which he sells to the local market. He runs a retail shop business as well.

William has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will help him to acquire a better grade of cow that will help improve his farming income and pay for the education of his children. Althogh fluctuation in milk prices makes the business quite unpredictable, William remains optimistic about business growth over time.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su esposa y sus hijos él tiene su negocio de granja de pollos, él lo inicio por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de tener más ingresos, no tiene un horario establecido.
El crédito lo necesita para  comprar más pollos para crecerlos y luego venderlos de esa forma podrá tener mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Miguel es tener una granja más grande y tener  clientela, con su familia espera darle lo necesario.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife and children. He has a poultry business, which he started himself due to the necessity of increasing his income. He doesn't have a fixed schedule.

Miguel is applying for this loan to buy more chickens to raise, and later sell them; in this way, he will be able to make a better income.

Miguels' dream is to have a larger poultry farm and more customers, and to be able to provide for his family's necessities.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas, de 38 años es una mujer sencilla. Junto a Hector, su esposo, cuidan de sus 2 hijos: Jorge Luis y Jhordy; en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Ella es una mujer peculiar; pues administra la siembra y su venta. Ya tiene 12 años de experiencia esparciendo semillas de papa, cebada, alverja, habas y maíz. Su modalidad de trabajo consiste en la asociación con otras personas, que ponen el terreno agrícola mientras ella invierte en la semilla y fertilizantes. Ya en la cosecha comercializa en la feria de Acostambo, donde reparten sus ganancias de manera equitativa. Además para obtener ganancias extras, trabaja como peón en otros terrenos agrícolas, pues quiere estar activa. Por su parte, su esposo trabaja en una mina, los visita cada 15 días, que una fecha de algarabía y gozo para su familia. Con el sueldo mensual que percibe, le permite pagar los estudios de sus hijos, como también ahorrar para comprarse una casa propia, que es su objetivo. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y está contenta de saber, que tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Felicitas de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa, alverja y maíz.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 38, is a simple woman. Together with her husband, Hector, she takes care of her 2 children: Jorge Luis and Jhordy. They rent a home in the town of Chilca. She is an unusual woman because she manages the planting and sales. She has 12 years of experience planting potatoes, barley, peas, beans and corn. Her work requires her to collaborate with other people who have the farmland, while she supplies the seeds and fertilizers. She sells her harvest in the market in Acostambo, and they divide their earnings equally. To earn extra money, she works as a laborer on other farms because she wants to be active. Her husband works in a mine and visits them every 15 days, a time of celebration and enjoyment for his family. With the monthly salary that he receives, they are able to pay for their children's studies and also are saving to buy a house. 

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she is happy to know she has this financial support because she feels certain that she will make advancements in her business. She promises to make her payments. She is thankful to be part of the association because all of the members are responsible and very united. Felicitas will use her loan to buy natural fertilizers to sprinkle among her potato, pea and corn plantings.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old and married, with three children. To earn a living he is a maize farmer. He has been in this business for two years and describes his business environment as good, because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.  John hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anye

texts.en:
Anye is married with six children and lives in Ntangang, a quarter in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. The deaths of his son, sister and father-in-law are the main challenges that he has faced in his life and hates thinking about.

This hard working man has taken and repaid loans ten times, and is involved in poultry farming and the cultivation of some basic food crops like maize, beans, groundnuts, yams, and coco yams. His business is located in the Ntangang quarter. He believes his business will succeed, because the animal excrement will be used as manure for the crops and, in turn, some of the harvest from the farm will be used to feed the animals. Demand of food crops is high in his locality, and his neighbors also buy some of his animals for consumption on occasion and for ceremonies such as weddings, funeral celebrations, and cultural rites. The community will also benefit from his animal excrement and yields from the crops which he grows at all times.

He says that the profits from his previous loans were used to buy medication for his family, to educate his children and to assist in the education of his grandchildren. Profit from the requested loan will be used to maintain and expand his compound, and to feed his family. He says that GHAPE loans are preferable, because training is given before loan disbursement, interest rates are very low, repayment is gradual (in installments), and the organization encourages them to save and undertake bigger investments.

loans.use: poultry farming, piggery and cultivation of  maize, beans, groundnut, yams and cocoyam

loans.name: Djemile

texts.en: Djemile S. is 31 years old. She is married and has a kid. Her husband works in Germany now. Before she decided to start own business she had worked in the field of trade for about 5 years. In 1996 she rented a stall in one of the trade centers of the town and started selling souvenirs, small jewelry and presents. Now she wants to open another stall in the town and needs some financial help. The loan amount is $ 1 200.

loans.use: To open and supply another stall

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima has a stand where she sells typical ecuadorian foods. She has been in this line of work for over 15 years. In order to get started she and her husband had to save money to invest in a cart. She began selling the products right out of her home and she has been very popular for many years. She makes chicken, hotdogs, fries and other foods for people on the go. She is seeking a loan because she needs to invest in a new cart. As one can see from the picture, her old cart is not in good conditions and this hurts the appearance of her business. Fatima is 41 years old and has 4 children, 2 of which are still in school. The other two have already graduated and with their wages from work help out at home. Her husband also works with her as they rely on the business to support their family.

loans.use: Buy a new cart to sell food from

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a young advertising entrepreneur from Zaporoshye, Ukraine. Three years ago she started her own small manufacturing company making outdoor advertising stands and hanging signs. Prior to owning her own company, Yelena gained valuable marketing experience as a manager in a marketing firm and in the advertising department of a local TV station. Her goal is to see her business continue to grow and find its way into some larger advertising markets.

Yelena is a bright and energetic lady who has been a delightful client with “Nadiya Ukraine” and has maintained a perfect credit history. She has requested a loan for $600 to buy some material for an advertising job. Often her marketing projects require a short term increase in working capital so that she can purchase necessary materials for a specific project. Our lending services have been a perfect fit for her business and we look forward to continuing to assist her and watching how her business will expand in the future.

loans.use: Buy material to produce advertising

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos is very responsible and a hard worker. He is married and has a small daughter. After struggling with unemployment, for the past six years he has been involved in the sale of clothing and perfume. He started his business with a very small amount of capital, but thanks to the high quality of his products and the excellent level of service he offers, he was able to increase his sales and reinvest in the business to allow it to grow. Unfortunately, his daughter fell seriously ill, and as they have no social security benefits, the cost of doctor's visits and medication were very high, thereby reducing the amount of capital he could invest in his business.

Today his daughter is no longer in danger. To continue working, he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise. He is committed to repaying the loan in 6 months. Now is time to help those who are most in need. You can be an important part of the development of this business and the lives of Carlos and his family. They appreciate it sincerely.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, es casado y tiene una pequeña hija, ante la falta de empleo desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes, inició su negocio con muy poco capital pero gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y el excelente servicio que ofrece pronto logró incrementar sus ventas y reinvertir en el negocio para hacerlo crecer. Lamentablemente su hija enfermó de gravedad y por no contar con seguro social los gastos en consultas y medicamento fueron muy altos, lo que redujo el capital que reinvertiría en su negocio.

Hoy su hija está fuera de peligro y para continuar trabajando solicita un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de Carlos y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Señora Virginia is 57 years old and is the mother of 3 children. She lives at Guillermo Sisley 675 and belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes (“Courageous Women’s Community Bank”) in the district of Calleria, Ucayali department. Together with her husband she owns a business selling motorcar spare parts. The town doesn’t have well-repaired tracks and the main moD. of transport is the motorcar: as a result these vehicles suffer frequent damage. Given this, Virginia and her husband decided to sell motorcar spare parts. Clients who are taxi-drivers are offered the possibility by Virginia of paying daily.

Recently, she has asked Manuela Ramos for a loan of 2.700 soles ($862 USD) which she will use to buy a dozen seals, two crates of lubricant, a dozen pull-systems and a dozen kip accessories. Virginia has the satisfaction of working together with her husband and it is he who with great care carries out the necessary motocar repairs.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Virginia tiene 57 años y es madre D. 3 hijos. Vive en el jirón Guillermo Sisley 675 y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, del distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali. Junto a su esposo comparten el negocio D. venta D. repuestos D. Motocar, la ciudad no cuenta con pistas habilitadas y el principal medio D. transporte es el motocar, entonces estos vehículos sufren muchos desperfectos, dada esta necesidad Virginia y su esposo deciden vender repuestos para motocar. Virginia a los clientes que hacen el servicio D. Taxi les da facilidades D. pago en forma diaria.

Recientemente ha solicitado a Manuela Ramos un préstamo D. S/. 2,700 (US$ 862 aprox.), el cual será utilizado para comprar 1 docena D. retenes, 2 cajas D. rodaje, 1 docena D. sistema D. arrastre, y 1 docena D. accesorios kip. Virginia tiene la satisfacción D. trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo y es el quien revisa con detenimiento los desperfectos del motocar.

loans.use: Buy motorcar spare-parts and accessories

loans.name: Elena Francisca

texts.es:
Elena has three young children that she takes care of by herself. Her oldest daughter is a professional and works in a health camp; the other two are entirely dependent on her since they are still students in high school. Elena set up a store because she received some money after getting laid off from a business that she helped to operate. Previously, she was also very anxious about the little money she was receiving despite the long arduous hours she was putting in; her dismissal exacerbated their financial conditions even more. Being the only vital source of income for her family, she depends on her sons to help her in their little store. Both take turns so they can still do their schoolwork. Elena has plans to increase the products offered in their little store until she is able to convert it into a mini-mart with hard work in the medium term while trying to meet her customers' demands. She leaves this goal at the disposal of your generous contribution which can help her realize her desires.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Elena, tiene tres pequeños a los que cobija sin ayuda alguna; la hija mayor es profesional y trabaja en el campo de la salud, mientras que los otros dos dependen enteramente de ella debido a que se encuentran estudiando en el colegio.
