She tells us that she currently has a “ropasicos” (pearls on fabric) business but will use the loan she’s taking out now to open another business consisting in knitting “chambritas” (infant sweaters) that will be sold in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio market.  This work will help her contribute to her family’s support a bit more since she’s married and has three children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answered that she likes the required savings and that she’s motivated to continue forward.

With respect to the members of the association, we can state that they are running a variety of businesses, such as: neighborhood store, grocery store, blanket weaving, blanket manufacturing, candy sales, vegetables sales, food sales and sportswear merchandising.

loans.use: to open a new business of infant wear sales.

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
Con el financiamiento al que aplica Nubia tiene planeado comprar víveres, ranchos, carnes frias, ropa y electrodomésticos menores, que traerá de Maicao, municipio fronterizo con Venezuela un país vecino y venderá en Soledad y Barranquilla en el departamento del Atlántico. Son muchos los pedidos que Nubia tiene de sus clientes y  necesita responderles, para conservarlos y con ello lograr que su inversión sea exitosa, porque  tiene pleno conocimiento que le pagarán de contado y a más tardar en la siguiente quincena del mes, como lo han pactado.  
“A las personas en Kiva que me dieron el crédito, les agradezco que confiaran en mi,  yo no los defraudaré” estas fueron las palabras con las que Nubia I.  se despidió de su asesor de Créditos cuando éste fue a visitarla para renovar su credikiva, el cual es el segundo que recibirá.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Nubia Iglesia ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/187901
texts.en:
Nubia plans to use the loan that she is currently applying for to buy food products, cold cuts, clothes and small electrical appliances that she will buy in Maicao, a town on the border with neighboring Venezuela.  She will sell her products in Soledad and Barranquilla, in Atlántico department.

Nubia has a lot of orders from her customers and she needs to fill them in order to retain her customers and ensure that her investment is successful.  She is fully aware that her customers will pay her cash and, at the latest, the following fortnight as agreed.  "I would like to thank the people at Kiva who gave me my loan for trusting in me.  I will not let them down".  These were the words with which Nubia I. said goodbye to her loan advisor when he went to visit her to renew her Kiva loan (the second that she has received).  If you would like to know more about Nubia Iglesia's story, click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/187901

loans.use: to buy cold cuts, food products, small electrical appliances and clothes

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria tiene 26 años de edad y es casada. Vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Monsefú. Su vivienda cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su distrito es conocido por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Las principales actividades que se realizan aquí son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña. Se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Maria gana la vida con la elaboración y venta de sombreros de paja. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años. Es muy conocida en este rubro y tiene una clientela ya establecida. Vende sus productos a pedido a sus vecinos y amistades y también al público general en los mercados locales. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacerle unos arreglos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old and married. She lives in her own home in the rural section of the District of Monsefú. Her home receives electricity and well water. This district is known for its tourist and religious festivals. The main business activities here are flower production, handicrafts, and cattle breeding. Despite being a small community, this area is full of vegetation. The community is located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria earns her living by manufacturing and selling straw hats. She has been in this business for two years. Maria is well-known in this trade and already has an established customer base. She sells her products according to orders from her neighbors and friends, as well as directly to the general public at the local markets.

At the moment, her house is in a state of deterioration so she needs to make a few repairs. For this reason, Maria is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa (a Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Abakundisuka Group

texts.fr: Albert S. est agriculteur du riz dans le secteur du Ruhuha, membre du groupe Abakundisuka, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 31 ans, il est marie, et il a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 8 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Il est ne a Bugesera, au Rwanda, et il a une éducation d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son troisième cycle avec ACB, et il a une très bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des fertilisants, et le paiement de main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’unité des membres (vivre dans une même agglomération), lutter contre la pauvreté en travaillant sans chercher le repos, et la valorisation de la culture de riz dans sa région.  Il voudrait avoir les machines pour lui aider avec son activité, et avoir une vache au moins pour chaque membre du groupe.  Pour sa famille et lui-même, il voudrait avoir une vache pour donner le lait aux membres de la famille, scolariser ses enfants, et nourrir la famille convenablement.
texts.en:
Albert S. is a rice cultivator in Ruhuha sector. He's a member of Abakundisuka group, and a customer of Kiva's partner, ACB, since 2009. He's 31 years old, married, and the father of three children, age 2 to 8. One of them attend school. He was born in Bugesera, Rwanda, and attended school up to elementary level.

He's seeking his third loan from ACB, and his repayment history is very good. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor. His strategy to grow the group's business is uniting its member and living in the same agglomeration, fighting poverty by working restlessly, and valorizing rice cultivation in his region. 

He would like to have machines to help him with his activity, and a least one cow for each member of the group. For himself and his family, he would like to have a cow to provide milk for the family, send his children to school, and feed his family decently.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: Tomasa del Carmen se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y cerdos. Hace más de 19 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable por lo que siente muy orgullosa de tener un medio de vida. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos, pues tiene que recorrer distancias bien largas a otras comarcas. Durante algunos años esta emprendedora estuvo sin tener un trabajo que le genera ingresos, pero con el paso del tiempo ha logrado tener su propio negocio. Ella sueña con realizar algunas comodidades  que le permitan realizar su labor cotidiana.
texts.en: Tomasa del Carmen sells general merchandise and pigs. She has had this business for more than 19 years. She is a very responsible person who is proud of earning her living this way. This loan is to buy pigs, because she has to travel long distances to other areas. For some years, this enterprising woman had no job generating income, but after time, she was able to open her own business. She dreams of having some comveniences that will make doing her daily work easier.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 55 years old and married with eight children, six of whom are currently in school. He has a poultry farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years. He employs one farmhand and sells his products to the local market. He also earns additional income from the sale of sugarcane, vegetables, and milk. 

Dominic has requested this loan of 60,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to buy additional chickens and build a poultry house. This he says, would improve his production capacity and increase his marginof profit. In future, he plans to expand his poultry farm by increasing the number of layers and constructing a better poultry house. He faces a transportation challenge getting his products to the market due to a poor network of roads.

loans.use: To buy chickens and build a poultry house.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and takes care of six dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. 

For the past three years Adjoa has been selling cosmetics. On her lap are some of the cosmetics which she sells by moving from one area to another. Adjoa  uses her income to see to the upkeep of her home. 

Adjoa is going to use her 800 GHS loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, She plans to build a cosmetics shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old and married to Anna. For the last seven years, he has been a farmer. Paul suports a family of six and earns a monthly income of 5,500 KES. 

Paul is requesting his fourth loan of 60,000 KES from KADET to purchase dairy cows and farm inputs, such as fertilizer, for his family farm. This will help boost his earnings.

In the future, Paul plans to expand his farm and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Fargana

texts.en: Fargana is an active 34-year-old mother of two children. She is engaged in a flower-growing business and cultivates roses. Her husband always helps her to improve their living conditions. The income she earns from this business, which is about 100 USD, allows her to take care of her family. She has a good credit history. Fargana needs to buy seeds, fertilizer, and flowerpots for selling her roses in the central bazaar. Fargana is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to help her with this purchase.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and flowerpots.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is a seamstress. For an additional income, she also sells soft drinks at the Abura market. The refrigerator near her in the picture is the one used to chill the drinks.

Afia has a junior high educational background. She and her husband, who is a farmer, have two children, and both parents help to pay school fees, utility bills, and other family expenses. 

Afia's loan will be used to buy more cloth and lining to sew into clothing to offer for sale. She intends to use the new profits from her business to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and lining to sew into clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Moko

texts.fr:
Moko  est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est divorcée. Elle est maman d’un enfant.
 
Elle travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2008.Elle est distributrice et s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé.

Elle a requis son premier crédit  à WAGES afin de s’approvisionner en pagnes pour répondre aux goûts des acheteurs.
texts.en: Moko is 43 years old. She is divorced and the mother of one child. She has been working at selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) since 2008. She is a distributor and gets her supplies from the Grand Market of Lomé. Moko has requested an initial loan from WAGES in order to stock up on pagne cloth to respond to buyers' tastes.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is 29 years old and still single. She has been running her motorcycle transport business for almost 10 years. 

She works hard because she wants to help her parents by providing for their daily needs. Being a female driver is quite difficult but still she proves to herself that she can make things possible. She enjoys her daily routine as the driver of a motorcycle taxi. 

Aside from transportation business, she also has a business selling vegetables. She has been selling different kinds of vegetables in her village. She would like to buy additional vegetables, but her capital is insufficient, so she is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).

Part of the loan will be used to buy wheels for her motorcycle, and part will be used to buy vegetables such as such as string beans, squash, and eggplant.

She hopes that she can maintain her business to be able to sustain the needs of her parents.

loans.use: to buy wheels and vegetables to improve her retailing and transportation business

loans.name: Zita Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Zita, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  25, 20 y 18 años de edad, los tres estudian en universidad y aun  vive con ella. Su esposo es maestro constructor. Ella aprendió hace varios años corte y confección en una academia en la ciudad de Portoviejo.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo y a confeccionar ropa en su casa, tiene  una maquina de coser en la cual confecciona ropa sobretodo de mujer y de niños, nos cuenta que ella combina ambas actividades ya que al mismo tiempo que sus clientes llegan para que les confeccione prendas de vestir también aprovecha para vendeles la ropapor catalogo, a veces también recorre por el lugar por donde vive. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 21h00 cuando tiene ropa que elaborar. Lleva más de 15 años en sus actividades y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos  y le gusta porque los interese son muy bajos en relación a otros bancos.

Su sueño es tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the members of the Ave Fénix Communal Bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, which is known as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here, we meet Sra. Zita, 49, who is married and has three children, ages 25, 20 and 18. The three study at the university and still live with her. Her husband is a master builder. Several years ago she learned tailoring in an academy in Portoviejo.

She works selling clothes by catalog and that she makes in her home. She has a sewing machine to make clothing, particularly for women and children. She tells us that she combines both activities, for when her customers come to her to have clothes made, she also takes the opportunity to sell them clothing by catalog. She also sometimes canvasses her neighborhood. She works everyday from 8:30 a.m. until 9 p.m. when she has clothes to make. She has spent more than 15 years in this work and she is doing very well.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been in the Communal Bank for 4 loan cycles and she likes it because the interest rates are very low compared to other banks.

Her dream is to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Abduvakos

texts.ru: Абдувакос проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 45 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он у себя дома занимается торговлей. В основном продает сухофрукты. В этой области он уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов сухофруктов.
texts.en: Abduvakos lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 45 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife. He works from home in trade. He sells dried fruit. He has been doing this for fifteen years. He is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of dried fruit.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of dried fruit.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single mother with one child still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She has operated a beauty salon for the past year; her potential customers are her neighbors. In addition she also operates a cloth-selling business which contributes to her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Demand is higher the end of the month than during the rest of the month. She dreams of opening a big beauty salon to accommodate more customers. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its good customer services.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for the beauty salon business.

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Maira  se dedica   a la costura, realiza trabajos para La Paz, también para Santa Cruz, ella confecciona, pantalones, overoles, tiene 24 Años  es madre soltera, tiene un Hijito de 4 Añitos, La madre de la Sra. Maira  falleció hace 5 años, ella vive con su padre, Viven por la zona del Plan 3000, la Sra. Maira trabaja de lunes a sábado, en su propio domicilio ya trabajo con la institución en Banca Comunal, Es una persona responsable con ganas de superación para un buen futuro de su hijito, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de tela, cierres ya  que cuando no tiene pedidos realiza trabajos en su barrio como ser arreglos, colocado de cierres y otros.
texts.en: Maira has a dressmaking business.  She makes pants and overalls that she sells in La Paz and also Santa Cruz.  She is a 24 year-old single mother of a little 4 year-old boy.  Maira's mother died 5 years ago, so she lives with her father.  They live in the Plan 3000 neighborhood.  Maira works Mondays through Saturdays in her own home.  She has already worked in her communal bank with this institution.  She is a responsible person who has a desire to succeed so that she can provide a good future for her little son.  She will use the proceeds from this loan to buy fabric and zippers, because when she does not have orders she does work in her neighborhood doing repairs, putting in zippers, and other sewing.

loans.use: to buy khaki fabric, zippers and embroidery

loans.name: Santos Eduviges

texts.es:
S., necesita un nuevo prestamo para comprar más artículos para la tienda, (arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles) ya que el crédito anterior le sirvió para fortalecer mas su negocio, debido a la demanda que tiene en los meses venideros.
Gracias al crédito anterior, le ayudo a crecer en sus ganancias y a tener productos que antes no tenía, y por medio D. este negocio ha logrado construir otra vivienda, por eso quiere seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
S. needs a new loan to buy more products for her store (rice, sugar, oil and beans).  Her previous loan helped her to further strengthen her business in anticipation of the demand that she will have in the coming months.

S.' previous loan helped her to increase her profits and have products available that she didn't have before.  Through her business, she has managed to build another house.  For this reason, she would like to continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and beans for her business

loans.name: Nancy Amparo

texts.es:
Nancy Amparo pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Nancy Amparo vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Nancy Amparo es la venta de cubre camas, colchas a pedido del cliente. Ella reparte sus productos a sus clientes y le da faciliodades de pago por ejemplo el cliente da una cuota inicial y después de 30 días tiene que cancelar en su totalidad el costo del producto. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Nancy Amparo requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como por ejemplo cubre camas y colchas. 

Nancy Amparo agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Nancy Amparo is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba” which is located in the city of Urubamba. The members of this Communal Bank conduct their meetings every 30 days in the city of Urubamba in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Nancy Amparo lives in the city of Urubamba, which is where she conducts her business activities. Her main business is selling bedspreads and quilts upon request from her customers. She delivers her products to her customers and offers them payment options. For example, a customer can make a down payment and have 30 days to pay the remaining cost of the product. Nancy has been in this business for several years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as bedspreads and quilts.

Nancy Amparo appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads and quilts.

loans.name: Chinarkul

texts.ru: Чинаркул 54 года, замужем и имеет троих детей.  Муж Кадырбек работает ветеринаром. Бизнес в разведении и откорме скота Чинаркул начала со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS), и смогла развить хозяйство с 5 коровами и 60 баранами, приносящее на сегодняшний день около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Бизнес, ставший семейным, имеет хорошую перспективу развития, так как село Асылбаш, где и живет Чинаркул с семьей, является очень хорошим местом для животноводства, так как рядом имеются пастбища для выпаса скота. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота , Чинаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Chinarkul is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband, Kadyrbek, is a veterinarian. Chinakul started her business, breeding and raising livestock, with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS, and has expanded her farm to 5 cows and 60 rams, currently bringing in about 15,000 KGS per month. The farm, which has become a family business, has a promising future. The small town of Asylbash, where Chinarkul lives with her family, is an ideal place to raise animals, as there are many pastures for grazing livestock. With the goal of increasing the amount of livestock further, Chinarkul has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 KGS, to purchase cows. She plans to use the income obtained from investing the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Fifatin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFATIN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Charlotte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Charlotte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Charlotte est mariée à un certain Saliou. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Charlotte vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Charlotte vend depuis cinq ans, des cartes de recharge téléphonique dans un quartier du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Charlotte vend des produits de mercerie. Charlotte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Charlotte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFATIN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group FIFATIN is comprised of three persons who reside in the same district. This is the first time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, named Charlotte, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She did not attend school. She is married to a man named Saliou. They have one child in school to support. Charlotte lives together with her husband and child, and they jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. 

To help cover the diverse expenses, Charlotte has been selling phone recharge cards for five years in a district in Benin. Concurrent to this business, she sells sewing supplies. Her supplies come from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Charlotte and the other members of the group FIFATIN are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards and sewing supplies

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok, 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three single children, is a skillful potter. From this business, she is able to make a profit of $1.50 a day to try and support her family. She is married to Mr. Sim, 39, who is in the business of collecting and selling firewood. He earns $2.50 each day. 

Currently Mrs. Sok is concerned about her mother's funeral because she doesn’t have enough money for it. So she decided to ask for some funds from Kiva and HKL to buy necessary things for the funeral and to pay for the whole ceremony. She would like to say thanks to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for the funeral and pay for the whole ceremony.

loans.name: Francisca Ondina

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 50 años de edad, desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, su negocio está ubicado en el Mayoreo y gracias a este ha podido sostener a su familia. El negocio de venta de verduras es muy rentable ya que cuenta con muchos clientes y también tiene un puesto de ropa usada. 

Francisca está solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de fardos de ropa usada para mujeres, hombres y niños, ya que se aproxima la navidad y necesita surtir su negocio de nuevos estilos para así llamar la atención de las personas y así vender más. 

El mayor deseo de Francisca es aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar y tener un local propio y grande. Este es su tercer préstamo  en FAMA y es una clienta que ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Francisca, 50, has operated a vegetables sales business for 12 years.  The business is located in El Mayoreo and provides an important source of income for her family.  The business is profitable because she has a reliable stream of customers.  Francisca also sells used clothing.  

She is applying for this loan so that she can buy bulk supplies of used clothing--men's, women's and children's--to stock her business before Christmas.  Providing a wider range of merchandise will attract customers and, in turn, increase demand.

Francisca's goal is to increase her income and, in turn, improve her family's economic standing.  She wants to open a store where she can sell her merchandise.  This is her third FAMA loan and she has repaid past loans on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her used clothing business.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en:
Delfin is married. His wife's name is Rebecca. They have two children. Delfin has his own business; he is engaged in farming.

Delfin grows agriculture crops such as rice and corn. He likes this business, and he wants to develop it. Delfin is industrious, enterprising, and goal oriented. This business is the main source of income for Delfin's family.

Delfin is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. The loan will help him increase profits and improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia, de 29 años de edad, ella es una mujer alegre y laboriosa y esta casada con Mauth de 32 años y fruto de ello tienen 04 hijos y viven en su propia casa. Olimpia, es muy empeñosa en sus labores y con ese optimismo que tiene decidió tener su propio negocio. Desde hace 09 años vende ropa importada al gusto del cliente y lo realiza con mucha vitalidad, porque es de su agrado. Para ella es más fácil tener su negocio cerca de su casa, porque le ahorra tiempo para realizar el desayuno y el almuerzo para su familia.
Lo bueno de su negocio, es que cuenta con cantidad de clientes que llegan por si solos sabiendo que encontraran las prendas  adecuadas. El éxito de su negocio radica en el buen trato y ofrecer su mercadería a precios módicos. Con el apoyo del crédito viajará a la ciudad de lima para comprar variedad de prendas. Posteriormente para el buen ingreso de su economía piensa en incrementar mayor cantidad de ropa para venderlo en un centro comercial. Este es crédito número 10 con MFP, por lo cual se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas y esta vez espera contar con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir progresando. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar mayor cantidad de ropa para incrementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Olimpia, 29, is a cheerful, hardworking woman married to Mauth, 32; they have four children and they live in their own house.  Olimpia is very dedicated to her work and with this optimism decided to have a business of her own.  For the last nine years she’s been selling imported clothing according to the taste of her customers and she does this with much energy because she enjoys it.  For her, it’s easier to have her business near her home because she saves time to prepare breakfast and lunch for her family.

What’s good about her business is that it has a good number of customers that come by on their own knowing that they will find the adequate articles of clothing.  The success of her business resides in the good service and in selling her wares at affordable prices.  With the loan’s support she will travel to the city of Lima to buy a variety of clothing.  Later on, to increase income she plans to increase the amount of clothing to sell it in a shopping center.

This will be MFP loan #10 and she commits to continue making her installment payments punctually; she hopes to have support from lenders to continue making progress.  She will use the 2000 new soles to buy larger amounts of clothes to enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, su esposa se encarga del cuidado de la casa, tienen tres adolescentes varones  que ya cuentan con empleo propio y una adolescente de 16 años quien es estudiante.
El comenta que se dedica a la venta de Carbón, empezó este rubro hace mas de 10 años trabajando en sociedad con su hermano, actualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, cuenta con un galpón cargado con bolsitas de carbón, el mismo se encarga de envasar y vender por la zona para lo cual dispone de una camioneta. Sueña con ser uno de los distribuidores mayoritarios de la zona, pero comenta que para eso necesita de más capital lo que le motivo a  acudir a la ayuda crediticia de fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, y de esa forma poder abastecerse y tener más del producto en stock.
texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and married.  His wife is in charge of taking care of the house.  They have 3 adolescent boys who already have their own jobs, and a 16 year-old who is a student. 

Juan comments that he specializes in the sale of coal.  He started out in this line of work more than 10 years ago, working alongside his brother.  He now works on his own.  He has a shed that is filled with small bags of coal.  He is in charge of packaging the coal and selling it in the area, and he has a truck available for this purpose.  He dreams of becoming a major distributor in the area, but he comments that to do this he needs more capital.  This is what motivated him to turn to the credit assistance of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

He requests a loan to buy coal, and in this way increase his inventory so that he will have more product in stock.

loans.use: to buy coal to later sell

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita de 57 años está casada con Zenón. Ella habita un hogar propio al lado de su esposo y de 2 hijos, y se ubica en un distrito de la selva central. Felicita es una mujer que no se cansa. En el calor de su hogar realiza la actividad que le agrada: la preparación de diferentes platos de comida. Siempre ve oportunidades para iniciar un negocio. Cuando sus hijos tuvieron mayores necesidades en el estudio tenía que ingeniárselas para generar más ingresos y no depender solo del sueldo de su esposo. De esa manera empezó preparando dulces tradicionales como las “Chapanas”, que se elaboran a base de harina de yuca y azúcar; pero lo que más vende son los tamales, hechos con maíz molido y relleno de carne; así también, platos de patasca (sopa tradicional concentrada de menudencias de res o carnero), “La base aérea me hace pedidos de platos típicos todos los domingos, no me puedo quejar, me va bien“, comenta orgullosa, pero para ello tiene que despertarse temprano para prepararlos. Ya se acostumbró a la rutina y ya cuenta con clientes fijos, a quienes distribuye los alimentos. 
Éste mes adquirió a crédito una máquina moledora de maíz, con la que prepara con mayor facilidad sus alimentos. Por elo requiere del prestamo para terminar de pagarlo.
texts.en:
Fifty-seven year old Felicita is married to Zenón.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children, in a district of the central forest.  

Felicita is a tireless woman.  In the warmth of her home, she does what she enjoys:  preparing various food dishes.  She always sees opportunities to start a business.  When her children had greater needs for their education, she had to come up with ways to generate more income and not depend only on her husband's salary.  In this way, she began preparing traditional sweets such as "chapanas," that are made with a yucca flour and sugar base.  However, what she sells the most are tamales, made with ground corn and a meat filling, as well as "patasca" (a traditional soup consisting of beef or sheep giblets). 

"The air base places orders with me for typical dishes every Sunday.  I can't complain, it's going well for me," she says proudly.  But for this, she has to wake up early to prepare the dishes.  She is now used to the routine and has regular customers to whom she distributes food.  

This month she got a corn mill on credit, which makes her food preparation easier.  She needs your help to pay for this machine.  This would be her 12th loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her monthly payments.  Her community bank is "Las Heliconias" (The Heliconias), where she is president and enjoys working with responsible partners.  She will invest the money to pay for the electric corn mill to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy an electric corn mill.

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Yeanoh. She is widowed and has three children, ages 10, 6, and 18 years. In 203, Yeanoh established her provisions business. She began her business because she lost her husband, and needed a source of income to take responsibilities of her family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 750,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Yeanoh requires a loan in order to purchase more provision for resale. In the future, Yeanoh plans to build a dwelling house for her business and give quality education to the children. Competition and rainy season are her current business challenges in this business. She thanks you for helping her and wishes you well.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: 02060326 Thôn Đại Giang _ Xã Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Quyền operates a food stall selling fish. Quyền has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main hardship that Quyền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is applying for a loan to purchase more tools for fishing.

Quyền is 26 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 02060326 Thôn Đại giang _ xã Hoằng Châu solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. She lives with no dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Quyền first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profits, Quyền hopes to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more tools for fishing

loans.name: Barrio Lindo I Group

texts.es:
Angelica es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 13 años y su negocio es la venta de abarrotes.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘El Torno’ área rural caracterizada por acopiar la mayor parte de la producción agrícola del lugar, donde existe un gran comercio de frutas, carne, semillas, insecticidas y demás materiales agrícolas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Angelica es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico mediano (sentada al centro viste blusa rosa), su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza, si vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica no tiene agua potable ni alcantarillado porque los servicios no llegaron al lugar. El sueño de mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de comida, servicio de moto taxi, venta de refrescos hervidos, taller de cerrajería, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de frutas. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, ella cuenta con una tienda dónde expone a la venta productos como harina de yuca, fideos, maíz, trigo, arroz, azúcar, y otros para ser vendidos por peso al menudeo, “el clima húmedo que tenemos no nos permite almacenar los alimentos por mucho tiempo, es por esos que los insumos de cocina se venden a diario y al menudeo…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque las ventas son al menudeo y diariamente. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus productos no se malogran por la venta continua, la desventaja es la falta de variedad de abarrotes. Su sueño es estabilizar las venta de su negocio , ella desea comprar variedad de abarrotes por mayor para vender al menudeo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Angelica solicita un préstamo para comprar variedad de abarrotes para vender al menudeo por las fiestas de año nuevo.

loans.use: para comprar variedad de abarrotes para vender al menudeo por las fiestas de año nuevo.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is married with 4 children, 2 are in primary school. He started business 3 years ago and he received first loan of $ 143 from Pemci which he paid very successfully. He has requested for a second loan of $450 to enable him buy more cattle for trading during the festive season. He also supplies the local community with meat and milk. The income from this business has enabled him to support his family and purchase more land. He is planning to build rental houses in future.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs Stella I. is 53 years old woman with six (6) children. She sells foodstuffs for the community. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the above amount for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
In the city of Victoria, in the state of Tamaulipas, lives Amalia. She is married and has four children. Although her husband works as an accountant, she saw the need to obtain extra income, so she started her own business ten years ago, selling tamales. At first she just sold them to neighbors and relatives, and from their recommendation was able to start selling in greater quantity. In the business she gets help from her children with sales and taking orders, and together they have made this business grow.

Amalia wants to continue growing, and in order to increase her sales she wants to improve the condition of her location so that she can offer better service to her customers. For this she is requesting a loan of $925, which she will repay over a period of 6 to 12 months. Without a doubt, you can be a fundamental part of the life of this family and the growth of their business. Please decide to support them.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

En la ciudad de Victoria, Tamaulipas vive Amalia, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, aunque su esposo trabaja como contador, veía la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra por lo que inició su propio negocio hace 10 años con la venta de tamales, en un principio solo vendía entre vecinos y familiares, y por recomendación de ellos empezó a vender a mayoreo. En el negocio recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en las ventas y entregar los pedidos, juntos han hecho crecer el negocio.

Amalia desea continuar creciendo y para incrementar sus ventas quiere abrir un local mejor acondicionado donde podrá ofrecer un servicio de mayor calidad a sus clientes, para esto solicita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares, ella se promete regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en la vida de esta familia y en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Any Xiomara

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Any Xiomara A. and I have had a business selling tortillas for three years. I now need to buy more corn, limes, milk and a mill to grind the corn. I support my family with this business and I hope that you can help me buy the things that I need this month.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Any Xiomara A., yo tengo un negocio de venta de tortillas hace 3 años. Ahora necesito comprar mas maiz, cal, leche y un molino para poder moler el maiz. Con este negocio yo mantengo a mi familia, el cual me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder compar las cosas que necesito para este mes.

loans.use: To purchase corn, limes, salt and a mill

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
"I need to extend two rooms in my house as they are very small and there is very little room for my family." I would like a loan of $500.00 to make these rooms bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Necesito ampliar dos cuartos de mi vivienda ya que son muy pequeños y el espacio para mi familia es muy reducido” Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para ampliar los cuartos.

loans.use: To extend 2 rooms/Ampliación de dos cuartos

loans.name: Yuyun

texts.en: Yuyun is 39 years old and is married with four children. She is a tailor along with her husband. She usually earns a small income and it's just enough for their daily needs. During summertime, her potential profits increase with the season. Yuyun requests IDR 500,000 to expand her business and this will provide income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months

loans.use: Expand her business and this will provide income for her children's education.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sat, 30, and her husband, Uch Ath, have been married since 1999. They have two children who are studying in the local school. Sat has been a weaver since she was 19 years old. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her husband is a construction worker and does farming. He is growing rice and planting mushrooms. Both husband and wife have not finished secondary school.

Sat is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $600. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials for weaving and buying rice seed for her husband to grow rice.

loans.use: Buying silk materials for weaving and rice seed

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en: I am Mariam S., and I live in a lush green small town called KRK, Pakistan. I am a mother of ten, and we have a family business of milk sales. Last year, I bought a cow for my business with the loans we received from Asasah, a microfinance institution. I want to increase the milk production to increase our income, therefore, we need a loan. I am a guarantor of a few more women in my neighborhood, and they are: Maqbool B., who requires loan to buy a cow; Zarina B., who will invest the loan in their beetle nut shop; and Rani B. who needs a loan to expand her milk business.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Chidi

texts.en: Chidi O. is 31 years old, single and lives in Benin City. He has been a LAPO member for 2 years. He sells cosmetics and has been in this business since 1997. This is a business he learned for 8 years. He needs the loan amount of $1200 to enable him to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits to restock a small store.

loans.name: Enma Elisa

texts.es:
Enma has been a member of the Spring Communal Bank for eight months, where she learned to run her business. In this new cycle she will assume the position of President in her Communal Bank.

Enma is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and expecting is her first child. She travels the center of the city of Ayacucho, selling orange juice. With a loan, Enma will be able to open a seafood restaurant with her husband.

Enma needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will use to buy tables, chairs, plates, and to pay rent.

Enma dreams of having a large seafood restaurant, so that her children can grow up to be professionals and she can finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Enma pertenece al Banco Comunal Primavera hace 8 meses, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a como administrar su negocio, en este nuevo ciclo ella asumirá el cargo de presidenta de su Banco Comunal.

Enma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Enma vende jugo de naranja de manera ambulante en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Enma con el préstamo que obtendrá aperturará una cebichería junto a su esposo.

Enma necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas, sillas, platos y pago del local que alquilará para la cebichería.

Los sueños de Enma son tener una marisquería grande, sus hijos sean profesionales y terminar de construir su casa.

loans.use: Enma needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will use to buy tables, chairs, plates, and to pay rent.

loans.name: Publio

texts.es:
Investment of First Loan:

Publio could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demands of his clients. That is to say he was able to buy everything in time, finishing his crop as expected and marketing all his product.

Development of Business:

The 3 hectares that he possesses have permitted him to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but also related products, as for example corn. Around thirty years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of his products.

Personal information:

Publio is 50 years old. He is married. He has 3 children, of which only one of them is in school. His dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of his aspirations is to buy more hectares of land to have more production

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan he will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of his location is that it is in the high part of this coastal sector.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11785

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Publio pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 3 hectáreas que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. Casi 30annos de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Publio tiene 50 años. Es casado. Tiene 3 hijos, solo uno de ellos estudia. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es comprar mas hectáreas de tierra para tener mas producción

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11785

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to continue investing in his land.

loans.name: Ni Putu Wartini

texts.id:
Ni Putu Wartini is in the business of pig farming. From her 1st loan with Dinari, she bought a breeding pig. She was able to earn a net profit of IDR 1 million in a 6 month period (around USD 112). However she feels that this income is still not enough to help her meet her family's needs. Therefore she is applying for the 2nd loan. She is planning to have 3 breeding pigs and she hopes she can sells the piglets 3 times in the next 6 months.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha Yang dirintis Ni Putu Wartini yaitu beternak babi karena usaha ini dapat berkembang cocok dengan lingkungannya. Dalam periode pinjaman ini Ni Putu Wartini masih memelihara 1 ekor induk babi, Keuntungan yang didapatnya dalam enam bulan dapat mencapai Rp 1.000.000.- .yang didapat dari penjualan bibit babi. Dalam setiap bulannya Ni Putu Wartini harus menyisihkan uang untuk biaya pemberian pakan ternaknya sekitar Rp.100.000,- Dari penghasilan 1 ekor induk babi ini, dirasa kurang mencukupi untuk biaya hidupnya. Karena itu, dalam pinjman kedua ini Wartini berencana memelihara tiga ekor induk babi dengan harapan dalam enam bulan Ni Putu Wartini dapat panen tiga kali dalam enam bulan, sehingga pendapatna keluarganya pun akan meningkat.

loans.use: To buy breeding pig (Membeli induk babi)

loans.name: Sinatala

texts.en:
Sinatala O. is a 23-year-old married woman with 1 child. Her husband is also self-employed, working as a driver, to provide their family with another means of financial support. She has 2 years of experience in the elei/printing business, and she sells her goods to the village people and business people 6 days per week. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 500 Tala ($208 USD).

She has received 1 previous loan from SPBD. In fact, SPBD loans are Sinatala’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from any of the traditional banks. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to expand and improve her business by purchasing more equipment.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth lives on Avenue No. 5 in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of El Alto [suburb of La Paz]. She is unmarried and lives with her parents.

Elizabeth recently graduated from university. Not having found employment, however, she makes desserts (pastries, cakes, etc.) which she sells in a busy part of the city.

She plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients in bulk to reduce her costs. This is her first loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Elizabeth vive en la Avenida n. 5 de la zona Puerto Mejillone en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres.

Aunque ella es egresada recientemente de la universidad, por la falta de trabajo se dedica a la elaboración de productos de repostería, (masas, queques y otros) los cuales los vende en una zona principal de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para compra de insumos, al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos. Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk (wheat, eggs, yeast, etc.) for confectioner’s business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda D. is a 31-year-old woman. She is married with three kids. Two of the kids are currently in school. Hilda is a resourceful mother. Her daily dream is to be able to work hard enough to provide her kids with a quality education for better future careers.

Hilda owns and operates grocery shop in one of the busy local markets and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. With this loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock.

Hilda hopes to save more to be able to pay her kids' school fees. She is a member of a community group called Ebenezer Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Married with three children who are currently in school, Rachael O. is 43 years old. She sells food like cassava, plantain, maize, bananas etc. in the local market of Nankese in Koforidua, where she lives. She has been selling for the past fifteen years; she has lots of selling experience to win customers. Rachael is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her children with quality educations for their future careers. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock to serve her customers and grow her business. She is a member of the community group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. In this group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock for her food market.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota tiene 59 años, es natural del distrito de Moho y vive con su hija Meri, quien tiene 20 años y es estudiante en un instituto. Como toda mujer fuerte, ha sabido sobrellevar la muerte de su esposo, con su trabajo dedicándole varias horas al día en su atención. El día de Carlota empieza, desde hace ya 20 años, a las 8 de la mañana, cuando debe trasladarse hasta el mercado para abrir su pequeño puesto de venta de ropa para niños. Según Carlota, su trabajo es muy bonito, ya que siempre está en contacto con los niños, llevado por sus mamás para probarles la ropa, se le alegre el corazón con tantos niños, por otro lado el permanecer durante casi todo el día en su trabajo es agotador, pero aun así a ella le gusta dedicarse a ello ya que la distrae de su soledad. Carlota quiere que su hija Meri salga toda una profesional para que no sufra lo que ella sufrió y se le abran mayores oportunidades en la vida. Con el dinero que solicita, comprara más ropa de niños para mejorar su venta y hacer que su negocio crezca hasta convertirse en una gran tienda comercial.
texts.en:
Carlota is 59 years old and she is originally from the district of Moho, and she lives together with her daughter Meri. Meri is 20 years old and she is currently attending school. Like a strong woman would, she has been able to pull through the impact of her husband's passing, thanks to her work that takes up her attenion and many hours of her day. For the past 20 years, Carlota's days begin at 8a.m. when she travels to the market to open up her stand to sell children's clothing. According to Carlota, her work is wonderful, especially because she's always around children and their Mom trying on clothes. Her heart is filled with happiness with so many children, but on the other hand to work all day the way she does is very exhausting. But she loves her work nonetheless, taking her away from her loneliness. Carlota wants for her daughter Meri to become a professional so that she may not have to suffer all that she has gone through. She wants her to have better opportunities open up for her in life. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase more kids' clothing to improve her sales and to make her business grow, until she can open a store of her own.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the selection of children's clothing that she sells.

loans.name: Ma De Lourdes Lorenza

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes tiene una estética llama  AIDE la cual la ha trabajado por un lapso de 10 años. Por lo cual le ha ido muy bien, ahora se ve en la necesidad de recurrir  a nosotros para pedir un préstamo para surtir la  estética de mercancía como químicos y utensilios. Nos solicita la cantidad de $7,000 pesos.
La señora  Maria se quiere preparar para esta época navideña la cual es muy solicitada para peinados, tintes, cortes y  planchado de cabello.

Su esposo tiene un taller de refrigeración y entre los dos aportan dinero para el sustento de la familia y con estos ingresos podrán pagar el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes has a beauty salon named AIDE that she has worked at for the past 10 years. It has gone very well and now she asks for a loan to supply the beauty salon with more merchandise such as chemical products and beauty appliances. She asks for an amount of 7,000 pesos. Maria wants to prepare for the Christmas season by supplying products in demand like brushes, hair dyes, hair cuts, and hair straightening. Her husband has a refrigeration shop and together they make enough money to support their family and with this income, they will be able to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chemical products and beauty appliances

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia T. is 32 years old, and married with four children.  Nelia has 97 ducks. Thirty-seven (37) of which are egg layers, which she raises to generate income for the family. She works hard to make her poultry business flourish. Her husband is a farmer who also helps her raise the ducks. Together, they dream of giving all of their children a good future. By sending all of them to school, they believe their children will fulfill their dreams in life.

Nelia needs a loan of $125 to purchase additional ducklings for sale. She also plans to open a store where she can sell eggs directly to customers. In this way, she can increase her profits and address the family's needs. 

CEVI helps Nelia sustain her poultry business through the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that they offer to entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith Alajid raises goats to support her family. Aside from paying the school fees, she was able to pay for the needs of her children as well as their other bills like electricity and water. Her husband  works as a casual employee in the government, but his earnings are not enough to support the family. 

Goats are easy to sell today, so this motivates Judith to do well in her business. That is why she requested a loan from CEVI to purchase additional goats. With this loan, Judith believes she will be able to make a bigger profit and and be better able to support her family.

CEVI helps hardworking people like Judith through their micro-financing program. CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, which helps the clients to improve and grow their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase three goats

loans.name: Elizabeth Benita

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth D. Z. comenzó con el negocio de la venta de ropa y zapatos a crédito, y con el grupo Sureñas, en el cual se encuentra en su décima séptima secuencia conjuntamente con la Sra. Juana Gomez. 
Posteriormente y a la par de su primera actividad instaló una tienda de venta de material de construcción particularmente de pintura y otros productos relacionados con ese rubro, es así que solicita un crédito para incrementar su capital.
La Sra. Elizabeth vive con sus padres y sus dos hijas pequeñas, porque se separó de su esposo hace más de tres años, ella solventa gastos de educación y otros gastos familiares que comparte con sus padres. Desde el año 2004, continúa siendo nuestra cliente responsable y comprometida con la Institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth D. Z. started off with a business selling clothing and shoes on credit, and with the Sureñas group, where she’s in her 17th sequence jointly with Mrs. Juana Gomez. Afterward, and along the lines of her first activity, she opened a shop selling construction materials; primarily paint and related items, and she is asking for a loan to increase her working capital. Mrs. Elizabeth lives with her parents and two young daughters, since she separated from her husband 3 years ago. Her expenses include schooling and other household expenses, which she splits with her parents. She has been a responsible and committed client of our institution since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint

loans.name: Carmelita Rene,

texts.es:
Con sesenta y seis años de edad y a pesar de sus constantes malestares en el cuerpo debido al dolor en sus extremidades inferiores, Carmelita es una persona muy trabajadora y optimista.
Desde hace cuatro años vende condimentos en un mercado grande de su localidad. Anteriormente, también vendía como ambulante pero se dedicaba a la venta de verduras ya que tenía ciertos conocimientos en el rubro. Cuando era mas joven dedicaba todo su tiempo a trabajar una tierra sembrando y cultivando vegetales y también criando ganado.
Se mudó a Lima una vez que se separo de su esposo, se fue a vivir junto a sus hijos mayores. De los doce hijos que Carmelita ha tenido, solo diez de ellos viven. La mayoría ya son independientes y tienen sus respectivas familias. Por ahora Carmelita solo se dedica a manutener a su menor hijo de veintidós años y a su nieta de dieciocho.
texts.en:
Sixty six years old and in spite of the constant ache in her body due to pain in her lower extremities, Carmelita is a very hardworking and optimistic person. She has sold condiments in a big local market for four years. Before, she used to sell vegetables because she had knowledge of the business. When she was younger she used to work the land full time growing vegetables and raising cattle. She moved to Lima once she got separated from her husband, and went to live with her older children. Of the 12 children that Carmelita had, only 10 live. The majority of her children are independent and have their own families. For now Carmelita only takes care of her youngest son that is 22 and her granddaughter who is 18.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorized taxi cart

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes C. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon in Abura. Agnes has received a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher.

Agnes has been a hairdresser since 2008. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of hair products to meet the demand of her customers who come to the salon. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business to further expand her hairdressing business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different hair products for her salon

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
As a widow, F. supports her six children by selling produce from her farm in her community in Bamenda. She will use this loan to purchase seeds for cocoyams, corn, beans, four bags of manure, one bag of fertilizer and for labor to clear and till her farmland.

F. is helping her community by creating employment opportunities on her farm and also by selling her produce at a convenient location for her customers. Prior to her involvement with GHAPE, she was unable to provide an education for her children. She also lost two dear people in her life—her husband and first son.

With the profits of this loan, F. now can provide a better life for her family by paying for their educational fees and books, and expanding her farm! F. appreciates GHAPE's gradual repayment schedule.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buying seeds, corn, beans, manure, fertilizer, and paying for farm labor

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.en:
S. Nurbibi is 30-years-old and is married with three children. Nurbibi runs a family business, a grocery store, and she has an important variety of merchandise which she hopes to strengthen during this warm season with a variety of drinks like juice and soft drinks. With the support of her husband, they have picked their business back up, and it has been the source of income that educates the entire family.

Currently Nurbibi requests $800 for 12 months. The money requested will go towards the purchase of merchandise like soft drinks, juice, ice cream, sweets, detergents and other products.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam Y. is 41 years old. He lives in Penjikent town. He is married and has four children. Uktam processes and sells raisins in the central local market. He purchases raisins from local farmers wholesale and, after processing, sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Uktam to make his business quite successful and provides a stable income for the family. Currently, he needs a loan of $800 to buy supplies so that he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. Uktam expresses his gratitude for everyone who is supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase his range of goods.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo H. is 54 year old entrepreneur and father of nine children. Most of his children are married already. He has a fishing business where he sells different kinds of fish in their village. He started his business using his own money of Php 3,000. Until now, he is still selling fish to be able to raise money for all their needs.

He is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional fish to sell. The loan will help him buy and sell more fish. In that way, he will earn bigger income for his own family.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a dealer in beauty products in their village. Due to lack in financial capital to sustain her business, she was motivated to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. This amount will be of great help in improving her business, since she wants her family have a better way of living.

Cynthia is married to Rogelio and blessed with two children and they are now in college. They are living in the village of Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. Cynthia is aiming to strengthen her direct-selling business because it does not only help her family financially but it also develops her self-confidence and she gains new friends.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris vive en la casa de sus padres con sus 2 hijos pequeños de 8 y 6 años. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de condimentos, se inició con ayuda de sus padres que le enseñaron la dinámica del trabajo y en la actualidad tiene su propio puesto en el mercado principal de su ciudad. Cada mañana se la encuentra atendiendo a sus clientes, ofreciendo desde ajos, pimientos procesados, hasta vinagres y diversos vinos que se utilizan en variedad de platillos. Debido a la calidad y salubridad de sus productos, Doris ha sabido mantener su negocio estable durante estos largos años y con cuyas ganancias ha solventado las necesidades de su familia. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta de participar nuevamente en la experiencia gratificante de ser parte de un banco comunal, donde ha aprendido el valor del ahorro. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería en condimentos no perecibles.
texts.en:
Doris lives in her parents’ house with her two small children who are eight and nine. She has been selling condiments for 12 years. She started with help from her parents who taught her the dynamics of working. She currently has her own stand in the main market in the city. Every morning you can find her waiting on her customers, offering them everything from cloves of garlic, processed pimentos, and vinegars to diverse wines that are used in various dishes. Due to the quality and cleanliness of her products, Doris has known how to keep her business stable for all of these long years. She has used her earnings to pay for the family’s necessities. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP. She is very happy to participate again in the gratifying experience of being part of a community bank. That is where she has learned the value of saving. The money she is asking for is to buy non perishable condiments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Souna

texts.fr: Souna B. est une dame de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente d’huile de palme, d’huile d’arachide et de divers autres produits alimentaires. Elle compte renforcer sa capacité et mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Souna B., age 54, is married and the mother of 2 children. Her business consists in selling palm oil, peanut oil, and various other food products. She intends to bolster her sales capacity to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell palm oil, peanut oil, and various other food products

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en:
Rejina is a member of the kinanambo borrower group In Kinyanambo,Iringa.She is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 16 and 14 years.

Rejina started her own shop business selling rice,cooking oil,wheat 2 years ago.she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Rejina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,wheat,cooking oli.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Rejina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,sugar,wheat

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is a woman who hails from the town of Pililia, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 36-year-old wife to Jose, who is 36 years old and a farmer. They were blessed with five children; three males and two females. All her children are all studying.
In 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with an aspiration to have access to capital for her business. For more than three years already, she is engaged with farming business and she is partnered by her husband. Farming of rice is a common source of livelihood in the upland and lowland villages in the country. Since rice is the staple food  for Filipinos, the demand for its grains is high.
She noticed that farming as a business brings bigger income and it gives her the chance to save and to sustain the needs of her children to school. Farming needs capital especially during cultivation until it grows and bear grains. She wanted to invest more on it.
Now on her 7th loan, she proposes a loan of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her farming business. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for the metal cover of a handtractor and a motor engine to make it run. She is looking forward to send her children to school until they finish college and find jobs. She also aspires of purchasing farm lands in the future to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To pay for the metal cover of a handtractor and a motor engine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Noel

texts.es: El señor Noel V. de 43 años de edad, es taxista con cinco años de experiencia, vive en el barrio 380 de la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, que estudian, ella hace nacatamales para vender y poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos, desde horas muy tempranas don Noel se levanta para dar un chequeo a su taxi para salir brindar el servicio a sus pasajeros. Este es su onceavo crédito en Afodenic y con cada crédito ah mejorado su vivienda, como su unidad de taxi. Con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para terminar de construir la cocina de su casa. Y poder tener la comodidad y aseo en su hogar. Se siente contento por los financiamientos que ha dado la institución ya que solo a través de ellos ha logrado las mejoras necesarias de su vivienda. Y como muchas familias Nicaragüenses poder tener una casa digna para su familia.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion y poder terminar de construir la cosina

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya D.  a 40 ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans sa propre maison à Banconi, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Après une formation de tradi-thérapeute, il s’est vite initié aux activités  d’achat et de vente de produits pharmaceutiques de la pharmacopée chinoises et autres depuis maintenant vingt ans.
