Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources financières nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. Ainsi, il sollicite ce 2ème prêt individuel auprès de Soro Yiriwaso qui lui permettra, d’acheter 4 cartons d’Aloé, 7 cartons de Manames, 8 bidons d’inzam indien, etc.  
Monsieur D. est en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ 2 ans.  Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.  
Il  s’approvisionne auprès de son fournisseur à Koutiala pour venir les revendre à Sikasso dans sa pharmacie située à la gare routière de Sikasso à une clientèle composée des voyageurs et surtout des routiers. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédit. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya D., aged 40, is married and the father of two children.  He lives with his wife and their children in his own house in Banconi, one of the outlying districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  After training in traditional healing, he quickly learned twenty years ago about the business of buying and selling pharmaceutical products and those from the Chinese pharmacopoeia and more.  With such experience in this field, he enjoys a strong reputation and accommodates many orders.  But the financial resources necessary are lacking for satisfying these needs.  Thus, he's requesting this second individual loan from Soro Yiriwaso.  This will enable him to buy 4 boxes of Aloé, 7 boxes of Manames, 8 containers of inzam indien, etc. Mr. D. has had an association with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for about two years.  The preceding loan was properly repaid.  He gets his supplies from providers in Koutiala and sells his goods in Sikasso in his pharmacy located at the Sikasso bus station.  His customers are composed of travelers and especially drivers.  Some of his customers pay in cash, others on credit.  With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that he plans on using to take care of most of his expenses and those of his family and to pay the interest on his loan.  The rest will be invested into his business. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicines (Aloé, Maname, Lipton, etc.)

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou T., 61, is a professional cleaner who started her work eight years ago. She currently does her work at the local hospital and earns a stable salary of US$ 70 each month. She was married, but her husband died of old age. She now has three children who are working in the garment industry.

Ou T. has faced difficulties with sanitation because her house doesn’t have a bathroom. Therefore, Ou T. is requesting a US$ 500 loan to be used to build a new bathroom for her family’s hygiene.

loans.use: To build a new bathroom for her family’s hygiene

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila tiene 53 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia.
Su negocio es la venta de diferentes artículos de uso persona; tales como ganchitos y adornos para el cabello, anillos, hilos, pinzas, etc. Para ellos tiene un puesto en uno de los mercados más concurridos de su distrito. Petronila sale de su casa desde tempranas horas llevando sus productos hasta su puesto y ahí permanece durante casi todo el día. 
Ella se siente contenta y tranquila con su trabajo, ya que le permite obtener buenos ingresos y así puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, ella siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual a la hora de pagar sus cuotas y lo seguirá haciendo así. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para estas fiestas navideñas, cuando la demanda aumenta.
texts.en:
Petronila is 53. She lives with her daughter in her own house. Her business is selling different items for personal use. She sells things like hairpins, hair decorations, rings, thread, and hair clips. She has a stand in one of the most popular markets in her district. Petronila leaves her house in the early hours, takes her products to her stand, and stays there almost all day. She feels happy and at peace with her work. It allows her to get good earnings, and that way she is able to cover the household expenses. This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual when it is time to make her payments, and she will continue to do so. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for the Christmas festivities; this is when demand increases.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Eliava Candiru Grace Group

texts.en:
Grace C. is twenty-eight years of age and married with three school-aged children. She has dealt with fruits such as mangoes, oranges, etc for three years. 

Grace is using the loan to purchase fruits such as mangoes, oranges, sweet bananas and tomatoes to resell. She is an enterprising business lady whose business dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase fruits such as mangoes, oranges, sweet bananas and tomatoes to resell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén Espinoza García es un cliente distinguido de nuestra Institución ya que todos sus pagos se registraron puntuales, anteriormente se le había otorgado un crédito para la mejora de su vivienda,crédito que fue pagado con puntualidad, nuevamente esta tramitando el y su esposa la señora María de la Luz Hernández para iniciar la construcción de un cuarto en un terreno que acaban  de adquirir.
texts.en:
Señor Rubén Espinoza García is a distinguished client at our institution since all his payments have been made on time. In the past, he had been granted a loan to improve his house, a loan that was paid on time. Now he and his wife, Señora María de la Luz Hernández, are negotiating to begin the construction of a room on a piece of land that they have just acquired.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Begin construction of a room

loans.name: Frank

texts.es:
El Sr. Frank vive en la localidad de el torno, es casado, su esposa es la Sra Zulma con la cual tienen un hijo pequeño, el se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros con su mototaxi, la cual es su fuente principal de ingreso, ya que su esposa solo se dedica a cuidar a su hijo; el destino del credito fue para comprar una linea de mototaxi(pertecer a un sindicato tiene un costo elevado muchas veces mas que la moto o que el auto ya que en bolivia hay lineas que tienen mas socios por que muchas personas usan esa linea de tranporte y esto ocaciona que las lineas de tranporte suban sus precios para afiliar asi a mas personas), su deseo es poder comprar su propia casa y un trajajo estable, es una persona  joven trabajadora que esta empezando con la actividad de transporte.

El Sr. Frank esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Frank lives in El Torno. He is married to Zulma and they have a young son. He is a mototaxi driver, which is his main source of income because his wife is a stay-at-home mom. The funds were used to buy into a mototaxi route (to belong to a union is very expensive, sometimes costing more than the mototaxi or the auto itself because in Bolivia there are routes that have more members because many customers use that route; this causes the transportation cooperatives to raise their prices to have more people join). His wish is to be able to buy his own home and to have stable work. He is a young, hard-working man who is just starting out in the public transportation business. Frank is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for placing their trust in him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy into a mototaxi route.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Madame Djeneba Sangaré est une veuve  de 51 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui vit avec ses enfants dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Djeneba, pour des raisons sociales ne fréquenta pas l’école moderne, mais plutôt la medersa.
Ménagère, elle ne s'intéressa réellement aux activités génératrices de revenus qu’après le décès de son mari et cela  pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de mener les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles de boutique. Elle apprit cette activité auprès  d’un des  amis son de son feu mari.  Avec une expérience de 5 ans, elle maîtrise bien cette  activité.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle intègre le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, des articles divers pour sa boutique.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente à une clientèle composée de la population locale, en détail , au comptant et à crédit.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djeneba Sangaré is a 51-year old widow and has nine children. She lives with her children in the Hérémakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For social reasons, Djeneba never went to a modern school, but to a "médersa" (private islamic school which offers a religious education). As a housewife, she became interested in income-generating activities only after her husband died, and then in order to provide for her own needs as well as those of her children. For this reason she decided to run a business selling shop items. She learned this trade with one of her dead husband's friends. Having had five years experience, she now masters the business well. In order to satisfy her sharply increasing customer base better, she has joined the loan programme at Soro Yiriwaso and is on her first individual loan with this company. With the loan she is planning to buy various items for her shop. She stocks up at Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells to a customer base of local people, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA. With this profit she plans to expand her shop.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items for her shop

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 33 years of age, single, and has two children who go to school. She has been operating a cafeteria for two years and has two employees to assist her in the business. She was selling used clothes before she ventured into this business.  She previously took out three loans from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business and pay school fees to her children. She hopes to build her family a house and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested for a loan of KES 80,000 to buy a freezer and renovate her business premise.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and renovate the business premises.

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
la sra. Norma Elena C. R. Se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, calzado y fantasia fina,  actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años, es madre de familia, tiene 1 hijo.
Con los ingresos que le genera su negocio, le permite suplir algunos gastos personales y de su hijo, de esta forma 
contribuye en el hogar a su esposo ya que en estos tiempos si se desea salir adelante se tiene que esforzarse y trabajar el hombre y la mujer, echarle para adelante.
El credito lo utilizara para comprar mas ropa, calzado y joyeria.
texts.en:
Norma Elena C. R. is a retailer; she has a small clothing, shoes and fine costume jewelry sales business. She has been in this line of work for over 3 years. Norma is the mother of a son. Earnings from her business make it possible for her to meet some personal expenses as well as those of her son. In this way, she adds to her husband’s contribution to family expenses because nowadays, to get ahead, both husband and wife have to work. She will use the funds to buy more clothing, shoes and jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yiriwa est composé de huit  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent ensemble dans le village de Dougounikoro dans la préfecture de Barouéli (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. 
Le groupe Yiriwa fait le commerce d’articles divers : encens,  savons,  tasses de marque inox, pâte d’arachide, galettes à bases de mil, du thé et des cartes de recharge téléphonique. 
Elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso  dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et sont à leur 3ème  prêt de groupe.
Madame Fatoumata S. qui excelle dans la vente de la pâte d’arachide compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs de grains d’arachide.  Elle s’approvisionne en arachide en gros à la foire de Konodimini.
 Pour préparer la pâte d’arachide, les gousses d’arachides sont décortiquées (à la mains),  débarrassées de ses décoctions, elle trie les meilleures graines pour les griller, après  les amène au moulin pour broyage. La pâte ainsi obtenue est prête pour être  vendue dans des petits seaux ou en détail dans des sachets en  plastiques, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, à domicile et à Ségou ville, au comptant et à crédit parfois. 
 Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, Madame Fatoumata S. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour la scolarisation des enfants et réinvestir  le reste dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Yiriwa group is made up of eight women, mostly married and living in monogamous families, and are on average 37 years old and have four children. They live together in the village of Dougounikoro in the Barouéli prefecture (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through family and marriage ties. The Yiriwa group deals in various products: incense, soap, stainless steel cups, peanut butter, cookies made from millet, tea, and telephone cards. They decided to get involved with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of increasing their working capital, and they are on their third joint loan. Mrs. Fatoumata S., who is quite successful at selling peanut butter, plans to use her loan to buy five sacks of peanuts. She gets her peanuts wholesale at the market in Konodimini. To make peanut butter, the peanuts are shelled (by hand), she selects the best peanuts for grilling and then takes them to the mill for grinding. The resulting peanut butter is ready to be sold in small pots or at retail in small plastic bags. Her clientele consists mainly of women who buy from her home and in the town of Ségou, who pay in cash and sometimes on credit. Like the other members of the group, Fatoumata S. hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35, 000 FCFA which will used to pay for their children’s schooling and to reinvest in their business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Phanna D., 25, and her husband, Mr. Mun Khoem, 30, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2004 and have a young son.
Phanna has been a silk weaver for eight years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a security guard for three months. Phanna is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida B. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Elida is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Elida owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of daily use products in the local community. Elida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000  PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Elida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maritza Oristila

texts.es:
la señora Maritza Oristila F. D. tiene 23 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jesus Dinelio Moran Bonilla tienen dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y Maritza a la venta de queso, mantequilla, cuajada, tambien hace pan  y tamales.
las ganancias que le genera este negocio las necesita para poder salir adelante junto con su familia. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra del producto lacteo que ella vende y tambien para comprar los materiales para hacer los panes y los tamales.

su deseo es poder darles una mejor calidad de vida y estudios a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza Oristila F. D. is 23, married to Jesus Dinelio Moran Bonilla and they have two children. Her husband works in agriculture and Maritza sells cheese, butter and curd, and also makes bread and tamales. The earnings generated from this business are needed for her and her family's success. The loan will be used for the purchase of the dairy products that she sells and also for the purchase of materials for making bread and tamales. She wants to give a better quality of life and education to her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cheese, butter, corn, firewood

loans.name: Ruth Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth Ordóñez es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive en la comunidad de Cochapamba la misma que es reconocida por su belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población joven ha emigrado en busca de mejores días para sus familias.

La Señora Ruth tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo labora como albañil, tiene casa propia la misma que le han construido gracias al esfuerzo de los dos.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la costura, actividad que fue inculcada por su madre, trabaja junto con ella realizando pantalones y son socias en el taller. Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo realizando los créditos en la fundación Espoir,  su nuevo crédito  lo va  a invertir en la compra de tela para la elaboración de pantalones, su meta es comprar más maquinas para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth Ordóñez is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Amigas” (Friends Forever). She lives in the community of Cochapamba, which is known for its natural beauty. The people earn their living raising animals and farming. Most of the younger residents have emigrated in search of better days for their families.

Ruth is 26 years old, married, and has a seven year old son who attends the local school. Her husband works as a mason. Thanks to both of their efforts, they were able to build their own house.

Ruth works as a seamstress and learned the trade from her mother. They work together making trousers and are partners in running their shop. Ruth is in her third loan cycle with Fundación ESPOIR. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of fabric for making trousers. Her goal is to buy more machines in order to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making trousers

loans.name: Maria Tomasa Amalia

texts.es:
Señora María Tomasa Amalia S. B. es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, que se encuentra ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería,  lo que producen es para su consumo. La población femenina se dedica al tejido  de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al bordado de polleras (faldas) y blusas.

Nuestra socia tiene 51 años de edad,vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos, su primera hija es casada, la segunda es soltera y trabaja, las dos viven independientemente, vive con su pequeña hija de 8 años y su esposo se dedica a la construcción, con el trabajo de los dos  han  logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a la cría de  animalitos como: pollos, cuyes, chanchos y ganado, con la leche que obtiene de sus vaquitas hace quesillos (queso tierno) para la venta,  también se dedica a la agricultura y los productos los vende  en su propia comunidad.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del banco comunal Zhidmad y los créditos le han servido para adquirir sus animales, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ganado.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Tomasa Amalia S. is a member of the Zhidmad Communal Bank. Zhidmad is located in the southwestern area of the Gualaceo canton. Its people engage in agriculture and stockbreeding, and what they produce is for their own consumption. Women also weave Panama hats made from the fibers of the “toquilla” plant, produce woolen sweaters and embroider “polleras” (a type of skirt) and blouses. Tomasa is 51 years old, she lives in a common law marriage and has three children. Her eldest daughter is married, the second is single and has a job of her own, and they both independently; Tomasa lives with her youngest daughter, aged 8, and her husband, who engages in constructions. Thanks to hers and her husband’s joint efforts, they have succeeded in building a house of their own. She engages in housework and in the breeding of small animals such as chickens, “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), pigs and cows. With the milk she gets from her cows she prepares fresh cheese that she then sells; she also engages in agriculture and sells her products to her own community. She is one of the charter members of the Zhidmad Communal Bank, and she has used the loans to buy her animals; the new loan she is requesting will be used to buy more cattle. Her goal is making her activity grow.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Q. M. tiene 58 anos. Es casado y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene siembras de maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas.

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Esta préstamo lo ayudaria en mejorar la situación economica de gastos de insumos para la agricultura. Espera seguir adelante y tener una casa propia. Un desafio que se enfrenta a la familia es que fallecio dos de sus hijos. 

No tiene mucho tiempo libre. Enfoca en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos Q. M. is 58 years old. He is married and lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. He has 3 children. Carlos is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús solidarity group. There are 15 members altogether, who are mainly farmers. Carlos is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He makes purchases and product sales in Ventanas. He is asking for the loan for his farming. This loan would help him improve his economic situation for buying farm supplies. He hopes to get ahead and have his own house. A challenge the family faces is that two of his children passed away. Carlos does not have much free time. He focuses on his work.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet owns a stall in Kisaasi market selling Irish potatoes. In addition to this business, she is a part-time teacher in a nearby primary school. Annet has been in business for two years. She sells to all categories of people on wholesale. She wants to use her loan to buy more bags of Irish potatoes. She buys bags of potatoes from Kasese district and uses public transport to and from Kasese. She works seven days a week and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges include transportation and defaulters.
Annet's aspiration is to see her business grow bigger and to make enough profits to buy a delivery van. She decided to join Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, because it brings services nearer to her.
Annet is married with one child who is not yet in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in and owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is from the village of Polo. She is 43 years old. Teresita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita operates a family member's fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling river-caught fish in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase house materials. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie N. lives in the Kanyanya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child,  who is in school.  She also takes care of additional family member’s mother.

Sophie has a business of a pub.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sophie sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  Sophie has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer.

She also generates additional income through selling breakables like cups, plates and glasses.The main business challenge for Sophie include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a beer depot and also build rental houses. She decided to join MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital. Sophie lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina;  La socia tiene 33 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos 15,13,9,4,; La socia  trabaja sembrando y cosechando sus tierras ella es agricultora como actividad principal. La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar semilla para sembrar maíz y papas, ella también comprara abono para la tierra. La socia solicita el préstamo para sembrar maíz y comprar abono.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the communal bank "SR. OF TANTAMARCA". This bank is located in the district of Chicon, in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco. Justina is 33 years old, she is a single mother of four children, aged 15,13, 9 and 4. She is a farmer and her work is to plant and harvest her land. Justina requests a loan to buy corn and maize seeds as well as potatoes to plant; she will also buy fertilizer for the soil. 
Justina acknowledges and appreciates the loan through this medium and she also takes the commitment to meet the payment deadlines of her rates.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra.Francisca M. es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene tres años trabajando en una empresa como cajera, su esposo el señor Jose tambien labora en una empresa de seguridad entre los dos han ido mejorando el aspecto de su casa, ya que ha ambos les gusta tener un hogar agradable y confortable, el credito que solicito es para colocar puertas mas seguras y telas mosquiteras debido a que las puertas que tiene no son muy seguras y viendo su seguridad y proteccion de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca Méndez is a very hard working woman.  She has been working as a Cashier for three years.  Her husband, José, works for a security firm and together they have been improving their home’s appearance since both enjoy having a pleasant, comfortable home.

The requested loan is to install more secure doors and screens because the doors currently installed aren’t very secure and they want to provide security and protection for the home.

loans.use: To install doors and screens.

loans.name: Patrick Maingi

texts.en:
Patrick Maingi M. has been in the business of livestock trading for 10 years. He buys livestock, rears it, and  sells it later at a profit. He earns a profit of Kshs.40,000 per month.  He is 40 years old and married to Kanini, and together they have five children aged between 20 years and 10 years old. The business   location is in  Matuu and  he has many customers since his sales take place in the open air market in Matuu. 

M. has no history with any other MFI and he is applying for his third loan of Kshs. 40,000 from KADET LTD after paying back the previous loans successfully. The purpose for this loan is to buy four cows to rear and sell later at a profit. 


He plans to use the anticipated profit to educate his children and also provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La  Sra. De Los Wilma es casada, tiene dos  hijos,   en edad escolar .
Ella  tiene una pequeña despensa  en el Barrio San Jose , cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso .

Con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que se merece  el apoyo necesario. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de fideos, harina, azúcar, aceite, arroz, y otros.
texts.en: Ms. De Los Wilma is married and has two school-aged children. She has a despensa [small grocery store] in the San Jose neighborhood, which is consistently growing and bringing in good profits. With the help of her husband and her entire family, and with much effort and sacrifice, she is getting ahead. Today she is a successful small businesswoman who, thanks to her friendliness, has customers who are faithful and numerous. She has shown herself to be a responsible and honest person when it comes to her commitments, and therefore deserves the support she needs. She is requesting a loan to buy noodles, flour, sugar, oil, rice, and other products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her small grocery store, such as flour, rice, noodles, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 35-year-old single man from Nabatieh. Since 2002, he has run a business selling clothes and shoes. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new collection of clothes and shoes for the Holly season. Hussein’s products are of a good quality and his prices are affordable to people in his region. His customers like to buy from his shop because he offers good customer service. Hussein puts his customers first and seeks perfection in his work. He dreams of opening a big shop or new branches in the region.

loans.use: To buy new clothes and shoes collection for the Holly season

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 57 years old and married, and has 5 children. To make a living, Emma plants and harvests rice to sell. Emma is hoping for her harvest to increase.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Gnetaga Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe GNETAGA sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles monogames à MAMASSONI  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien soldés. Elles font  de la restauration et l’achat vente  des fruits et légumes tel AICHATA T.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 5 paniers de fruits et légumes.  Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs et quelques fois au grand marché de  la ville de Sikasso auprès des grossistes.
Elle vend aux marchés, à domicile, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle compte avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  pouvoir aménager son coin de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the group GNETAGA are essentially married women averaging 36 years of age and three children living in monogamous families in MAMASSONI, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.  The previous loans have all been settled.  

The group members are active in food service and in the buying and selling of fruit and vegetables, as in the case of Ms. AICHATA T..  With her new loan, she plans on buying 5 baskets of fruit and vegetables.  She gets her supplies from farmers and sometimes at the big market in Sikasso City from wholesale merchants.  Accepting cash and sometimes credit from her customer base composed of men and women, she sells at markets and out of her home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be put into savings.  The other part will be invested in her business.  She is counting on having more capital in order to satisfy her customers more and to fix up her sales location.

loans.use: Buying fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Verónica Mercedes

texts.es:
Verónica Mercedes C. F., tiene 26 años, es soltera con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Verónica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta reunirse con las vecinas.
texts.en:
Verónica Mercedes C. F. is 26 years old, she is single and she lives with her children in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos Province. She has 3 children.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto (Valle Alto Communal Bank) is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; this group engages in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Verónica engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys and sells the products in Ventanas and in the Comercial Peña, and she also sells them every day at her house or in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of buying a house.

She likes getting together with her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Hajara has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.
To help expand her business, Hajara has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hajara hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Hajara is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to have more business capital by receiving a loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal, fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Hmayak

texts.en:
Hmayak T. is 30 years old. He lives with his parents and his wife in Lchashen village near Sevan. He has a general secondary education and for ten years he has been engaged in animal husbandry. With his family's assistance, Hmayak raises cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Due to the income from his farming, Hmayak has supported his family’s needs, increased his numbers of livestock and bought a truck, which he uses for transporting fodder. 
     
Hmayak is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El Señor José Antonio tiene 32 años. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Este negocio comenzó por su Padre que le enseño a manejar con el paso del tiempo este negocio le gusto a José ya que además tenía que mantener a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos, llantas, entre otras mejoras. Sus deseos son de conseguir otra bicicleta para trabajar y así proporcionarle a su familia esta fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Mr. José Antonio is a 32-year-old man whose business is providing tricycle taxi services. He has been in business for over 7 years. This business was started because of his father, who taught him how to ride. As time passed, José started to like the business, plus, he had to support his family. This loan will be used as working capital to purchase spare parts, tires, and other maintenance items. He hopes to purchase another tricycle so that he can work, thus providing his family with another source of income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso 4 Group

texts.en:
Deyanira is the group coordinator for the "Esperanza y Progreso 4" (Hope and Progress) in San Pedro de Macoris. They are five members that are requesting their second or third loan; all of them have been in this group for one year or more. Deyanira is receiving her third loan, after having successfully repaid and invested every loan in her business. 

Deyanira lives with her long-term partner. She is a young woman and her business is selling clothes. She will use this loan to purchase more varieties. Her dream is to have a wholesale store and to live well and safe in her own house. Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: La señorita Roció vive en  la zona de canal, vive en alquiler es soltera, ella realiza la venta de anticuchos en Cochabamba en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad, ella realiza su venta de lunes a viernes , ella vive con su madre señora mayor  de edad , el préstamo lo invertirá para comprar accesorios de cocina y una parrilla nueva más grande, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora siempre pensando en superase salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, su deseo es el poder alquilar un lugar y abrir su pensión para así poder brindar mejor atención a sus clientes, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en: Rocío lives in the Canal area, is single, and lives in a rented home.  She sells anticuchos (grilled meat kebabs) in Cochabamba on one of the city’s central streets.  She makes her sales from Monday to Friday.  She lives with her elderly mother.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of cooking accessories and a new, larger grill.  Rocío is a young and hardworking person who is always thinking about getting ahead in life and improving her quality of life.  She wants to be able to rent a place and open a guesthouse in order to provide better service to her customers.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy cooking accessories and a new grill

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has more than 30 years of experience working with home appliances. In 1984, he launched his own business where he began dealing in air conditioners. He purchases his products from a local electric center. 

His work consists in selling both used and new AC units in addition to repairing damaged ones.  His wife has been working as a teacher in a local school for 18 years to provide extra financial support for the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more products. He is planning to strengthen his commercial operation to end up with increased sales and higher income.

loans.use: to buy more products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is not currently in school. Christine has a small beauty salon, which she has had for 2 years. She also has a second business selling soft drinks.

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase braids, soda and splash for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Christine hopes to own a poultry firm. 

Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save more money.

loans.use: to purchase braids, soda and splash for resale.

loans.name: Noel Perpetuo

texts.es:
El señor Noel Perpetuo Ramírez Salgado tiene 5 años de estar laborando Con CEPRODEL-El sauce, como Deudor Principal de dichos créditos otorgado, cuenta con 4 hijos bajo su cargo 2 estudian y los otros dos trabajan en conjunto en su finca, es su crédito numero 5 lo cuales todo han sido invertido en la ganadería. 
Cuenta con una propiedad de 87 MZ propia de terreno, donde la desarrolla para la explotación ganado lechero, novillo de engorde y agricultura.  
Se dedica a la actividad de agricultura y ganadería la inversión la realizo con el objetivo de comprar 6 novillos para el desarrollo  con el propósito de tener una mayor fuente de ingresos y mejorar su  trabajo, para así obtener mejores ingresos y abastecer las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Noel Perpetuo Ramirez Salgado has been with Ceprodel-El Sauce for the past 5 years. He is the principal holder of the loans. He has 4 children in his care. Two are in school and the other two are work with him on his land. This is his 5th loan and they have all been invested in cattle livestock. He has a land that is 87 hectares in size and he uses to support his dairy cattle, beef cattle, and he also uses it for agriculture. He is a farmer and an agriculturist. He invested with the objective of purchasing 6 calves to raise in order to increase his source of income and to improve his business. This way he will be able to increase his income and he will be able to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 42, resident of Guadanoville, Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a mechanic, and she is a mother to four children, two of whom are already studying in college and the other two are in high school. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Helen earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Helen hopes to be able to expand her business soon and be able to send all of her children all the way through college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items needed for her variety store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 37 years old lady, married to Peter, and they have three children aged between six and ten years. Janet operates a cereal stall from which she sells mainly maize and other cereals, plus assorted fruits on the sides. She has been doing this for the last two years and makes a monthly income of 10,500 KES. 

Janet has applied for her second loan of KES.20,000, after she repaid back her first loan successfully. 

Janet will invest the anticipated profits in her business will use to pay the loan and also pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to open a big cereal stall in future.

loans.use: to buy five bags of maize to resell.

loans.name: Appolinarie

texts.en:
Appolinarie is 33 years old and married, with three children between the ages of 3 and 12. Appolinarie sells sacks of charcoal in her store and her business is well-organized. She has one year of experience and works from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except Sunday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Appolinarie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell so she can improve her business. With the extra profit, Appolinarie will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Massitan

texts.fr:
Madame Massitan est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille nucléaire   avec son mari et ses enfants  au quartier Attbougou de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, Massitan qui fréquenta plutôt l’école coranique, commença très tôt  le commerce  auprès de ses parents. Après  plusieurs années d’apprentissage à leurs côtés, elle finit par évoluer seule en optant pour le commerce d’habits et de chaussures. Elle mène cette activité depuis maintenant 15 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles qui sont des importations.
Dans le souci de faire de face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 60 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels  tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 balle de pagnes wax et 4 douzaines de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et au Togo. Massitan vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permet de rembourser son prêt, de participer à des événements sociaux et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Massitan is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Attbougou area of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Not having attended school for societal reasons, Massitan instead attended Koranic school, and very early on began selling goods with her parents. After several years of training alongside them, she finished by starting her own business, choosing to sell clothes and shoes. She has run this business for 15 years now and has extensive experience and a large clientele. Her strength in sales is due to the quality of her items, which are imported.
With the hope of meeting her customers' demands, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso and has been working with this institution for 60 months. After 4 group loans and 3 individual loans, all repaid properly, she is on her 4th individual loan, which she intends to use to buy 1 bale of pagnes wax (brightly-printed West African clothing) and 4 dozen shoes. She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso and Togo. Massitan sells her goods in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan, participate in local events, and help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy pagnes wax (brightly-printed West African clothing) and shoes.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 48 years old and lives with her partner. She has three children, one of whom still lives with her. 

Gregoria makes her living selling crafts such as colorful bags and knitted cell-phone pockets. She is asking for a loan in order to buy a wider range of crafts to sell. She plans to purchase colorful backpacks, knitted purses and knitted hats. 

She hopes that by expanding the variety of crafts she sells, she will be able to make greater profits. Gregoria is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more crafts to sell such as backpacks, little purses and knitted hats.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz, es agricultor, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura sembrando yuca y maíz para consumo familiar y para comercializar, él aprendió desde joven junto a su padre.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como lo son los fertilizantes, ya que en la agricultura son muy importantes para fortalecer la plantación y que produzca mejor cosecha.
Su aspiración es que el cultivo sea abundante en la producción, ampliar el terreno de cultivo para tener mejores posibilidades de generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Cruz is a farmer.  He lives with his family, his wife and children.  

He has been farming for 15 years.  He grows yucca and corn for the family’s consumption and to sell. When he was young, Cruz learned from his father.

He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies like fertilizers.  In farming it is very important to fortify the fields to produce a better harvest.

His hope is that he produces abundant crops and that he expand his fields in order to have improved possibilities for generating income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa, a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated an Internet cafe business in the Philippines for the past four years, is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase computer supplies for her enterprise. She also earns income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Melissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Juditha has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.  Juditha has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juditha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma has operated her sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house for almost 20 years. A widow, she works hard to sustain her family and is especially mindful of the education of her four children, two of whom are enrolled in a college/university. Wilma wants them to obtain a degree and achieve gainful employment someday that surpasses her own meager achievements.

Requesting a loan of P19,000 to help buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, coffee, bread and eggs, these additional items, to be sold in the store, wil help her earn more profits.

In the future, Wilma would like to diversify her business and establish a more convenient store to stock her items properly in order to attract more customers. She also hopes to achieve a better quality of life someday.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, coffee, bread and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52 years old and married. She has an 18-year-old child. 

Rebecca's husband works as a farmer and driver.  She helps her husband till their land in Trinidad, Bohol.  They also hire farmers to help plant rice sedlings on their land. 

Rebecca requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor.  She hopes that their farm will grow bigger.  Another one of Rebecca's goals is for her child to finish college and to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mayra Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Mayra tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la aldea el cerro de marcovia y se dedica a la venta de gallinas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion, Mayra es muy dedicada a la crianza de gallinas, sus ventas las hace en su casa de habitacion y tambien va a dejar las gallinas al mercado municipal.
este tipo de ave es muy apetecida por las personas, ya que se preparan buenas comidas con dicha ave.

Junto a Mayra vive su esposo quien le apoya economicamente en sus compromisos, juntos trabajan muy fuerte para salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mayra is 31 years old.  She lives in the village of Cerro de Marcovia and she sells chickens, an activity she carries out at home.  Mayra is very dedicated to raising chickens and her sales occur at home but she also takes chickens to the municipal market to sell.  This type of bird is very popular with people since good meals are prepared from it.  Mayra’s husband lives with her and contributes economically to meet obligations.  They work hard together to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed concentrate.

loans.name: Juan Norberto

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su familia, tiene a cargo un hijo de 18 años de edad, él es empleado de la alcaldía municipal, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8:00am a 4:00pm, desde hace 4 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ladrillo de piso y compra de unas ventanas, esta inversión ayudara tanto a su familia como a Juan, porque estará mejorando las instalaciones de la vivienda, ofreciéndoles una mayor comodidad y seguridad.
El propósito de Juan es terminar con los detalles de su vivienda, cuidar su empleo para poder ayudar a su familia y ser responsable con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family and has an 18-year-old son in his care.  He works for the council.  He works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 4.00pm and has been in this job for four years.

Juan is currently requesting a loan to buy paving bricks and some windows.  This investment will help both Juan and his family because he is improving their home in order to provide them with more comfort and security.  Juan's goal is to finish his home and to do well at work so that he can help his family and be responsible with his loan.

loans.use: to buy paving bricks and some windows

loans.name: Francisca Felisa

texts.es:
La señora  Francisca  Felisa  se dedica  a la venta de artesanías  como son: huipil, camisas y batas también le gusta  criar gallos de pelea y hacer velas.
Empezó su negocio desde  hace treinta y cinco años, es  viuda ya que su esposo murió cuando sus hijos estaban chicos, le  gusta mucho su trabajo por que gracias a sus huipiles y batas y blusas ahora sus  hijos son profesionistas.
La señora  Francisca tiene  sesenta  y dos años de edad , tiene la cantidad de  ocho hijos  cuatro mujeres y cuatro varones   Elodia  de cuarenta años de edad, adelfa  de  de cuarenta y cuatro años  de edad , Honoria de  treinta años de edad  ,soledad de  veinte ocho años de edad ,  Martín de  treinta y ocho años de edad, Miguel de  veinte seis años de edad, Lorenzo de  veinte cuatro años de edad y Anatolio de cuarenta y un años de edad.
Pidió  el préstamo para comprar mas hilo blanco, manta  por pieza y listón, lo que mas quisiera es  seguir tejiendo que es lo que mas le gusta.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca Felisa sells handcrafted blouses, shirts, and gowns. She also raises cockfighting roosters and makes candles.

Francisca started her business when she was 35 years old. She is a widow and her husband died when her children were still young. Francisca greatly enjoys her work. Thanks to the sale of her handmade blouses, gowns, and shirts, her children are now professionals.

Sra. Francisca is 62 years old and has eight children, four daughters and four sons: Elodia (age 40), Adelfa (age 44), Honoria (age 30), Soledad (age 28), Martín (age 38), Miguel (age 26), Lorenzo (age 24), and Anatolio (age 41). She is requesting a loan to buy more white thread, cloth by the piece, and ribbon. What she wants most is to continue knitting since that is what she likes to do the most. Francisca expresses her thanks to Fundación Realidad for the support it has given her so that she can move forward.

loans.use: to buy thread, cloth, and ribbon for making traditional clothing.

loans.name: Allahyar

texts.en: Allahyar is a 31 year-old man who sells seasonal fruits and vegetables, which he has done for the last 4 years.  His monthly income from this business is 200 AZN.  His wife actively helps him to run the business.  He applied for 1000 AZN loan to increase profits and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Hélène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hélène est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Hélène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Hélène est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Clément. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et  à leur charge. Hélène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille,  Hélène vend depuis cinq ans, des nappes de table et des ustensiles de cuisine de façon ambulante. Hélène s’approvisionne au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Hélène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The JESUKPEGO group is composed of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is their second time seeking financial support from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The representative of the group is Hélène, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Hélène is 35 years old and she lives in Benin. She never attended school. She is married to a welder named Clement and they have four dependent children, all in school. Hélène lives with her husband and their children and the couple provide together for the family’s needs. 

In order to help with the various household responsibilities, Hélène started selling tablecloths and kitchen utensils door to door five years ago. She buys her merchandise in Togo. 

Eager to meet the needs of her customers and increase her sales and revenue, Hélène is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the JESUKPEGO group. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths and kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with two children. Fe is 43 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Fe sells clothes to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase new clothes to sell.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Fe hopes to have her own dress shop in the area.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
MARIAM est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit  avec son mari, sa coépouse et  leurs enfants  dans  la ville de Koutiala.  
Du à des problèmes de famille, MARIAM n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études,  raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman.  
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle finit par opter pour l’achat et la vente de l’arachide depuis 20 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car elle reçoit des commandes important à travers les vendeurs de pâte d’arachide de Koutiala.   
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, MARIAM  a fait recours  à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 7 ans.   Elle a pris 13 prêts dans  une association (prêt solidaire) tous  remboursés correctement  et elle est à son deuxième  prêt individuel dont le précédent a été bien payer. 
Avec ce financement, elle compte acheter 15 sacs d’arachides  auprès des stokers de céréale de Koutiala  et elle effectue sa vente au grand marché à une clientèle  de femmes et d’hommes au comptant, en détail et à crédit.  Avec ce financement, elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 110.000FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour le  remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.  
Dans ses perspectives, MARIAM compte élargir son activité dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mariam is 54 years old, married with seven children. She lives with her ​​husband, her co-wife and their children in the town of Koutiala.

Due to family problems, Mariam did not have the opportunity to further her education. From an early age she focused on retail commerce, which she learned at her mother's side. 

After trying several income-generating activities, she eventually opted 20 years ago for the retail trade of groundnuts (peanuts). Her reputation is good, as she receives large orders from Koutiaba-based sellers of groundnut paste.

To increase her working capital and expand her business, Mariam approached the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution some seven years ago. As member of an association she was granted 13 group loans, all correctly repaid. She is now ready to receive a second individual loan, the previous one having been fully reimbursed.

With this funding, she plans to purchase 15 bags of groundnuts from Koutiala grain wholesalers. She will then sell retail at the great market to a clientele of women and men, for cash or credit.

She expects this funding will generate monthly profits of 110.000 FCFA she intends to use to reimburse Soro loan interests and contribute to improve her family's living conditions.

Looking to the future, Mariam plans to diversify her business activity.

loans.use: Buy bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Donna Kerr

texts.en:
Donna Kerr is a 31-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have one child, and they live in Locsoon, Tudela.

To earn a living, Donna Kerr operates a store that sells a variety of goods. Donna Kerr has had this business for several years.

Donna Kerr is requesting a loan in the amount of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional goods such as noodles, beverages, and detergents. Donna Kerr has been a member of PMPC for 8 months. In the future, Donna Kerr hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods (e.g., noodles, beverages, and detergents).

loans.name: Elodie Armelle

texts.fr: Armelle vit maritalement et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Elle est vendeuse de divers, liqueurs et cannettes à son domicile. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Pour étendre son secteur d'activité et  satisfaire sa clientèle, elle fait recours à Finadev visant ainsi à atteindre une marge donnée, pouvant l'aider à  couvrir ses charges quotidiennes et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire.
texts.en:
Armelle (is married) and has no children yet. She is a retailer of various goods, liquor, and canned drinks out of her home. Her supplies come from surrounding markets. 

To extend her business sector and to satisfy her customers, she has turned toward Finadev thus aiming to achieve a given margin enabling her to help cover her day-to-day expenses and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy 10 packs of canned drinks, 20 of assorted liquor, and other goods.

loans.name: Doda Hemberta

texts.es: Doda Hemberta de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella vende comida rápida, tortas hamburguesas, hotdog, bebidas entre otros; tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, comercia en el parque municipal de la zona y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que elabora es de primera calidad y aprecios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Doda es una mujer dedicada a su labor siempre está buscando oportunidades que le lleven al éxito, su más grande sueño es hacer crecer el negocio pero no posee de suficiente capital para la inversión en insumos, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, embutidos, carnes, verduras, bebidas, etc. Doda Hemberta es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá pagar el financiamiento y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: pan, embutidos, carnes, verduras, bebidas

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda lives in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has seven children. Erlinda buys and sells fuel. For eight years, she has continually managed her fuel business, and she earns PHP 8,400 a month from this. Since 2007, Erlinda has been a member of GDMPC. Now, she needs to buy more fuel to sell, so she requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC. She is hoping for business progression and expansion.

loans.use: to buy more fuel to sell.

loans.name: Jeanina

texts.en:
Jeanina sells sandals and handbags that she crochets by hand. Although she spent eight years working in retail and wholesale clothing sales, she had problems with her legs and was forced to leave her job. Having a business allows her to contribute to her family’s income. She would like to use her loan money to buy materials such as wool and decorations, and fashion magazines so that she can get new ideas for things to make.

Jeanina is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is frequently away from home, as he works as a mechanic on the shipping barges that come in and out of Guayaquil. Little by little, they have been saving up to build a home out of cement, instead of the bamboo one they have now. Jeanina’s dream is to establish her business in her home and to provide her children with an education so that they can get good jobs in the future.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She would like to use her loan money to buy materials such as wool and decorations, and fashion magazines so that she can get new ideas for things to make.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria I. is 46 years old with six children. She sells water for the community. She hopes to use her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more water containers for sale

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela is the young mother of two little ones, ages 3 and 4. Her husband works as an employee at a company, but he receives very little income. In order to earn an extra income and improve the living conditions of her family, three years ago Maricela and her sister started selling various products. They noticed that what they sold the most of was cosmetics, so they continued selling only those products. Fortunately their business has gone very well and their customers have increased.

At present, Maricela has various orders she has not been able to fill due to lack of capital. For this she requires a loan in the amount of $275, which she will repay over a period of 4 to 8 months. Without a doubt, the well-being of this family is in your hands. Please support them.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Maricela es una joven madre de dos pequeños, de 3 y 4 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como empleado en un empresa, pero recibe un ingreso muy bajo, para obtener un ingreso extra y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, Maricela y su hermana iniciaron la venta de diferentes productos, hace tres años, y observaron que lo que más se vendía eran los cosméticos por lo que continuaron solo con este tipo de productos, afortunadamente les ha ido muy bien en su negocio y sus clientes se han incrementado.

Actualmente Maricela tiene varios pedidos que no ha podido surtir por falta de capital, para esto requiere de un crédito por $275 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y apóyala.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mahsadoi

texts.ru:
Mahsadoi G. is 50 years old. Her husband went to Russia to find a job. Their daughter is married and their two sons work for a building company. She sells fabrics for woman's clothing. Mahsadoi is a certified commodity expert and has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She used to work as a saleswoman, but then she decided to start her own business selling fabrics at the market. She currently travels to the neighboring countries of Kirgizia and Uzbekistan to buy her fabrics. She wants to expand her business by traveling to China and the United Arab Emirates to buy better, more expensive fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

G. Mahsadoi – 50 лет, продает ткани для женской одежды. В этом бизнесе она 10 лет. Раньше работала продавщицей в магазине по продаже тканей. Она решила сама привозить ткани и продавать на базаре. По образованию она товаровед. За товарами ездит сама в соседние страны Киргизию и Узбекистаню Муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Ее дочь замужем, а два сына работают в строительной компании. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и поехать за товаром в ОАЭ и Китай , чтобы купить дорогие ткани.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Josue Ricardo

texts.es:
Josué is married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker, and he started his own business since there were not many jobs available where he lives. He found it necessary to start his own venture. He worked as an apprentice in a mechanic workshop for more than a year. During that time, he learned the business and bought the necessary tools to be able to branch out on his own and that, he did. He has already been able to improve the quality of his life; the salary he previously earned as an employee was not sufficient to meet his living expenses. He wishes to continue his business and devote much of his energy to grow it to its maximum potential.

Josué seeks a loan of $375 to be able to buy more tools for his workshop and to offer better service to his customers. He will pay back the loan in 5 months. He and his wife are grateful for your support that contributes to the growth and improvement of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Josué esta casado y no tiene hijos, su esposa se dedica a su hogar como ama de casa, y él inicio su negocio ya que en su ciudad no hay muchas oportunidades laborales, fue por eso que se vio en la necesidad de emprender un negocio, hace mas de un año el trabajaba como ayudante en un taller mecánico y con el paso del tiempo aprendió del negocio y fue adquiriendo herramientas necesarias para poder algún día independizarse y así lo hizo, ya con esto mejoró su calidad de vida por que el sueldo que ganaba como empleado no le alcanzaba para los gastos de su hogar, y ahora el deses continuar con su negocio para el cual le invierte mucho esfuerzo y ganas con la finalidad de hacerlo crecer.

Josué solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para poder comprar más herramientas para su taller y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Junto con su esposa te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para el crecimiento y mejora de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Kwintini

texts.en: Kwintini B. is a 38-year-old father of two who lives in the Lumo area of Dar Es Salaam city. He has been in business for the past 16 years selling building and construction materials. He runs his hardware shop in an up-and-coming area where most residents are constructing permanent residential houses. He is in need of $350 to help expand his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience A. is 40 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells tailoring materials.This business was started in 1999. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy a sewing machine and more  tailoring material for sales.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and more tailoring materials for sale.

loans.name: Kazinga C (I) Group

texts.en: Barbara is 34 years old, married, and has five children. She would like to purchase materials to expand her business and product range.

loans.use: Expand her retail shop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: The young entrepreneur K. Joseph is a fisherman and it’s through fishing that he is what he is today. He is 29 years old, married with 5 children and has four of his late brother’s children in his care. He owns two boats that operate at the Katebo landing site off Masaka road as well as other fishing materials like fishing nets.  At times he fishes himself and this earns him a lot while at other times, especially when he needs a rest, he employs other fishermen on his boats. His customers are fish retailers from surrounding towns as well as tourists. He requests a loan to enable him sell more fish now that their prices are high.

loans.use: To sell more fish and pay school fees for his children now that the school term has began.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is 23 years old and is a married woman with a 3 year old child. She and her husband also take care of 1other person, age14 years old. Tatu owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mr. Vorn V. and his wife married in 1998. They have three children: two sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school. The family live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Vorn and his wife have been fish wholesalers for eight years. They buy fish for resale to retailers at markets in Phnom Penh. They carry their goods in their old truck. Now, Mr. Vorn wants to buy a new truck to replace the old one.
