Mr. Vorn is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to add in his own savings to buy a new truck to replace the old one to use in his business.

loans.use: To add in his own savings for buying a truck for carrying fish

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth P. has a machine that grinds rice. He earns about $6 per day working from his house. His wife, Mrs. Lot Vay, earns about $3 per day making wine and selling ground rice. They have two children, all of whom are young, and live in Phkar Rumchek Village in the Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia.

To increase their income and make it easier to operate their business, they are seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike to use for business. With the remainder of the loan, they will buy rice to grind and sell. This loan will help to expand their business and improve their family income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and rice

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en: Faatupu Pasi, 57, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Faatupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She is a mother of six children running a small shop.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mr. Ry P. and his wife, Mrs. Khun Chaem, are farmers in Tumnop Thmey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They have five children, two of whom assist their parents in the fields while two others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

One of Mr. Ry P.’s children is going to organize his engagement ceremony; unfortunately, Mr. Ry P. does not have enough money to celebrate this occasion, which is very important in Cambodian culture. Therefore, Mr. Ry P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. In the past, Mr. Ry P. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy a buffalo for breeding. Mr. Ry P. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To organize an engagement ceremony which is very important in Cambodian culture

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a twenty-eight year old lady.  she is married with two kids in school. She has been trading in grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tin tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc in the market of Obuasi, Ghana for ten years. Her experience in trading has made her one of the most successful traders in the market. Rebecca considers this loan a great opportunity to enable expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable and palm oil to increase her inventory. Rebecca is a member of  the community group called Anointed Ladies. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and assist themselves to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables and palm oil.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina was born and raised in Western Ukraine. For nearly 8 years she has successfully operated a business selling quality perfumes and cosmetics. She now has a small sales kiosk in the central market of her home town of Beregovo. Being the entrepreneur that she is, Valentina is always ready to explore new opportunities.  Eventually she would like to diversify her products and in turn, generate more products.

Valentina has built up around $2000 in working capital and has an extensive history of working with Nadiya Ukraine and has successfully repaid all loans with no delinquencies.  She is now requesting a loan for 1,500 Grivnas ($325) to buy more cosmetic supplies. She believes that through her business, and the products she offers at the market, she can help her female customers stay pretty and attractive, and at the same time, she can meet the basic needs of her own family as well.      

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To increase assortment of inventory

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. O. is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Koforidua, in the eastern region of Ghana. She is 41 years old.  She runs a clothing shop and has sold jeans, blouses and skirts, lace materials, women's slippers and dressing bags for the past eight years. Leticia is constrained by funds in running the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to purchase a large quantity of high-quality goods to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. She is a member of the group called 'Biako ye'. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase improved inventory for her business.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
Azucenas,  es la denominación que adoptan 10 socias que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer . Dicha asociación es un grupo nuevo, cumpliendo así un año de trabajo responsable.
Casi todas se dedican a la comercialización de víveres y comestibles, éstos adquiridos al mayor para su respectiva venta al por menor y generalmente sus ventas la realizan de forma ambulante. Ellas requieren capital para comprar estos productos al por mayor y para alquilar tiendas en la calle Raúl Salmón, de la Ceja de El Alto, ya que es un zona netamente comercial, o en otras calles donde la venta sea segura, con lo que garantizarían mejores ingresos para sustentar a sus numerosas familias.
texts.en:
Azucenas is the name taken by 10 members working together with Pro-Mujer. This association is a new group, counting on one year of responsible work.

Almost all of the members sell groceries and foods. Most of these items are purchase in wholesale and resold and generally all of the sales are carried out door to door. They require working capital to purchase these products wholesale and to rent spaces along the street Raul Salmon in Ceja de El Atla, a commercial zone, or on other streets where sales will be steady. With these improvements they will secure better earnings to better support their large families.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As working capital to purchase products wholesale and to rent spaces.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Elisa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en el Jr. Bolívar Nº 335, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera con 2 hijos, uno mayor de edad y otro que aún depende de ella. Merly. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de belleza. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se encuentra enferma. Trabaja en el puesto de salud 9 de Octubre. Cuenta con 2 motokar, los que hace trabajar todos los días para así aumentar sus ganancias.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 4 llantas, arreglará el motor, tapizará los asientos, etc.

Gracias a su habilidad ha logrado tener sus dos movilidades para mejorar su estabilidad económica y apoyar a su menor hija.
texts.en:
Elisa belongs to the "Las Tigresas" Community bank, located of Jr. Bolivar number 335 in the Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in the department of Ucayaali. She is a 45 year old single mother with two children, one who is grown, and another (Merly) who still depends on her for support. With the first 300 sol loan that she received from Manuela ramos, she invested in the purchase of beauty products. She has been working with the community bank for 4 years. Currently, she is ill. She works in the 9 de Octubre health clinic. She has two motokars which she has working daily to earn money. With this loan of 3000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 4 tires, fix an engine, upholster the seats, etc. Thanks to her skill she has been able to acquire two vehicles to improve her economic stability and to support her minor daughter.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 tires, repair engine, upholster seats, etc.

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Mrs. Norng P. was born in Kor Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a 63 year old widow with a child who is a construction worker. She makes thatch. In addition, she is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectare plot on which she cultivates rice. Despite her hard work, she is unable to provide a comfortable life for her family. To improve her living conditions, she is asking for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan K. is 31 years old. He is married with two children. His wife looks after the house and the kids. Rovshan supports his family by breeding cattle which he sells for meat. He has been in this business for the past 8 years.

Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income needed to allow Rovshan to support his family and improve their living conditions. Now Rovshan is planning to buy two baby calves and fodder to speed up the raising process. Rovshan is requesting a loan of 1200 USD over a term of 15 months.

loans.use: purchase two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Alberta es soltera, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Alberta vende ropa, calzados, sus ventas los realiza en la feria de San Juan y también reparte a amigos y conocidos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Alberta necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados.
Los sueños de Alberta son construir su casa y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alberta is a member of Banco Comunal Amauta. She's single, 42 years-old, and has two children. Alberta sells clothing and footwear in the San Juan fair, and she also acquires products in Lima that she distributes to friends and acquaintances. Alberta requests a loan of 1500 soles ($475 dollars) to purchase additional footwear for her store. Alberta dreams of building a house and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase footwear for her store

loans.name: Amelia Rosalina,

texts.es:
Al inicio, cuando recién empezó a trabajar, Amelia se dedicaba a vender especerías y condimentos en un puesto ambulante. Estuvo buen tiempo en ello hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de hacerse de un puesto propio en un mercado nuevo cerca de su casa. Una vez en su puesto de abarrotes cambió la venta de condimentos a la de abarrotes.
Hoy ya lleva ocho años en su negocio. Más adelante le gustaría tener el capital suficiente para comprar un mototaxi y alquilarlo.
En su hogar se encarga de cubrir los gastos de alimento, mientras que su esposo cubre los demás gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Initially, when she started working, Amelia sold spices and condiments from a traveling cart. It took a long time before she had the opportunity to open her own small store in a new market near her home. Once she opened her grocery store, she changed her business focus from condiments to groceries. She has now had her business for eight years. In the future, she would like to have enough money to buy a mototaxi to lease out. In her household, she is responsible for paying for the food while her husband is responsible for the rest of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Javier M.  de oficio transportista desde hace más de 10 años, trabaja en el servicio de trufi 1, taxi de ruta fija, tiene dos hijos pequeños, la esposa Sra. Graciela Condori trabaja mucho tiempo en la residencia de la Embajada Americana, vivian en casa an alquiler hasta hace unos tres años, ahora tiene casa propia y se encuentra para refaccionar el patio, en lo que invertiran el crédito, ademas la movilidad esta presentado algunas fallas.
El Sr. Javier M. es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2003, trabajó en grupo  Shaloom, integrado por tres personas, hasta el año 2005, posteriormente trabajo en crédito individual hasta el año 2007, y reingresa después de un año de descanso, con crédito individual con codeudor, no presenta deudas en otras instituciones ysegúbn su historial es una persona muy responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier M. has worked in the transportation field for more than 10 years. He works for the Trufi 1 service, a taxi with a fixed route. He has two young children and his wife Mrs. Graciela Condori has worked for a long time in the American Embassy residence. They lived in a rented house until three years ago and now they live in their own home. It is time to refurbish the patio, which is what they will use this loan for, and in addition mobility is causing some problems. Mr. Javier Machiado has been a client of Kiva partner Emprender since 2003. He worked with the Shaloom group, composed of three members, until 2005. He then worked with an individual loan until 2007, and he is now rejoining after a year-long break with this individual loan with co-signer. He has no other debts with other institutions and according to his history, he is a very responsible and punctual person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain his vehicle and fix his home

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Fama T. a 39ans, mariée, mère d’un enfant avec 4 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle fait de la restauration et aimerait avec ce prêt parvenir à mieux renforcer son capital. Avec cet activité, elle compte subvenir aux besoins familiaux afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fama T., age 39, is married and the mother of one child. She also has four other children to support. She works in the food serving business, and would like to use this loan to bolster her working capital. She intends to use this business to provide for her family, in order to improve the living standard of her children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her food serving business

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina A. sells beans and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. With the extra profits from her loan, Celina hopes to be able to buy a lorry (truck) to hire.

Celina is 30 years old and married a nurse who works at Juba Teaching Hospital. They have two children who are studying for diplomas at Supiri Institute Of Management And Information Technology. One takes a human resource management course and the other one takes computer science.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Selling food products in his rented store is the only source of income for Mahir S., a 40-year-old trader who's been doing this for 12 years. Mahir is married and the father of two sons. His children are the reason that he works hard in order to provide them with the best, brightest future.

This man has many projects for his future. The main project is that Mahir wants to build his own store where he would be able to sell a wide range of products.

His wish is to add more items and  therefore have more to offer to his clients. Mahir will pay back this loan and, with the profit, he will be able to pay for his children’s education. This man waits for your help. Let's make his dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji M. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste. She is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make into paste for sale. Keji is 34 years old and married to an army officer. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more groundnut for making paste

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith H. is managing a small rice field. She has workers in her farm because her husband is currently ill. She is 60 years old and has two children. She dreams to grow her business, even more to have a better quality of life for her family. Aside from rice, she also manages a small piggery. She has been doing multiple businesses to supplement the income of the family.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She thinks that, by her loan, she will be able to increase the profit of her farm.

Through CEVI, the dream of expanding her business is within reach. CEVI provides their clients, not just credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm needs.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: José Tomas M. M. tiene la edad de 48 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de José es la ventad e granos básicos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que fue con capital propio, por que tenía la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, su familia tiene muchas dificultades económicas, pero esto no impide que José sea un hombre responsable y cariñoso con su familia, a pesar de las circunstancias él ha hecho de todo para salir adelante. Por lo que el dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de detergentes, jabón, arroz, frijoles, jugos y gaseosa. El deseo de José es mejorar sus ingresos para propiciarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
José Tomas is 48 years old. He is a married man and has four children that he is responsible for. José works selling staple grains. He has been dedicated to his business, which he began with his own capital because he needed to generate income for his family, for over 20 years. His family has many economics difficulties but this doesn't stop José from being responsible and loving with his family. Despite the circumstances, he has done all he can to get ahead. As far as the money that he is requesting, it is for working capital for buying detergents, soap, rice, beans, juice and soft drinks. José's wish is to improve his income in order to provide his family with the necessities of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gloria Herminia

texts.es: La Señorita Gloria B. tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera de oficios Artesana,  “Confección de Delantales para Mujeres”, habita junto  a sus Papas, ella y sus Papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de vender productos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje la Planta Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Gloria B. is 26 and single. She works in handicrafts, and she makes women’s aprons. She lives with her parents. She and her parents do the same work, and they have two employees who help them. They have been selling their products for six years. They live in Paraje la Planta, in the Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has grown. However, her economic situation has not allowed her to increase her capital. That is why she has come to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She will use the loan to buy raw material. That way she will be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her family get ahead so that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts     (buy raw material)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells drinks and provisions. she has been in the business for the past 18 years. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drink and provisions to sell

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Alba is a member of the Mgodi borrower group in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 26 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 2 years.

Alba started her own Tailoring business 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Alba first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Alba hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: 14 De Julio Group

texts.es: Venta de víveres, calzados, ropa, cosméticos, dulces, pasteles y carbón son los negocios de las integrantes del grupo 14 de Julio que se fundó hace 7 años aproximadamente. Es el caso de Rosa V.  de 48 años, es parte del grupo hace 2 años ella ingresó por invitación de una amiga que vive en su zona, Rosa tiene el negocio de elaboración y venta de carbón, inicio su negocio hace 7 años, su esposo es quien  elabora el carbón y ella lo vende en una tienda que se ubica en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto y tiene mayor demanda los días viernes, sábado y domingo. Rosa es madre de 5 hijos, dos de los cuales viven con ella porque son pequeños, ella necesita el préstamo para comprar madera que trae de Yacuiba.
texts.en:
Group 14 de Julio was founded about seven years ago. Its members sell groceries, shoes, clothing, cosmetics, candy, pastries and coal. Forty-eight year old Rosa V., for example, has been a member for two years. She was invited to join by a friend who lives in her area. Rosa makes and sells coal. She started the business seven years ago. Her husband makes the coal and she sells it at a store located in Ceja, in El Alto. The coal is in highest demand on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. Rosa has five children, the two younger ones live with her. She needs the loan to buy the wood she brings from Yacuiba.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio Miguel,  pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAY HUAYNA”; ubicado en el valle sagrado de los Inkas, exactamente en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestro socio tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, el socio aún no tiene hijos y se dedica a realizar muchas tareas de albañilería y construcción, nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de algunos materiales y hacer un capital de trabajo para realizar obras. 

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Fahima Bene Hesar Group

texts.en:
Fahima is the group leader of Fahima Bene Hesar Group which is made up of five female members. Each of them would like to expand their business and bring some new changes to it.

Fahima would like to take a loan for her tailoring business. She has been a tailor for more than ten years. With the money she wants to buy a new sewing machine to sew good-quality clothes.

Sediqa wants to take a loan to buy fresh fruit to sell in the market.

Nargis wants to take a loan for her quilt-sewing business.

Husnia wants to take a loan for her bakery shop to buy flour and firewood.

Rahima wants to take a loan to buy new kinds of cosmetics for her beauty salon that is located in her house.

Together, they have requested a group loan of 50,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Mr. Torn N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this, he is a pig breeder. Since these two businesses are going well, he wants to expand them, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field. He will use the rest of the loan to buy piglets and pig feed.

Mr. Torn N. is a villager in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. His wife, Mrs. Lach Keourn, helps him with the business. They have three children: one is working in a garment factory while the others are in school. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is 27 years old. He is married with a child who is still breastfeeding from its mother. 'Mathew the fisher', as he is popularly called by his peers, has been a professional carpenter for some years now. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture. He has one apprentice who is learning skills and training for his future career. He has been in business for the last six years now. He said because of a lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This, he said, slows down his work because he has to wait for funds from his customers before any work can begin, which most often causes delays. He requests the loan to enable him procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sand paper, wood, etc., to improve on his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income status to ensure a good living for his family. He would grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is a very focused, hard-working woman. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She is 36 years old, married and has three children. For the last four years, she has made a living selling building materials. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, and has applied for a loan for N80,000 to buy more building materials to sell and to expand her business. She extends sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy seeds and expand his business.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea R. is from the town of Gud in San Isidro. She is 21 years old. Rea is married and has one young child. To make a living, Rea owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Rea has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rea is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Rea's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jovel

texts.es:
Jovel O. Q., tiene la edad de 57 años, es casado, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 46,32,y 6 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de novillas, para la siembra de pasto y la reconstrucción de cercas. El está seguro de que puede darle un buen mantenimiento y así mejorar su condición económica.La idea de sembrar pasto es para mantener vacas de leche, que en estos momentos ya tiene tres, pero quiere ir creciendo poco a poco.Es la segunda vez que se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, además de que desea tener una pequeña lechería para aumentar sus ingresos.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jovel O. Quiros, 57, is married and has 3 children. The children, 46-, 32- and 6-years old, respectively, are the most important people in the world to him. He wants the loan to buy heifers, plant grass and rebuild fences. He is sure that the investment will provide him a good living and improve his economic condition. He wants to plant grass to support his three milk cows, a number that he hopes to increase over time. This is his second FUDECOSUR loan and he says that the the loan committee has helped him a lot. Their help has allowed him to proceed with various projects that he had planned and he is very satisfied with the funds that he has received. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and more economic stability. He would also like to have a small creamery to increase his income. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy heifers and supplies for livestock business.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: M. Juliette est née le 3 février 1970 à Azové au Bénin.  Juliette vit depuis 8 ans au quartier Vodjè à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin.  Juliette est mariée à AGONDJIHOSSOU Clément, un chauffeur, et est mère de quatre enfants. Juliette n’a jamais été à l’école mais tous les enfants de Juliette sont scolarisés.  Juliette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Juliette est une couturière. Mais à côté de cela, et pour faire face à ses besoins, Juliette vend des sacs, des chaussures et des tissus, par le système de distribution. Juliette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo.  Juliette exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans et a déjà eu de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Juliette sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son commerce et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Juliette ambitionne plus tard acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Juliette M. was born on February 3, 1970, in Azové in Benin. For eight years, she's been living in the Vodjè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Juliette is married to Clément AGONDJIHOSSOU, a driver, and she's the mother of four children. She never went to school, but all her children attend school. She lives with her children and her husband. The couple supports the family expenses together. Juliette is a seamstress, but she also sells handbags, shoes, and fabrics, by the distribution system. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, as well as in Lomé, Togo. Juliette has been running this business for eight years, and already benefited from one loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The loan was repaid without problems. She's seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to bolster her business and better satisfy her customers. She ambitions to acquire a parcel in the future.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, shoes and handbags

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda C. M. is a 47-year-old woman living in La Aurora, Heredia, located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica.

Amanda is involved in the income generating activity of renting out an apartment. She plans to use this loan to invest in the upkeep of her apartment by purchasing two electricity generators. An obstacle for Amanda has been an increase in competition which has forced her to search for clients in new areas.

Amanda’s life goal, in addition to the expansion of her business, is to learn English. She plans to take classes from the ¨Centro Canadiense¨ which translates as the Canadian Center, an organization offering in-house English classes.

Amanda is a very positive person who recognizes the importance of seizing each day and enjoying life to the fullest with her family.

loans.use: To purchase two electricity generators for an apartment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy bags of dried fish to increase her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products and ingredients to prepare more meals

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 46 years old and married with three children.  The children range in age from 2 to 16 and two of them currently attend school. He runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for over ten years. He sells milk to the Kenyan Cooperative of Cremeries and maize at the local market.  He says that the main challenge is finding a suitable market for his produce and consistent wages.

Johnson requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help his family's health and provide for his children's education. In the future, he would like to improve his farm's milk and poultry production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-ol L., 53, has been married to his new wife since 1998. He has five children – two sons and three daughters. Three of them married and live outside the family home and the other two are hairdressers. They live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Sam-ol has been driving a motor taxi for 25 years. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to tuk tuk (auto-rickshaw), because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to buy a trailer. He also will use part of the loan to repair the wall of his house.
The couple are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to drive as a tuk tuk taxi

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela S. is from the town of Banga. She is 45 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children.

Estela owns a fish pond where she grows tilapia (St. Peter's fish) which she sells to the market. She also owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of coconut plantation. Estela shares that she is thankful for what she has and she hopes to succeed in all her ventures in life. She has been engaged in her business for more than twenty years now.

In 2010, Estela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Estela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Donata

texts.es:
Donata es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela, el mayor de 17 años termina el colegio este año y desea prepararse para sus estudios superiores.
Donata tiene un negocio de venta de comida, esta actividad la realiza 3 veces a la semana en las ferias, los otros días aprovecha en la compra de ganado para su posterior venta de carne. Donata ha trabajado desde muy joven, ha vendido ropa, antiguamente canjeaba productos por carne, también ha trabajado de ambulante y en una empresa pesquera.
Donata solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que utilizará en la compra de víveres al por mayor para la preparación de comidas, como son: arroz, azúcar, aceite. Los sueños de Donata es tener una tienda de abarrotes grande o un restaurante, para ello esta buscando un lugar para alquilar.
texts.en:
Donata is a member of the Paloma (The Dove) communal bank. She lives with her life partner and has three children who are in school; the oldest is 17 years old and will be finishing high school this year and wants to prepare for his university studies. Donata sells prepared food three times a week at various farmers markets. The other days she buys cattle for subsequent meat sales. Donata has worked since she was very young; she has sold clothing and used to trade items for meat, she’s also worked as a peddler and has been employed by a fish processing plant. Donata is asking for 2000 soles to buy wholesale food items like rice, sugar and cooking oil to use in her meal preparations. Donata dreams with having a large grocery store or a restaurant and is looking for a place to rent suitable for this purpose.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs at wholesale.

loans.name: Marjorie Leonor

texts.es:
La Joven Marjorie tiene la edad de 35 años, vive en el barrio anexo a Villa Flor, madre soltera de un hijo, el cual ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para poder dar lo necesario a su hijo. 
Su mama siempre la ha apoyado, vive con ella y su hijo de diez años, trabaja como analista de recaudación desde hace varios años ha logrado mantenerse estable su trabajo para lograr un salario fijo.
Con lo que gana alcanza para la alimentación, estudios, transporte y también ayuda a su mama con los gastos básicos, de agua y luz.
Entre sus planes es hacer mejoras a la casa pero no ha logrado debido a que no cuenta con dinero, y todo esta con altos costos. Para construir.
Es por eso decide por este medio de financiamiento para construir un pequeño porche en frente de su casa para un mejor espacio.
Comprara: piedra, bloques, un metro de arena, cemento, hierro, zinc para comenzar  hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 35 years old. She lives in the neighborhood attached to Villa Flor. She is a single mother and works hard to be able to give her son everything he needs. Marjorie's mother has always supported her daughter. Marjorie and her ten-year-old son live in her mother's house. Marjorie works as a collections analyst. For many years, she has maintained a stable job and earned a fixed salary. With the money she makes, Marjorie pays for food, school, and transportation in addition to helping her mother with basic living expenses, like water and electricity bills. One of her plans is to make improvements to her mother's home. So far she has been unable to make the desired improvements because she does not have enough money to cover the high costs of construction, which is why she has asked for a loan through Kiva. Marjorie plans to build a small porch in front of the house to offer the family more space. She will buy stones, blocks, sand, cement, steel, and an iron roof to begin construction.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to build front porch

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina pertenece al Banco comunal Sarita y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones con sus consocias con quienes comparten sus vivencias y alegrías.
Delfina es casada y tiene 5 hijos el mayor de 26 años y el menor de 9 años, todos estudiantes. Delfina vende ropa a pedido que reparte de casa en casa, negocios y familiares, sus productos los adquiere de la ciudad de Lima. Además Delfina viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende quesos que adquiere en la comunidad de Sachabamba. Delfina solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de chompas.
Delfina sueña con tener una tienda estable y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Sarita communal bank. What she enjoys the most is the get togethers with her fellow members to share anecdotes and joys. Delfina is married and has five children. The oldest is 26 years old and the youngest is 9. All are students. Delfina sells clothing that her customers have ordered from her. She delivers the items door-to-door both to family homes and to businesses. She gets her products in the city of Lima. In addition, Delfina goes to the Ayacucho backcountry to sell cheeses she gets in Sachabamba. She is asking for a 1200 sol loan to buy sweaters. Delfina dreams with having a stable store and to be a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira Q. M. tiene 43 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Jacinto y Jefre. 

Rosa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene siembras de maíz y arroz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para comprar los insumos, abonos, y semillas de agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta préstamo mejoraria la situación economico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene enfermedades y plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Le gusta pasar tiempo en la casa en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira Q. M. is 43 years old. She is married and lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 2 children named Jacinto y Jefre. Rosa is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús solidarity group. There are 15 members altogether, mostly farmers. Rosa is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She makes her purchases and product sales in Ventanas Canton. She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers and seeds, so that with the help of this loan she will improve her economic situation. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. One challenge that she has faced in her work is diseases in her corn and pests, and one pest in particular called ¨longosta.¨ In her free time, she likes to spend time at home.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: agriculture

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja nació en la ciudad de Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. (La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra ubicada a una hora diez de la ciudad del Cusco). 
 
Maruja trabaja como empleada pública en la UGEL (Unidad de Gestión Educativo del Local), ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de tarde. Maruja nos cuenta que su papá trabajaba en la fábrica donde confeccionaba frazadas pero a su papá lo despidieron y la empresa le indemnizó  con frazadas entonces Maruja como venia que había mercadería entonces decidió vender las frazadas. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone en su trabajo.
       
Con el próximo préstamo Maruja que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar mercadería como por ejemplo frazadas. 

Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal “Vilcanota” de la asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maruja was born in Cusco and now lives in the city of Urubamba. (Urubamba is located one hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco). Maruja works as a civil servant at the local educational authority. She works from Mondays to Fridays from 7 am to 3 pm. Maruja tells us that her father worked in a blanket-making factory, but he was fired and was paid in blankets as compensation. Therefore, Maruja set up a business selling blankets. She has been doing this for the last 15 years, thanks to the efforts she puts in her work. With this next loan, Maruja is asking for 1000 new soles ($375). She will spend the money on buying merchandise. She has been a member of the Arariwa Association's "Vilcanota" community bank for a number of years and has done well thanks to her comrades' trust in her and her punctual payments. Maruja thanks you for contributing to this loan and promises to pay on time according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as blankets

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Christine has a business running a bar, which she has had for 5 years.  She also generates additional income by selling milk and dairy products.  

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more drinks for the bar and milk.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and save for herself, and also buy food.  In the future, Christine hopes to own a plot of land and build a house.   

Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by letting her increase her business capital and learn how to behave to people.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and milk

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda A. is 44 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of Eastern Wao Poblacion, Wao municipality in the province of Lanao del Sur on the Mindanao islands. Merlinda provides hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Merlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase beauty supplies. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her beauty business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her beauty business

loans.name: Cirilo Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Cirilo Alejandro C. C., tiene la edad de 35 años es soltero habitante de la Comunidad de San Caralampio, desde hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, de los cuales se ha enfrentado a problemas en sus terrenos tales como plagas, sequias, es para solucionar este problema que solicita un préstamo para brindar un mejor mantenimiento a sus siembras en la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, abonos orgánicos, que permitan una mayor producción de cosechas, incremente los volúmenes de ventas, favorezca su economía  en la inversión para la construcción y remodelación  de la infraestructura de su vivienda. El es un hombre humilde pero muy trabajador que ha logrado su bienestar por sus esfuerzos propios, y que su responsabilidad con las cuotas de su ultimo prestamo demuestran su honradez, responsabilidad, e inmpetu por mejorar cada dia sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Cirilo Alejandro C. C. is 35 years old, single, and lives in the community of San Caralampio.  For 7 years he has made a living from agriculture, and he has had to deal with problems on his land such as pests and droughts.  In order to solve these problems Cirilo is asking for a loan so that he can improve the health of his crops—specifically, by purchasing fungicide and organic fertilizer.  This would allow him to improve his crop yield, increase his sales, and improve his finances so that he can invest in construction and remodeling work on his home.  Cirilo is a man who is modest yet very hardworking and who has managed to improve his welfare through his own efforts.  He was responsible in making the payments on his previous loan, and demonstrates his integrity, responsibility, and energy every day so that he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: Improving the health of his crops

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es: El sr. fidencio es un sr. pensionado su esposa no trabaja y el quiere hacer un cuarto ya que donde ellos viven cada que llueve se les inunda su casa en esta ultima vez el agua se llevo todas sus pertenencias incluyendo su casa dejandoles nada mas los puros cimientos de la casa donde ellos viven son humildes y necesitan de un cuarto para poder vivir comodamente ya que nada mas cuenta con un cuarto.
texts.en: Fidencio is retired and his wife does not work.  He would like to build a room because where they live floods every time it rains, and the last time it rained, they lost all of their belongings in the flood, including their house.  They were left with the cement foundation of the house.  The houses where they live are humble and they need a room to live comfortably since they don't have anything right now.

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes for men and women and Avon cosmetics in order to improve sales

loans.name: Piedra Preciosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Piedra Preciosa está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ana S. de 50 años quien tiene una pequeña y modesta venta desde hace seis años la cual gracias a los préstamos y su arduo trabajo ha ido creciendo actualmente tiene una tienda bien surtida. Ella es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales uno de ellos es menor de edad de 10 años. 
S. invertirá el crédito  en granos básicos, carne, chiverías, pan, huevos etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yesenia Cosea S. 28 años desde hace cinco años vende comida y Magda F. vende leña desde hace 7 años.
texts.en: The group Piedra Preciosa (“Precious Stone”) is comprised of three hard-working women.  One of them is Ana S., 50 years of age, who has had a small and modest store for 6 years.  Her business, thanks to the loans and her hard work, has been growing and she currently has a well-stocked store.  She is the mother of five children, one of whom is still a 10-year old minor.  S. will invest the loan into buying basic necessities such as meat, bread, eggs, etc.  The other members of the group are Yesenia Cosea S., 28 years of age, who for the past 5 years has been selling food, and Magda F. who has sold wood for the past 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase basic necessities such as meat, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a single man. For a living, he operates a driving school. He has engaged in the business for two years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable. He hopes to expand his driving school in the future.  

He has requested for 30, 000 Kes to buy a computer.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S., 29, is a local rice grower who has been farming on her land for over four years. For additional income, San S. raises a few pigs in a stall at her home. She is married to Nait Noeurn, age 36, who assists with the farming business. This couple has four children who are living at home because they are studying in school. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for San S. and her family, San S. has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise. With the remaining money, she will buy tobacco stock which she will sell at profit.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets and tobacco stock

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a husband and the father of Ahmed, 13 years old; Asala, 11 years old; Osama, 9 years old; Tareq, 7 years old and Siba, one year old. Hasan is a National Palestinian Authority employee from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Hasan took out a loan from FATEN in order to replace an old home appliance and replace the sofas he has in the house with better ones.

Hasan appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase a new home appliance

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
la señora Karla Patricia M. tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, Karla se a dedicado a trabajar muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos, posee casa propia y tiene mas de cinco años de vivir en ese lugar.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de ropa interior, cosmeticos y el resto en abarroteria para su pulperia.
su meta es darles una buena educacion a sus hijos.
dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo y espera poder tenerlo bien surtido y mas grande.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y para la alimentacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia M. is 29 years old, she is a single mother and she has 2 children. Karla has worked very hard to provide for her children. She has her own home and she has more than 5 years living in the same place. 

The loan will be used to purchase undergarments, cosmetics, and inventory for her convenience store. 

Her goal is to send her children to school. 

She says that she is very happy to have seen her business grow and she hopes to keep a good quantity and variety in her inventory.

She needs her earnings to cover the household expenses and to feed her children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery store merchandise and cosmetics.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Betty has a small retail shop, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business in tailoring.
To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and soap for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to build a house and expand her business further.
Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by enabling her to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a small retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase maize flour and sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de hielo. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable. Ella inicio este medio de vida por su Mama ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a este negocio, Alba se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena cliente ya que el pago de sus cuotas las realiza en tiempo y forma se encuentra muy contenta con este financiamiento que lo utilizara para la compra de bolsas, entre otros.
texts.en: Alba Luz, 38, sells ice.  She’s had the business for over 5 years.  She has always stood out for being a very responsible person.  She started this way of earning a livelihood through her mother who used to be in this business too.  Alba has shown herself to be a very good client since she makes all her payments on time.  She is very happy with this loan that she’ll use to buy bags, among other things.

loans.use: To buy bags, among others.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 7 Group

texts.en:
Marta is one of the members of her group "Mujeres en Desarrollo 7" (Women in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with two of her three children.

Marta is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown in her business and her loan amount. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling vegetaB.. She operates a vegetaB. and fruit stall where she sells many sorts, especially plantains,  cassava, oranges, bananas and other tropical produce. Her loan will be used to expand this inventory. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing shoes and clothes and to save toward her long-term goal of having an improved business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Freyda Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 40 años, una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad como enfermera de un hospital, un día con la venta del carro de su esposo decidieron abrir una pequeña farmacia.

Ella trabaja diariamente de 6:00 am hasta la noche su esposo también de apoya en la farmacia. Lo que le afecta en su negocio es la delincuencia ya que cada vez es más frecuente por el sector. Con el préstamo ellos quieren comprar productos para la farmacia para así aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere seguir mejorando su casa para así también ampliar su farmacia y darle todo lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 40 years old and is a hardworking woman who began working as a nurse at a hospital. One day, she and her husband decided to open a small pharmacy after selling his car.

She works daily from 6am until the evening and her husband also helps out with the pharmacy. What affects her business is the delinquency, as it is becoming increasingly more common in the area. With the loan, they want to buy products for the pharmacy in order to increase their profits. In the future, she wants to continue improving her house in order to expand her pharmacy and provide her children with all the best.

loans.use: to buy display cases, pills, and notebooks

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Sari Mertha group is located in Dusun Tegal Sari, Sumberkima Village, Singaraja. This group has a total membership of 10 people, and all the members of the group are women who are married and have children. This group has loans of  Rp. 10,000,000, and the person who responsible for the group is Ni Luh P.. Ni Luh P. is the Sari Mertha leader. She has good experience in managing the business of pigs, but because her capital is only slight, her business did not develop and produced only a small profit. Therefore she chose to borrow capital at MUK. 

Ni Luh P. will get a loan of Rp. 1,000,000 to be used to buy superior piglets and also to buy their feed. With this loan, she hopes this effort will go forward and succeed so as to improve the economy of her family.

loans.use: To buy superior piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stainless steel table.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
La Sra. Evelin, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres luchadoras”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 44  años, tiene dos  hijos que cursan estudios universitarios. 

Evelin  motivada por una vecina  inicio su negocio de cosméticos   dado un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 hace tres  años  en la actualidad  cuenta con una importante cartera de clientes que le permite  obtener  buenas ganancias..


Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos,  tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  y otros productos a pedido de sus clientes. 
 
Evelin, es una  mujer muy alegre y emprendedora le pone muchas ganas a su negocio es por esta razón que su sueño es  tener boutique,  está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Evelin is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras", located in the district of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin, and the Department of San Martin. She is married, 44 years old, and she has 2 children who are in university.

Evelin was motivated by a neighbor to start her own cosmetics business with her initial loan of S/. 300, three years ago. Currently she has a significantly large clientele that provides her a good income. 

With this loan of S/. 800 she will purchase beauty products for her inventory, including perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, skin lotions, compacts, talcs for adults and for babies, lipsticks, nail polish, and other products requested by her clients.

Evelin is a very happy and enterprising woman who expends much effort on her business. Her dream is to have a boutique. She is very thankful with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for helping women like her to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as perfumes for ladies and gentlement, skin lotions, compacts, and talc.

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en: Amartuvshin is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His two children, ages 13 and 14, both attend local secondary school. He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2007 and gained much experience. He is a safe and reliable driver who provides comfortable service for his customers. Now he has lots of regular customers and is planning to continue his business in the future. In addition, he also is planning to manage a grocery trading business with the help of his wife so that he can earn more money that will assist in paying his children's tuition fees. He is a polite man who says, "I want to expand my business and to open my grocery store in near future." He is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery items and to rent a stall.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house, but it has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past 10 years, she has made a living by selling coconuts in a local market and to her neighbors. She faces a big challenge because of the high cost of transportation from rural areas to urban areas. She dreams of expanding her business and serving a large market  in the future. She is applying for a loan for KES. 10,000 to buy sacks of mangoes and coconuts to resell. She decided to join Yehu to get loans and boost her business.

loans.use: buy sacks of mangoes and coconuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a divorced woman with three children, one of whom attends school while the others have graduated from school. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past seven years, she has sold onions at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of onions for sale and iron sheets for her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions for sale and iron sheets for her house.

loans.name: Mangee

texts.en:
Mangee is 34 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has three children between the ages of five and 15. All of her children attend school. 

For the past two years she has been running a grocery shop where she sells soft drinks, rice, soap etc. Sometimes she has few customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of profit. 

Mangee is requesting a loan to purchase more items to sell to expand her business. In the future she hopes to grow her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell to expand her business.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 53 años, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, vive en su propia casa en compañís de su esposo Eliseo de 56 años y sus 07 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Dina trabaja todos los días en sus tierras, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y  siembra de todo un poco, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plantas de cacao y café ya que estos son los productos que mejor se venden en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectarlos; lo cual reduciría mucho sus ganancias. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Por otro lado la plaga de insectos afectan sus plantas y por ello  Anita comprará con el crédito solicitado mallas para hacer trampas y protegerlos de los insectos quienes se apoderan de los frutos. Este será su décimo crédito con MFP,  por tanto espera de un pequeño apoyo de los financistas para llevar consigo su propósito y por ello esta apta en devolver todo sus aportes puntualmente como en sus anteriores créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto  de sus compañeros. Con los 3,000 mil nuevos soles, comprará mallas por metros para realizar sus trampas y combatir los insectos que asechan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Dina is 53 years old,  and a native of the city of Santa Rosa.  She is a hardworking woman, who lives at home with her husband, Eliseo, aged 56, and her seven dear children, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. 

Together with her husband Eliseo, Dina works every day on their land.  With much effort she has been able to make their land be very productive and she plants a little of everything, as she knows that any product she gets will be good.  She mainly plants cocoa and coffee plants, as these are the best selling products in the market. 

What she likes most about her job is protecting her crops from the insect infestations that can affect them and which would greatly reduce her profits.

She has spent 20 years doing this, and believes that the most difficult part is transporting their crops to the city of San Francisco, for that is where she sells her products.  On the other hand, the insect infestations affect the plants and therefore Dina will use the requested loan to buy mesh to make screens to protect the plants from the insects who take over the fruit. 

This will be her tenth loan through MFP, so she hopes for a little support from lenders to carry out her plan, and she is capable of repaying all their contributions promptly, as with her previous loans.  In her community bank, she is a very supportive partner for the rest of her colleagues. 

With the 3,000 New Soles, she will buy meshes by the meter to make screens and combat the insects that lurk in her crops.

loans.use: to buy several meters of mesh.

loans.name: Celsa Dolores

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de telica es maestra del colegio sagrado corazón de Jesús, con 25 años de impartir clases, su núcleo familiar consta de 3 personas su esposo y 2 hijos los que estudian  en los colegios de la localidad, está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de zinc y clavos, para la construcción de mejora de vivienda, el día laborar de esta señora es salir a las 6 de la  mañana teniendo que transportar autobús y recorrer 12 km, dicho crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: This lady is from Telica.  She’s a teacher at Sagrado Corazón School.  She has 25 years’ experience teaching.  Her nuclear family consists of three people: her husband and their two children who go to local schools.  She is asking for financing to buy zinc metal sheeting and nails to do some home improvements.  Her work schedule begins at 6am when she has to take the bus and travel 12 kilometers.  The loan will help her improve her living conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy zinc metal sheeting and nails.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 and married. He has six children and all are in school. He has been in farming for 10 years in his home area of Kisii, South Rift, Kenya. He has two farmhands who help him in producing maize and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Peter has made a loan request through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo for 25,000 KES to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says his focus is to have two additional high grade dairy cows, and the profits will help him educate his children.

Peter says the costs of transportation and managing animal diseases are far too high. He remains grateful to Juhudi for partnering with small farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. 

Richard has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, & beverages. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods & snacks, and also to pay for materials needed for the renovation of his store. In the picture, Richard is working on the renovation of his store; the lumber is still to be used for the store. 

Richard has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & snacks, and to buy materials to renovate the store

loans.name: Muoki

texts.en:
Muoki has been practicing farming and selling his farm produce in Kilala, Maukueni town. He is 38 years old and married to Esther. They have four children.

Muoki was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. He paid the other loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

In the future, Muoki hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Mahudo Pk10 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDO PK10 est formé de quatre personnes qui vivent dans la même agglomération au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Elisabeth, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Elisabeth est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un maçon nommé Benjamin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leurs charges. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Elisabeth n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de sept ans que Elisabeth exerce comme activité, la vente de haricot préparé (communément appelé "Adowè") et de pain dans une ville du Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Elisabeth vend des bois de chauffage. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Elisabeth désire renforcer son fonds de roulement et agrandir son activité. Pour ce faire, Elisabeth sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDO PK10, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mahudo PK10 is composed of four individuals living in the same location in Benin. The group’s representative, by the name of Elisabeth, is the one raising her hand in the photo. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to expand their business activities. Elisabeth is 31 years old and married to Benjamin, a stonemason. They have three dependent children, all of whom go to school. The spouses live together with their children and jointly provide for various family needs. Elisabeth didn’t go to school. For almost seven years, Elisabeth has been selling cooked beans (commonly known as “adowè”) and bread in a town of Benin, which allows her to provide for her family’s needs adequately. As a secondary activity, Elisabeth sells firewood.  In order respond better to client demand, Elisabeth would like to bolster her business capital and expand her activities. To achieve this, Elisabeth, along with other members of the Mahudo PK10 group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy beans and condiments

loans.name: Deni Ulise

texts.es:
Deni, vive con su esposa, el tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas hace (puertas de metal, ventanas y techos) el oficio lo aprendió de ayudante y ahora tiene su propio taller, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar herramientas (pintura, tubos y  soldadores) de esa forma obtendrá mejores resultados y más ingresos.
El propósito de Deni es siempre mantener su negocio estable, tener lo necesario para la vida diaria y que su familia viva en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Deni lives with his wife. He has a metal shop where he makes doors, windows, and roofing materials. He learned this trade as an apprentice and now he has his own workshop. Deni works every day, Monday through Sunday.

This loan will be used to buy equipment such as paint, pipes, and welding materials so that he can obtain better results and more income. Deni’s goals are to always maintain a stable business, to have what he needs for daily life, and to provide his family good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy paint, pipes, and welding materials.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ines; La socia tiene 31años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad; la socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría cuyes y aves de corral, ella también elabora chicha a base de maíz, la socia tiene un terreno en el cual siembra y cosecha maíz amarillo para la realización de la chicha de jora o chicha de maíz fermentado; La socia también elabora comidas caseras, la socia desea invertir su crédito en la compra de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, también en la compra de arroz, azúcar al por mayor. La socia solicita el pre4stamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores para la venta y de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas típicas caseras.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”. The communal bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Ines.  She is 31 years old and is in a live-in relationship; she has two children aged 9 and 3.  Ines works raising small animals, specifically guinea pigs and farmyard poultry.  She also makes chicha (a local drink) from a corn base.  Ines has land where she grows and harvests yellow corn for making chicha de jora or chicha made from fermented corn.  She also makes homemade meals.

Ines wants to invest her loan in purchasing small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She also wants to use it to purchase rice and sugar at wholesale.  Ines is requesting the loan to purchase small animals for sale, and ingredients for making her typical homemade meals.

Ines is grateful for the loan, and commits to comply with her loan repayment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of small animals for sale, and ingredients for preparing her typical homemade meals.

loans.name: Erick Crisantos

texts.es: En la comarca Wiscaral localizada en las afueras de Estelí, zona conocida por sus suelos fértiles para siembra, vive Erick, de 33 años , un joven agricultor de hortalizas, casado, padre de tres hijos de 13,9 años respectivamente y el ultimo un bebe de tres meses. El empezó en este negocio desde, muy joven cuando termino su secundaria. Empezó sembrando hortalizas en las tierras de su padre, después aprendió a lidiar con el ganado, ordeñar vacas, ayudarlas a parir y criar terneros  actividades propias del campo, su familia ha sido su principal apoyo ya que son muy unidos y trabajan como un solo equipo según nos cuenta Erick. El realizo el préstamo para comprar 4 novillos para vender y reproducir. Ya que podrá reproducir un ganado de mejor calidad, porque posee buenos pastos pero no tiene muchos animales para reproducir, así que el préstamo la ayudara mucho a poder aprovechar al máximo los recursos. Su próxima meta es mejorar la raza del ganado , mejorar las condiciones de la finca.
texts.en: Erick lives in the region of Wiscaral located on the outskirts of Esteli, an area known for its fertile planting land.
