Ella quiere construir mejor su casa por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, empaste, bloques y asi asegurar su vivienda. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante bien definido.
texts.en:
Mercy, age 43, manages a small restaurant where she serves lunches to an established clientele of workers. She lives in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area outside of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem.

Mercy has always enjoyed cooking, so she chose this line of work to support her children. She wakes up in the morning to prepare lunches in her home so that she can deliver them. Mercy prepares various dishes in her kitchen and then sells them at her restaurant. She also delivers lunches to different customers. Each meal consists of soup, an entrée, and juice for $1.50. She has a list of customers for whom she delivers lunches to their workplace.

Mercy wants to make improvements to her house, so she will use this loan to buy cement, mortar, and blocks to make her home secure. In the future she hopes to have a well-defined restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for making home improvements

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 39 años, convive con Andrés, de 46 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Marisela, de 13 y Cairo, de 11 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca, Cuenta alegre, que se siente desarrollada ayudando a su esposo, en los gasto del hogar; pues desde que era niña, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo y como tradición familiar, ella nunca se alejo de ello, Hace 4 años que heredó un terreno agrícola, donde siembra papa, arveja y lechuga, los que después de cada cosecha lo comercializa a los intermediarios que visitan sus terrenos agrícolas constantemente. Pero a Gloria hace 3 años, se le ocurrió una idea. Comprar flores al por mayor y llevarlos a la capital, ya que el mercado ahí es muy bueno y las ganancias son mayores. Ahora ella, viaja una vez por semana, y como le va muy bien está pensando ahorrar para comprarse un camión, con el que pueda trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como socia de su banco comunal, está orgullosa de sus integrantes, ya que son mujeres responsables y luchadoras. Ya tiene pensado destinar el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arveja, y el resto del dinero invertirá en la compra de gladíolos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner Andrés who is 46 years old.  The couple have 4 children but only live with 2 of them: 13 year-old Marisela and 11 year-old Cairo.  The family lives in their own home in the town of Palca.  Gloria happily tells us that she feels satisfied helping her husband to cover their household expenses since when she was a little girl her parents taught her how to farm and, as it is a family tradition, she never stopped.

Four years ago Gloria inherited a plot of farmland where she grows potatoes, peas and lettuces which she sells after each harvest to the middlemen who constantly visit her land.  However, 3 years ago Gloria had an idea.  She decided to start buying flowers wholesale and take them to the capital since the market there is a good one and the profits are better.  Now she travels there once a week and as her new business is doing very well she is thinking of buying a truck which would enable her to travel more easily.

This is Gloria's third loan with MFP and, as a member of her community bank, she is proud of the bank's members who are responsible and determined women.  She will use her loan to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and will invest the rest of the money in buying gladioli wholesale.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of pea seeds and to buy gladioli wholesale

loans.name: Ruzikhol

texts.en:
T. Ruzikhol is 41 years old. She is married,  the mother of 6 children and lives with her husband in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She and her husband, together, put all their effort toward working very hard on their farm, growing wheat, onion and a variety of fresh vegetables. Early every morning, the couple’s children collect the produce and sell it at a market. 

Ruzikhol is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for their farm. You are the one who will determine their success and play an important role in their business’s growth. Ruzikhol has gained a reputation for responsibility with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Merys María

texts.es: La señora Merys María M. Velásquez tiene 50 años y vive con su marido en el barrio El Prado del municipio de Soledad, al norte de Colombia. Tiene tres hijos de 30. 25 y  23 años de su primer matrimonio, pero  viven aparte. Ella posee una panadería en la que produce pan, galletas y pudines; además vende cervezas, gaseosas y jugos. El negocio está ubicado en una esquina cerca a la terminal de transporte interdepartamental de Barranquilla y en ese sector trafican muchas personas, sin embargo, la mayor parte de las ventas las realiza en varias tiendas de barrios cercanos. La microempresaria contrató los servicios de un joven que le ayuda a atender el negocio y hacer los repartos. Ella es quien elabora los panes y demás productos. Este oficio lo aprendió en el año 2003, en Barranquilla, después de llegar desplazada por la violencia de grupos armados ilegales de extrema derecha en el municipio de San Pablo, al sur del departamento de Bolívar. La casa en la que vive la señora Merys es propia, ella recibió un subsidio de vivienda del gobierno nacional.  Este es el crédito número 16 que tramita en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de harina, levadura, queso, huevos, azúcar, grasas y esencias. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 100.000, el margen de utilidad es del 40%. En un futuro cercano, la microempresaria planea comprar un enfriador más grande, remodelar su vivienda para acondicionar mejor el local del negocio y abrir un nuevo punto de venta en el centro de Barranquilla. Ella dice que todo lo que se ha propuesto en la vida lo ha logrado, porque en su opinión, a las personas no les faltan fuerzas sino voluntad.
texts.en:
Merys María M. Velásquez is 50 years old and lives with her husband in El Prado neighborhood, in the town of Soledad, in the north of Colombia.  She has three children aged 30, 25 and 23 from her first marriage but they no longer live with her.

Merys has a bakery in which she makes bread, cookies and pies.  She also sells beer, soda and juice.  Her business is located on a corner near the inter-departmental transport terminal in Barranquilla and there are a lot of people in this area.  However, most of her sales are made to stores in nearby neighborhoods.

This small businesswoman has hired a young man who helps her in her business and takes care of her deliveries.  Merys makes the bread and other products herself.  She learned this trade in 2003, in Barranquilla.  She arrived there after having been displaced by the violence of illegal, armed, far-right groups in the town of San Pablo, in the south of Bolívar department.

Merys lives in her own home.  She received a housing subsidy from the national government.

This is Merys' 16th loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying flour, yeast, cheese, eggs, sugar, fats and spices.  Her average daily sales are 100,000 pesos and her profit margin is 40%.  In the near future, she plans to buy a larger chiller cabinet and remodel her home so that she has a better set up for her business premises.  She also plans to open a new sales location in the center of Barranquilla.  She says that so far she has managed to achieve everything that she has set out to achieve in life because, in her opinion, people don't lack strength, just willpower.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, cheese, eggs, sugar, fats and spices

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sylvia has a drug store business, which she has run for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase medicine. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to become a teacher. Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her how to play netball.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for resale

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
Coiffeuse de  carrière depuis 15ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2enfants. Après son échec au brevet d’études secondaire, elle a préférer apprendre la coiffure pour éviter  l’oisiveté.
Avant de connaître  notre organisme, elle effectuait déjà des petites épargnes en faisant des ristournes et les cartes de pointages. Le premier prêt, lui a apprit beaucoup en gestion et épargnes. Elle procède à faire des prix promotionnels pour attirer ses clientes.

Ses revenus journaliers étaient de 10.000f avant le premier prêt, maintenant avec sa politique de rabais de tarif coiffure, pédicure , et manucure, elle a augmentée ses revenus jusqu'à  30000f 

Au prochain prêt, elle veut améliorer ses conditions de travail, car elle veut ajouter un casque pour les bains d’huile et une gamme complet de soins capillaires.
Très ambitieuse, Blandine compte faire l’extension de son salon en recrutant des filles mères pour leurs épanouissements.

Ses enfants sont en bas âges et mérite une attention particulière, elle se bat pour leurs donner une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
With a 15-year career as a hairdresser, Blandine is a married woman and the mother of two children. After failing to earn her middle school diploma, she favored learning how to style hair, so as to be active in life.  Before becoming familiar with our organization, she had already saved some money through the use of rebates and point cards.  The first loan taught her a lot about managing and saving money.  She continued on with promotional pricing to attract customers.  Her daily revenues amounted to 10,000 francs before her first loan.  And now, with her policy of discounts on the price of a haircuts, pedicures, and manicure, she has increased her revenues to 30,000 francs.  

For the next loan, Blandine wants to improve her work situation.  She wants to add headgear for providing oil treatments and a complete range of hair care.  A very ambition woman, she plans on expanding her salon by recruiting young mothers and developing them.  

Blandine's children are young and deserve special attention.  She struggles to given them a good education.

loans.use: Buying cosmetics and hair care products

loans.name: Sabah

texts.ar: صباح في عمر 55 سنة متزوجة ولها 3 اولاد تعمل في محل لبيع الخضار والمواد لغذائية لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب عملها وتريد له التجدد والتطور كي تتمكن من مساندة عائلتها في دعم نفسها وتعليم اولادها لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها لكن تنقصها المادة حتى تزيد من مدخول محلها لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض بزيادة البضائع وكانت تلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة خضار ومواد غذائية لدعم المحل
texts.en: Sabah is 55 years old and married with 3 children. She has been working for the past ten years at a grocery shop which serves her neighborhood and local community. She very much loves her work and is driven to further develop it so that she can support herself and her family. Sabah’s last loan helped her procure more merchandise, and she wanted to seek another one from Al Majmoua to purchase more foodstuffs to sell at her store.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Karol

texts.es:
Karol Leitón M. 
2011-54

Monto del crédito 300,000 colones

Karol L. M. tiene 25 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos, uno está ya en la escuela, en segundo año y el menor es de 2 años, vive con su compañero en el barrio San Luis , esto es en la zona de Puntarenas, Costa Rica. Desde hace mas de 8 años se dedica al comercio y este es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fundación Mujer. 

Ella ha mantenido una excelente conducta de pago y ha utilizado  los créditos, y este no va a ser la excepción, en la compra de mercadería: Blusas, camisas, ropa interior, perfumes, entre otros.

La clienta dedica las mañanas a la atención de su familia, envía a su hijo mayor a la escuela, y le prepara la comida a su compañero, quien se va para el trabajo, ella realiza los oficios domésticos y las  tardes las dedica a la atención de su negocio, ya sea comprando mercadería, entregado de mercadería y cobro; estas labores las realiza en su comunidad lo que le facilita el desplazamiento, solamente cuando tiene que comprar mercadería va a la ciudad de Puntarenas.

El crédito le va a permitir atender a sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos de su actividad, al aumentar su capital de trabajo.

Su principal sueño es contar con su propio bazar en la comunidad y dejar las ventas ambulantes, además que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y continuar con el negocio, que es un apoyo económico importante para la familia.
texts.en:
Karol Leitón M. 
2011-54
Loan Amount:  300,000 colones

Karol Leitón M., 25, is the mother of two children; one is already in school, in second grade, and the youngest is two years old.  She lives with her life partner in the San Luis neighborhood which is in the Puntarenas zone of Costa Rica.  She has been a merchant for over 8 years and this is the third loan request from Fundación Mujer.  She has maintained excellent payment behavior and has used the loans; this one will be no exception, to buy merchandise: blouses, shirts, underwear and perfumes, among others.

She dedicates mornings to her family.  She sends her oldest child to school and prepares her partner’s meal who then goes to work.  She does the domestic chores and during the afternoon she tends to her business be it buying merchandise or delivering goods or collecting payments.  These tasks take place in her community which facilitates her getting around.  It’s only when she has to buy merchandise that she travels to the city of Puntarenas.

The loan will make it possible for her to tend to her customers and improve her income by increasing her working capital.

Her main dream is to have her own store in the community to stop doing door to door sales; also that her children have a good education and to stay in business, which is an important economic help for the family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: clothing for men, women and children and perfumes.

loans.name: Wilmer Rolando

texts.es:
el señor Wilmer Rolando B. F. esta soltero y vive en el municipio de Pespire.
Wilmer se dedica a la reparacion de motocicletas en su taller ubicado en la carretera panamericana.
Wilmer atiende su negocio desde hace aproximadamente 2 años y es muy visitado por las personas que viven en este lugar.
el señor wilmer es muy conocido en esta zona por su buen desempeño en la reparacion de motocicletas. .
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos y algunas herramientas para su taller, de esta manera cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
el señor Wilmer tiene como anhelo instalar otro taller de motos en la ciudad de Nacaome para poder expandirse y asi obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilmer Rolando B. F. is single and he lives in the village of Pespire.
Wilmer engages in repairing motorbikes in his garage located along the Pan-American highway.
Wilmer has been running this activity for about 2 years and his garage is attended by many people of this area.
Wilmer is well known in this area for his good skills in repairing motorbikes.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy spare parts and some tools for his garage, in order to be able to satisfy the needs of all of his customers.
Wilmer wishes to open a second motorbikes repair shop in the town of Nacaome, in order to expand his activity and earn more money.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and some tools for his motorbikes repair shop.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old and married, with four adult-aged children. To make a living, Geronima raises crops.

Geronima has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Geronima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer.

Geronima is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Taj's Group

texts.en:
Taj lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of Rasheed Park with her family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who runs a small restaurant in the community. In the restaurant, he sells Punjabi food items such as "Nan chanay" (made with chick peas and served with bread) and "Biryani" (made with rice and chicken served with pickles) to his customers. He is well-known among his customers for his good quality and taste.  Using the loan, he will purchase chick peas, rice, cooking oil and spices, etc. to make good quality food to sell to his customers at a profit. 
 
Taj and her husband G. S. both are very supportive persons. They both support their son in his business. S. supports him by handling his customers in the restaurant and Taj helps him by making food for his restaurant.  

Taj is confident that the loan investment will bring better profits to her son’s business and he will be able to increase his clientele. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Taj.

loans.use: To buy required items such as chick peas, rice, cooking oil and spices for restaurant.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Mary has a business of selling and making a local brew. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Mary sells her products from home. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more millet flour, cassava flour and maize bran. 

She also generates additional income through plaiting ladies hair. The main business challenges for Mary include thieves and seasonality. Her goal for her business is to start selling at wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land. Mary lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and  piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of millet flour, maize bran and cassava flour

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy R. L. is a 20-year-old married lady. She and her husband have one child, aged 5, whom they wish to give a good education to the university level. 

Her business is located at a busy shopping center known as Kambi in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area well known for production of sugar cane and it is commonly referred to as the sugar belt region. 

Mercy owns a poultry farm where she rears broilers for meat and eggs that she then sells to the local people. She has been running this business for the last year and has managed to give employment to one person.

She says this business is profitable but the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well.

She is using this loan of KES 60,000 to buy more poultry to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. Mercy hopes to be a millionaire in the future. She describes herself as a self-reliant lady.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Azam

texts.en:
Azam is a 47 year old man. He is married and he has four children. Azam is engaged in a farming business and for 20 years he has been running this business. Azam cultivates agricultural products such as wheat, barley, and watermelons. His wife and son help him to process land and sow seeds. The he keeps part of his crop for his family and the rest he sells at the market. Azam would like to get a loan of 10,000 TJS for purchasing fertilizers and fuel and lubricating materials in order to make a good profit and provide for his family’s needs. 
    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fuel, and lubricating materials for his farming business.

loans.name: Baraka Office Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bauma représentante du groupe d’affaire « Baraka office »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 42 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants, tous étudient. Son mari est un activiste de droits de l’homme dans la ville de Goma au sein d’une organisation non gouvernementale. Elle est vendeuse de pommes de terre, bananes, huile raffiné, huile de palme, etc., au petit  marché sectoriel de l’office.  Il ya 7 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  16 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  4 sacs de pommes de terre, 5 régimes de bananes, 2 bidons d’huile Rina, 1fus d’huile de palme, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison étant donné qu’elle est encore locataire.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Baraka Office» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The client named Bauma, the representative of the business group called « Baraka Office », is an entrepreneur of 42, married and the mother of four children, all enrolled in school. Her husband is a human rights activist in the town of Goma, working for an NGO. Bauma sells pototoes, bananas, refined oil, palm oil, and so on at the the Office's small sector market. She has been in this work for a full seven years, but she has just finished repaying her 16th loan with Hekima. 

This new loan will allow her to buy four sacks of potatoes, five stalks of bananas, two jerrycans of Rina oil, and one barrel of palm oil, etc. Morever, she would like to pay her children's school fees and build a house, since she is presently renting. This client thanks Hekima for working on behalf of poor women who are excluded from conventional banks. Please note that the business group «  Baraka Office» is made up mainly of women.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of potatoes, five stalks of bananas, two jerrycans of Rina oil, and one barrel of palm oil, etc.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus hijos Wilfredo y Rosa, el primero que trabaja como cobrador D. bus y esto ayuda a la economía del hogar y Rosa quien por ser menor D. edad sólo estudia. Ana ha crecido a sus hijos desD. hace mas D. 10 años a puro esfuerzo D. la venta D. Tamales D. Elote. DesD. muy temprano sale a comprar los elotes tiernos que son necesarios para que su tamal cuente con el gusto que a sus clientes les agrada, al regresar D. comprarlo lo prepara para llevarlo al molino y estando lista esta etapa cocina con mantequilla la masa y la sazona procurando que sus tamales estén listos antes D. las 2 pm, a la vez realiza las demás actividades hogareñas que demanda su casa. Al tenerlos listos a las 2 D. la tarD. lleva sus ricos tamales cargándolos en su cabeza a vender al mercado regional cercano a donD. vive, ahí es muy conocida Ana por vender los pupulararmente conocidos como “tamales charitos”. Ana ahora desea comprar mayor cantidad D. elote, mantequilla y leña para hacer sus tamales dado que entrando a la época D. invierno son mas solicitados, espera que con el crédito que INTEGRAL le otorgue poder realizar sus ideas y esto haga que obtenga mayor cantidad D. ganancias que al final beneficien a su familia.-
texts.en: Ana Julia is a single mother and lives alongsiD. her children, Wilfredo and Rosa, the first of whom works as a bus conductor and this helps with the home expenses and Rosa, who still being young, only studies. Ana has raised her children for more than ten years through the pure effort of selling corn tamales. Starting early, she leaves to buy tender corn that is necessary for her tamales to taste as her customers like. Upon returning from buying them, she prepares them to bring them to the mill and being ready, at this stage she cooks the dough with butter and seasons them making sure her tamales are ready before 2PM. At that time, she does the rest of the home chores that her house demands. Upon having them ready at 2 in the afternoon, she takes her delicious tamales, carrying them on her head, to sell in the regional market, near where she lives. There Ana is well-known for selling them popularly known as "tamales charitos". Ana now wishes to buy a greater quantity of corn, butter and firewood to make her tamales since during the winter season there are more orders. She hopes that with the loan that INTEGRAL gives her, she can accomplish her ideas and therefore obtain more income which will ultimately benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of corn, butter and firewood to make her tamales.

loans.name: Valdemira

texts.pt:
Natural do distrito de Zavala provincia de Inhambane, não concluiu o ensino primário . Tem 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 9  a 13 anos de idade sendo o mais novo o unico rapaz. Saiu de Zavala com marido e vieram a ponta de a procura de  emprego nesta zona turistica.
Actualmente vive e trabalha  na nesta zona zona e recebe salário mensal com o qual alimenta a sua familia e poupa um pouco no Banco comercial (BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-adsema apartir de conversas com seus amigos e vizinhos e decide aproximar para obter mais esclarecimento sobre as condicoes de acesso ao credito e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
É cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema ha mais de 6 . Teve como seu primeiro financiamento no valor de 6.000,mts para fabrico de  blocos para sua obra;  no segundo foi no valor de 7.000,00mts tambem foi para compra de cimento; no terceiro emprestimo foi para compra de pedra no valor de 6.000,00mts; no quarto emprėstimo no valor de 7.000,00mts foi para compra de cimento para iniciar com o levantamento das paredes da sua casa e no quinto emprėstimo de 7.000,00mts foi para compra de arros para janelas .
Com o presente emprėstimo de 20.000,00mts pretende pintar a sua casa e dar inicio a uma nova construção na ciadade de Maputo.
texts.en:
Valdemira is from the Zavala region in Inhambane province. She didn't finish 8th grade. She has three children between the ages of 9 and 13; the youngest is her only son. She and her husband left Zavala and came to Ponta, which has a lot of  tourism, to find work.
Currently she lives and works in this area and earns a monthly salary that she uses to feed her family. She is able to set some aside in the bank each month.
She heard about Hluvuku-Adesma through conversations with her friends and neighbors and decided to approach the organization to find out more about how to apply for loans and take advantage of Hluvuku financing to carry out her projects.
She has received more than 6 loans from Hluvuku-Adsema. She used her first loan, in the amount of 6000 meticals, to make building blocks for her construction project; the second, for 7000 meticals, she used to buy cement; the third, for 6000 meticals, she used to buy stone; the fourth, for 7000 meticals, she used to buy cement to erect the walls of her house; and the fifth loan, in the amount of 7000 meticals, she used to buy bars for the windows.
She plans to use this loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, to paint her house and begin building another structure in the city of Maputo.

loans.use: to buy supplies to paint her house.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 44 años de edad, el es casado, y tiene 03 hijos. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en un caserío llamado Colera en el distrito de Tambogrande, esta es una zona rural del distrito. Y aun no cuenta con servicio básicos.

Elmer se dedica desde hace más de 3 años a la compra de ganado ovino. El los cría y engorda para sus posterior comercialización cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y eventualmente a los vecinos y pobladores del distrito. Elmer posee un terreno agrícola donde ha sembrado mango y limón, Con estos ingresos que el obtiene de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

El desea comprar animales para engorde y alimentarlos con productos balanceados y  poder así mejorar el desarrollo de sus animales y venderlos a mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Elmer es una persona trabajadora, activa y bastante responsable adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran alguien tranquilo y confiable.
texts.en:
Elmer is 44 years old, married and has 3 children.  He lives in his own house located in a hamlet called Colera in Tambogrande District; it’s a rural part of the district and still does not have any basic utilities.

For over three years Elmer has been buying sheep.  He raises them and fattens them up to resell later when they reach a good level of development and he offers them to area merchants and sometimes to neighbors and local residents.  Elmer also has a piece of farmland where he grows mangoes and lemons.  Income earned from these activities is used to support his family.

He wants to buy animals to raise and to feed them with nutritionally balanced feed so that his animals will develop better and can be sold at higher prices.  Because of this, he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

Elmer is a hard working, active and quite responsible person who is also engaged in farming.  People who know him consider him to be levelheaded and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosibel Estela

texts.es:
Rosibel, es madre soltera de dos niños, vive con su madre y se dedica a la venta de empanadas, tiene 7 años de estar en el negocio, las prepara desde temprano y las vende todos los días de la semana.
Ella quiere invertir un préstamo en plátanos, azúcar y leche, pues estos son los materiales para preparar las empanadas, con esta compra estará preparada para poder continuar con su venta y generar ganancias para su familia.
Su aspiración es poder comprar una vivienda, para vivir con su familia, además de que su negocio sea rentable para ofrecer a sus hijos una vida digna.
texts.en:
Rosibel is a single mother of two who lives with her mother and has a business selling empanadas.  She has had this business for 7 years.  She prepares the tortillas in the early morning, and sells them every day of the week.

Rosibel wants to invest the loan proceeds in the purchase of bananas, sugar and milk, because these are supplies she needs to make empanadas.  With this purchase, she will be able to continue with her sales and generate earnings for her family.

Rosibel aspires to be able to buy a house where she could live with her family.  She also aims to keep her business profitable so that she can offer her children a decent life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sugar and milk to make empanadas

loans.name: Butungisa Bakyara Twimukye- Group

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of five and an agriculturalist in Ntungamo district in the western part of Uganda. 

This 37-year-old lady earns about 15,000 Uganda shillings as profits per week from her agriculture activity and pays school fees for 4 of her 5 children who are in school.

Her children are between the ages of 1 and 15. She says they are very helpful for her activity, especially during the holidays.  She has been in this business for 6 years.

She is an agriculturalist who profoundly values education and it's from this basis that she has a dream of educating all her children up to the very high institutions of learning.

Mary intends to use her Kiva loan for paying fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay fees for her children.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is married and her husband is a driver by profession. She is the mother of a son who is 23 years old. He operates a donkey cart through which he offers loading and unloading services to his clients. Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart because his current cart has become rough and can’t bear heavy loads. Shameem is hopeful that by purchasing a new donkey cart, her son will be able to improve his business by providing better quality loading services to his customers. He has been operating his business for many years and Shameem is very hopeful about his business growth after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 25 years old with two children. Neither of her children is in school. She is married to a businessman. She has a business selling beans and soft drinks like mango juice in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. 

Beatrice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan for building a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans and soft drink like mango juice to sell

loans.name: Midonougbo Group

texts.fr: MIDONOUGBO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même localité au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer leur activité. La représentante du groupe, Célestine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un mécanographe du nom de Grégoire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Célestine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Célestine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix ans que Célestine vend des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures et des trousseaux de façon secondaire. Célestine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Célestine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Célestine sollicite un crédit avec les membres du groupe MIDONOUGBO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Midonougbo is a group of three people who live near one another in Benin. This is the first time this group is seeking a loan from Alidé in order to strengthen their business.

The group's representative, Célestine (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 45 years old and is married to an equipment operator by the name of Grégoire. The couple has four children, all of them under their care and in school. Célestine and her husband live together with their children. Célestine did not attend school.

Célestine has been selling cosmetic products, as well as secondhand shoes and clothing for nearly ten years. She is passionate about her business, which allows her to meet the needs of her family and her children. Célestine purchases her supplies in Benin. In her desire to satisfy her clients, Célestine is seeking a loan with the members of the Midonougbo group. This loan will allow them to better respond to customer demand and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic proucts.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 46 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.
Winnie runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more items to sell in her variety store. Winnie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 
Winnie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 33 year old single woman.  She has an eight year old child.  Mary describes herself as God fearing and honest. 

She operates a charcoal sales business and also sells cereal.  She has been involved in this business for 6 years, located near a residential area in Mombasa.  Mary says her biggest business challenge is the fluctuation of commodity prices. 

Mary will use the Kes 50,000 loan to increase her stock of charcoal.  Her business goal is to create a wholesale operation within 5 years.  She hopes to buy a plot of land where she can run her business.

loans.use: to increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña Francisca tiene  44 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales nada mas uno vive con ellos el cual estudia el preparatoria. Ella se dedica principalmente al cultivo de aguacates dice que aproximadamente tiene unos 200 árboles y también cultiva flor de cempasúchil ya que en la temporada de día de muertos es cuando tiene ventas altas. Ella platica que cultiva de todo un poco como frijol, maíz, avena, trigo, calabaza etc. dice que desde muy joven su familia le enseño al cultivo de diferentes plantas, ella está muy contenta por los créditos que le ha hecho la financiera por que poco a poco está haciendo realidad su sueño que es el tener una huerta propia y el ver que sus árboles están dando fruto esa es su satisfacción, dice que con el crédito ella comprara mas platas de aguacate y fertilizantes y abonos orgánicos para que ayuden a sus árboles a dar fruto de mejor calidad. Francisca sale a vender a la central de abastos de una población cercana a su localidad.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is 44 years old, married, and has three children. Only one child lives with her and attends preparatory school. Francisca spends most of her time growing avocados. She says that she has approximately 200 trees, but she also grows marigold flowers for the Day of the Dead since she experiences high sales during that holiday. In addition, Francisca mentions that she grows small amounts of beans, corn, oats, wheat, squash, and other crops. As a young girl, her family taught her how to grow different types of plants.

She is very pleased with the loans she has received because they have helped her to gradually fulfill her dream of having her own orchard. In order for her trees to bear fruit that is to her liking, Francisca says that she will buy more avocado plants, fertilizers, and organic compost. These supplies will help produce fruit of better quality. Francisca sells at the central supply depot in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy avocado plants, fertilizers, and organic compost.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, 4 of whom attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Justine sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last year. Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Justine's goals and hopes are to own a truck for transporting green bananas from the villages of Masaka and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in Uganda. For the past year, Caroline has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells stationery items. 

To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pens and paper, and will help Caroline to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Caroline hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house, and to get a driver's license. 

Caroline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Caroline's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save and to manage money.

loans.use: to purchase more pens and paper

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lorna has a shop that makes and sells home made sausages or longganisa. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy raw ingredients for making home made sausages.

Lorna  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home made sausages.
